loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam: Es una mujer sociable y luchadora, casada. Desde hace 19 años habita en una vivienda de tambo de madera, con 6 personas. Solicita financiamiento para cambiar la madera y comprar poste y clavos. Su sueño es establecer una pulpería.
texts.en: Miriam is a sociable woman and a fighter, and is married. She has lived in a For 19 years lives in a wooden dairy farm with 6 people. She is requesting a loan to change the wood and to buy nails and posts. Her dream is to establish a grocery store.

loans.use: to replace the wood in her home and buy nails and posts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement and bricks for building a corral for her animals.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is married to Christine and blessed with one child who is four years old. For the past six years he has been running a pharmacy; he also owns rental houses as a secondary business. He earns a monthly income of KES.20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).

John has applied for his first loan of 50,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya to buy more stocks of assorted medicines, cement and iron sheets. He will use the anticipated profits to provide for his family's basic needs.

John hopes to grow his business and create employment opportunities for the youth in his community.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of assorted medicines, cement and iron sheets

loans.name: Yolibeth Xoliyeth

texts.es: Yolibeth: Es una joven emprendedora de 26 años de edad, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, casada, tiene 1 hijo menor de edad. Desde hace más de una década habita en una casa de tambo de madera, con el propósito de construir su vivienda de minifalda de concreto y madera, solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar bloques y cementos. Su sueño es terminar construir su vivienda y establecer una pulpería.
texts.en:
Yolibeth is an enterprising young woman who is 26 years of age. She is originally from Puerto Cabezas. Yolibeth is married and has one dependent child. She has lived in a wooden stilt house for more than a decade. Her goal is to build a “minifalda” house (which is designed to withstand earthquakes) made of concrete and wood.

Yolibeth is requesting her first loan so that she can buy blocks and cement. Her dream is to finish the construction of her house and open a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy blocks and cement for building her house.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.pt:
Tem 48 anos de idade, pai de 6 filhos, 1 maior de idade e os outros ainda a estudar, vive maritalmente na casa própria, depende do negócio, estudou ate 4ª classe do antigo sistema de ensino e é secretário do bairro na zona onde vive, esta a tomar o crédito pela primeira vez.
Pretende comprar produtos como: arroz, açúcar, óleo, vinagre, velas, peixe, etc, para ampliar o seu negocio que faz todos os dias numa banca à berma da estrada.
O seu maior sonho é desenvolver o seu negócio e futuramente adquirir uma viatura que lhe facilite o transporte de sua mercadoria.
Tem como desafio, o fundo que usa que é ainda muito baixo, uma vez que era ainda, apenas próprio e com o credito espera crescer.
texts.en:
[Ana] is 48 years old and has six children, one of whom is an adult and the others of whom are still in school. He and his partner live in their own home. He has a business selling groceries. He went to school through the fourth grade and is a political representative for the neighborhood where he lives.
This is his first loan from Hluvuku. He plans to use it to buy products such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, vinegar, candles, fish, and so on to expand his business, which he runs out of a roadside stall.
His biggest dream is to develop his business further and eventually get a vehicle that will make it easier for him to transport his merchandise.
His biggest challenge is that his income is quite low. He hopes that this loan will help him increase it.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, vinegar, candles, fish, and so on.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fishing nets, canned sardines, corned beef, soy sauce, cooking oil, coffee, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: G.s Dios Con Nosotros Group

texts.es:
La señora Marlenis  se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotería en general, cuenta con 6 años de experiencia, sus principales clientes son las personas que viven en su comunidad y personas que transitan por la calle ya que su negocio está ubicado en la calle principal.
Doña Marlenis necesita el préstamo para comprar azúcar, arroz, jabones, manteca, leche, refrescos, agua, pan, etc. espera que esta inversión le permita salir adelante con su familia y le genere los ingresos necesarios para mejorar su  calidad de vida.
Doña María Alicia su fuente principal de ingresos los obtiene de su negocio, venta de ropa, zapatos, lácteos, nacatamales y pescado tiene 37 años de experiencia.
Doña Olga su fuente principal de ingresos los obtiene de la venta de abarrotería en general, tiene 10 años de experiencia.


Danlí, Honduras – Septiembre 2014
texts.en:
Marlenis works in commerce. Her main occupation is selling groceries in general. She has 6 years of experience. Her main customers are the people who live in her community and the passers-by, because her store is located in the main street.

Doña Marlenis needs the loan to buy sugar, rice, soap, lard, milk, soft-drinks, water, bread, etc. She hopes this investment will allow her and her family to get ahead, and also help her make the necessary income to improve her life.

Dona Maria Alicia gets her main income form her business. She sales clothes, shoes, dairy products, Nicaraguan tamales, and fish. She has accumulated 37 years of experience.

Dona Olga's main income comes from the grocery store, he has 10 years of experience.

Danlí, Honduras - September 2014

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, soap, lard, milk, soft-drinks, water, bread, etc for her business.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a farmer from Mugwe village, in the Chuka area of Kenya. He has a young wife, named Rugendo, with whom they were blessed with four children. 

Robert is able to provide for his family by engaging in mixed farming. He owns a two-acre piece of land where he keeps dairy animals and grows tea, among other crops. He is also involved in other personal businesses that earn him extra shillings. 

For the last 23 years that he has been in business, dairy farming has become deeply ingrained into his system. Robert is constantly looking for ways to grow a business he is so passionate about. 

Robert is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. He already has a name in mind that he is going to name the cow...'Mercy.' Robert is going to make use of the additional money from the new acquisition to repay the loan and to pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Daniel Antonio

texts.es:
Daniel de 29 años de edad, es un joven muy trabajador, ya que busca opciones de trabajo para sacar adelante su familia, actualmente vive en la casa de su suegra con su compañera de vida quien se dedica a los oficios domésticos y su hija de tan solo 5 años de edad.

Daniel actualmente está trabajando con un carretón para vender sorbete en las comunidades cercanas, en los días que no trabaja con el carretón busca otra forma de hacer sus ingresos como del trabajo de jornal, ya que lo buscan también como ayudante para trabajos de soldadura.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar pesticidas y herbicidas para el control de la plaga en su cultivo de frijol. Tiene cultivados 3,500 metros cuadrados de frijol y está sufriendo algunos ataques de plagas, entonces necesita invertir en algunos productos químicos para control de plagas y también fertilizar el cultivo para tener buenos rendimientos.
 
Daniel tiene la idea de poner su tienda en un futuro, para mejorar sus ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Daniel, aged 29, is a young man who works very hard: he is always looking for work opportunities to get his family ahead.

He currently lives at his mother-in-law's house with his life partner, who is a homemaker, and their daughter, who is only five years old.

Currently, Daniel uses a vendor's cart to sell sherbet in the nearby communities. In the days when he is not using the cart, he looks for other ways to earn an income such as working as a day labourer because he is also wanted for his services as a welder assistant.

He is requesting a loan to buy pesticides and herbicides to control pests in his bean crops. He has planted 3,500 square metres of beans, and his crops are being affected by some pest attacks. Thus, he needs to invest in some chemical products for pest control and also to fertilize his fields so that he can have good crop yields.

Daniel plans to open a shop in the future to improve the income for his family.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and herbicides to control pests in his bean crops.

loans.name: Gildo Sarvelio

texts.es:
Gildo de 80 años de edad. Esta casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos. 

Gildo  fue empleado y esta jubilado. Actualmente se dedica a la agricultura. El crédito lo utilizará para la compra de abono, fertilizantes, venenos y arreglo de los cercos. Él planea preparar bien sus tierras para que sus hijos sigan trabajando la tierra y dejarle un buen patrimonio a su familia.
texts.en:
Gildo is 80 years old. He is married and his wife takes care of the household duties.

Gildo was employed, but is now retired. He currently devotes his time to agriculture. This loan will be used to buy compost, fertilizers, poisons, and to repair fences. He plans to prepare the land well so that his children can continue farming. In addition, he will be able to leave a good inheritance for his family.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, poisons, and to pay for fence repairs.

loans.name: Safargul

texts.ru: Сафаргул живет в одном из районов Таджикистана под названием Носири Хусрав. Ей 37 лет. У нее четверо детей. Она замужем, ее муж фермер. Сафаргул 8 лет занимается животноводством. Она выращивает скотин в коровнике. Для данной деятельности у нее имеется все условия. Сафаргул хочет получить кредит и приобрести большое количество телят и бычков. Она надеется стать успешной бизнес woman и добиться признания в этой области.
texts.en:
Safargul lives in a region of Tajikistan called Nosiri Khusrav. She is 37 years old. She is married to a farmer; together they have four children.

For eight years Safargul has raised cattle in a barn. She has everything needed for this business. She wants to take a loan to buy a large number of steers and calves. She hopes to become a successful businesswoman and become known in this business.

loans.use: to buy steers and calves to increase her herd of cattle.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: 45-летняя Замира жительница сельского района Носири Хусрав. Она живет там с четырьмя детьми, которым по 19, 16, 14 и 11 лет. Замира зарабатывает на жизнь путем разведения крупнорогатых скотин у себя при дворе дома. Она начала эту деятельность 2 года назад, чтобы обеспечить семью новым источником дохода. Замире в ведении деятельности помогает семья. В данный момент она хочет расширить свой бизнес, увеличив поголовье скота. Для этой цели она просит кредит для купли одного молодого бычка. Она ожидает поддержки.
texts.en:
45-year-old Zamira lives in the rural village of Nosiri Khusrav. She lives with her four children, who are 19, 16, 14 and 11 years old. 

Zamira earns a living by breeding cattle in her yard. She started this business two years ago to provide her family with a new source of income. Her family helps her run her business. She would now like to increase her herd of cattle, and is asking for a loan to buy a young steer. Zamira awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy one young steer.

loans.name: Mucunku

texts.en:
Mucunku is a smallholder farmer practicing mixed farming on a two-acre farm. His home and farmstead are located in the Chuka area of Kenya. 

On the farm, he has a home where his family stays. His wife, 49 years old, has blessed him with six children that he takes care of, selling milk, eggs, tea, and other crops. Mucunku has also invested in other side-businesses that give him additional income from time to time. 

He has been doing farming for over 20 years. He always strives to grow his business and become more financially independent and stable. He is seeking a loan to purchase an additional dairy cow. 

One more cow on the farm will make a difference in Mucunku's livelihood. For one thing, it will provide him with additional income that will enable him to afford his children's education. Mucunku told our loan officer that the impact of the loan on his family is that it will bring an increase in financial security to his family.

loans.use: to purchase a diary cow.

loans.name: Vianey

texts.en:
Vianey is 44 years old, separated, and mother of three daughters. She takes care of her children and lives in her parent's house in which she has been living her whole life. In her parents home, she operates a beauty salon which she owns.

She has had her beauty salon open for 12 years, and she attends all sort of clients, especially women looking for good look for a special event. 

She is asking for this loan to buy furniture needed for the salon and give a better looking.

With the effort she has put into her work, Vianey has been able to carry out her daughters, and she is looking  forward to keep open and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her beauty salon

loans.name: Juana Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Juana tiene la edad de 59 años, soltera labora como domestica para una casa privada desde hace algunos años.
Esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de Materiales de construcción para la realización completa de la cocina ya que la que tiene no presta las condiciones que requiere en cuanto a aseo e infraestructura, esta al aire libre solo tiene una caseta de zinc para taparse del sol o la lluvia. con la elaboración de su cocina tendrá mejores condiciones y mayor presentación.
Agradece el apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le han brindado con este sexto crédito.
texts.en:
Juana is 59 years old and unmarried. She has worked as a housekeeper in a private home for many years. She is requesting this loan to buy construction materials to complete her kitchen since it does not provided the required cleanliness and structure. Her current kitchen is outdoors and only has a zinc roof to provide cover from the sun or rain. Improving her kitchen will provide better conditions and greater performance.
She is grateful for the support that Kiva and Afodenic have provided her with this sixth loan.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to improve her kitchen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase personal care products for her business

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 27 years old. She is married with one child who is 3 years old and does not yet go to school. She is a veterinarian and has been working for the past 2 years. With the requested loan, Chantal would like to buy more drugs for resale. The profits will be used to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for sale.

loans.name: Happy Ladies Group

texts.en:
Mary is a 55 year old member of the Happy Ladies group.  She lives in Harare. She is widowed with 8 children and 16 grandchildren. In 1974, she got a job as a pre-school teacher in Zambia until she decided to establish her own preschool in Zimbabwe in the year 2000. She has since been using the larger part of her house as the pre-school. 

She has experienced ups and downs in the running of the pre-school as well as in the enrollment numbers and this has been largely due to lack of adequate working capital. She currently has 60 children enrolled. Mary has also managed to help orphans in her society. She has about 20 orphans that she is educating at half the fees.

Mary is looking forward to building a proper structure for the preschool where she will be able to accommodate more children than at present. At the moment she is hiring transport to ferry the children to and from school and she hopes that in the near future she will be in a financial position that allows her to buy a small bus for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy resources for her pre-school.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy: cement, sand, gravel and to pay labor costs for cementing the floor of the home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay healthcare costs.

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Баходур трудолюбивый мужчина. Он женат и воспитывает 3 детей. Баходур является основным кормильцем семьи. Он занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур и скотоводством. Так как его семья большая, его доход не хватает для обеспечения семьи, поэтому он каждый год на несколько месяцев уезжает в Российскую Федерацию на заработки. Баходур выращивает сельхоз культуры более чем 10 лет. Он имеет большой опыт в этой сфере. Баходур должен купить уголь и дров на зиму, так как в сельской местности во время зимы в ограниченном режиме дают электричество. У него старые родители и он должен создать условие теплоты для них. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки уголья и дров. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Bahodur is a hardworking man. He is married and raising three children.  He is his family's main breadwinner and he works in agriculture and animal husbandry.  His income is not sufficient to provide for his large family, which is the reason why he has to travel to Russia every year and work there for a few months.  Bahodur has been working in agriculture for more than ten years, and he has a good deal of experience in this field.  He currently needs to buy coal and firewood for the winter season because in the rural areas, electricity is rationed during that time of year.  Bahodur's parents are getting old, and Bahodur wants to make sure that they stay warm this winter.  He is taking a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy coal and firewood.  He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy coal and wood to keep his house warm during the winter.

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose, age 25, makes her living by fishing. She catches fresh fish and sells them to members of her local community. She has been engaged in this business for five years.

Mary Rose lives with her family in Carles, Iloilo. She and her husband have two children. Their older child is three years old and their younger child is a one year old.

Mary Rose is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 30,000 in order to buy a fishing net, paint, and a pump boat engine. These materials will help her to increase her daily catch and eventually to provide her family with nutritious food. 

In the future, Mary Rose would like to expand her fishing business enough to support the needs of her growing children, including quality education.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, paint, and a pump boat engine

loans.name: Betty Soe

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Virgen De Monserrate Del Pollo.
En este lugar vive la señora Betty, tiene 58 años de edad, está divorciada y de esta relación tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven con ella.
Doña Betty es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para  así salir adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos, colchones, almohadas entre otras cosas, su forma de venta es por pedidos los mismos que sus clientes le realizan por anticipado, trabaja cinco días en la semana enseñando sus productos en una revista para que sus clientes decidan y realicen los pedidos, una vez que tiene algunos clientes ella envía los pedidos a una distribuidora, luego que recibe los entrega a sus clientes, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada 15 días.
Este crédito es para comprar colchones y electrodomésticos ya que tiene algunos encargos. Lleva un año en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos sin tantos requisitos. Sus sueños son tener un local propio y seguir incrementando su negocio.
texts.en:
The city of Portoviejo, capital of  Manabí Province has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees, and is also where the Virgen De Monserrate Del Pollo Credit Group meets twice a month. The group includes 58-year-old Señora Betty, a divorced mother of three adult children, two of whom still live with her. 

Doña Betty has always enjoyed working so that she can improve her life. She sells electronic household appliances, mattresses, pillows, and other household items, taking advance orders from her customers. Doña Betty works five days a week, and advertises her products in a catalog that customers can use to identify what they want and order it. Doña Betty submits orders to a distributor in small batches, then delivers products to customers when she receives them from the distributor. Her customers buy on credit and pay after 15 days.  

Doña Betty will use the funds from this loan to purchase mattresses and electronic household appliances as she has several orders. She aspires to set up her own shop and keep growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase mattresses and electric household appliances.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to stock her fruit business.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is a 37-year-old woman who is married to David, and they are blessed with three children. David adds additional income to support their children's welfare. Magdaline has been practicing farming for a period of four years earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Magdaline was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES 30,000 and intends to use this amount to purchase fertilizers, seedlings and manure.

Magdaline plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seedlings and manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle taxi for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for his banana plants

loans.name: Alexi Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Virgen De Monserrate Del Pollo.
En este lugar vive la señora Alexi, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 3 hijos de 20, 17 y 5 años de edad, estudian en universidad, colegio y escuela. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Alexi es una gran ama de casa y buena esposa que realiza los créditos para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica a la cría de gallinas criollas,  tiene muchas gallinas las mismas que las mantiene por espacio de tres meses tiempo adecuado para que tengan un buen crecimiento para luego entregarlos  a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa, ella también les vende a los vecinos y personas de la localidad, con esto ella se gana lo suyo lo cual invierte en los estudios de sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar alimento y medicinas  para que las gallinas tengan un buen desarrollo. Lleva más de 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The city of Portoviejo, which is the capital of Manabí, has been known for many years as the city of the tamarinds.  Every 15 days the group called "Virgen De Monserrate Del Pollo" meets.

This is where Alexi lives. She is 42 years old, she is married, and she has three children that are 20, 17, and 5 years old. They study at the university, high school, and elementary school. Her husband is a chauffeur. 

Alexi is the soul of the household and a great wife. She helps her husband secure loans and she also helps pay the household expenses. She raises chickens. She has as many chickens as she can keep for three months’ time so that they get nice and big and then she sells them to the merchants that come to her home.  She also sells them to her neighbors and other people that live in the area.  The money she earns she invests in her children's educations.

This loan is so that she can buy food and medicine for the chickens, so that the chickens develop properly. She has been a member of the group for more than 3 years and she likes the group because the loans are easy to obtain.  She dreams that her children will someday become professionals.

loans.use: to buy food and medicine for her chickens.

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en:
Suzan is a hardworking woman living in Masindi, Uganda. She runs a beauty salon so as to earn a living. She is married with three children and all are able to attend school.

Suzan desires to expand her salon so as to increase her income but competition is affecting her. Suzan needs a loan to buy cosmetics and salon items to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and salon items to sell

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Los Hombres forman parte importante en el fortalecimiento de un país para su desarrollo. Futuros profesionales en los diversos campos laborales de la vida y de nuestro país, Manuel tiene 33 años de edad y es soltero el se a propuesto sacar su familia adelante en el sistema económica el tiene 5 hijos, 3 de ellos son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela que les queda cerca de su comunidad y los otros 2 de ellos le ayudan a Manuel en los cultivos.

La actividad que el dignamente realiza es la agricultura campo que le ha venido abriendo puertas para nuevas oportunidades en la vida par poder llegar a ser alguien mejor en un futuro y por medio de lo que realiza el puede tener un ingreso económico para el sustento diario de su familia, los ingresos la obtiene con la siembra de papas que lo realiza en su comunidad, el eligió esta actividad porque hay pocas personas que se dedican a dicha actividad y por lo tanto es muy rentable, la segunda actividad que el   realiza es  de jornalero.

El uso respectivo que dará al préstamo que está solicitando es para la compra de semillas de papas y fertilizantes para sembrarlas y así obtener mejores ingresos económicos, los sueños de Manuel es la ampliación de su siembra de papas para que le generen más ingresos económicos para el y su familia.
texts.en:
Men are an important part in strengthening a country's development. Future professional in the various farming labors and in our country, Manuel is 33 years old, single, and has plans to support his 5 children. 3 of his children are excellent students in the nearby community school and the other 2 help Manuel with the crops. Manuel is a proud farmer who has had many doors open to him to be able to be a better person in the future and be able to have a regular source of income to support his family.

His income comes from growing potatoes. He chose this activity because there are few people that do this so it is very profitable. The second source of income he has is working as a day laborer.

He will use the loan to buy seed potatoes and fertilizer to grow his plants and in this way obtain greater income. Manuel dreams of expanding his potato crops so that he can generate even more income for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and fertilizer.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar lives with his wife and two school-age children. He is involved in distribution and sales of soft drinks. He purchases the stock of drinks from a wholesale market and distributes it to local stores.

The requested loan is very important for Edgar to purchase new stock of water, juices and soft drinks to distribute and to cover his orders from stores. 

He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of water, juices and soft drinks for distributing and selling at local stores

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita lives in San Martin, Puebla with her son. Anita is a widow and has been working selling catalog cosmetics since his husband passed away.  Anita and her late husband bought a piece of land and started building their house little by little. The last thing they started to build was the kitchen and remains unfinished. Anita makes around $800 USD a month but her income is not guaranteed. Therefore,  access to credit is almost impossible. For the last three months she has been saving to finish building the kitchen with a proper roof  to protect the stove that they bought after saving for quite some time. Anita needs this loan to finish the payment for the construction materials.  Her son will help with the construction, and they will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction. The new construction will be the the home she dreamed with her husband. Anita is aware that dedication and hard work is what makes dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish building her kitchen.

loans.name: Yryskan

texts.ru: Ырыскан, 36 лет, замужем, 2 детей школьного возраста. У Ырыскан - средне-специальное образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 19 лет назад, с покупки скота. Благодаря упорному труду Ырыскан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы, 20 овец, 2 лошади, на арендованной земле мерою 1,86 ГА она выращивает картофель для реализации.  Ежемесячный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Ырыскан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 12 овец. Доходы от кредита Ырыскан планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение своей деятельности и хочет накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Yryskan is 36 years old, married, and she has two school-age children. She has a specialized secondary education and is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, two activities which provide an additional source of income to her family.  She started in this field 19 years ago when she bought her first livestock.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently owns three cows, 20 sheep and two horses, and she also grows potatoes for resale on a plot of leased land measuring  1.86 hectare.  She makes close to 10,000 som (KGS) every month.  In order to further develop her farming business, she has turned to the Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to purchase 12 sheep.  Yryskan plans to re-invest the profits from her loan into further increasing her activity.  She would also like to save enough money to repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase 12 sheep to fatten and resale.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José  de 40 años de edad quien vive en Sololá, soltero con sus 8 hijos. Quien se ha dedicado al trabajo de la tierra como campesino por muchos años pues es el único oficio que le genera ingresos económicos, los primeros 5 hijos ya tienen vidas independientes y los 3 últimos son excelentes estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad.

La actividad que el realiza es agricultor en su comunidad, la tierra ha sido bendecida por manos de José pues es la actividad que el realiza y le gusta  trabajar y cuidarla.  Es un oficio digno de admirar el que hombres se dediquen por años y para toda la vida.  La tierra sin la labor de hombres campesinos dedicados al cultivo de la misma, no daría los frutos que sostienen generalmente a toda generación.

El motivo de la realización de su  préstamo es para la compra de terreno y fertilizantes ya que desde un tiempo ha venido trabajando por ello para poder cultivar la tierra sin pagarle a otra persona por usar sus tierras como lo ha vendió haciendo.

Las metas de el es pagar sus deudas con que el cuenta y en un futuro comprar más terrenos para sus hijos.
texts.en:
José is 40 years old, is single and lives in Sololá with his 8 children. He has spent many years as a farmer working the land since this is the only occupation that generates economic income for him. The first 5 children already lead independent lives and the three smaller ones are excellent students in the community's school. 

His occupation is being a farmer in his community. The land has been blessed by the hands of José, since this is the occupation he has and he likes to work and take care of the land. It is an occupation worthy of admiration that men spend years and their whole lives pursuing. The land without the work of farmers who are dedicated to its cultivation would not give the fruits that overall nourish an entire generation. 

The purpose of his loan request is to buy a plot of land and fertilizers, since he has come and worked on the land for a while in order to cultivate it without paying the other person to use his land as would be the case if he had sold it. 

His goals are to pay back his debts and in the future purchase more land for his children.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land and fertilizers

loans.name: Jose German

texts.en: Jose lives with his wife in San Martin, Puebla. He recently opened a convenience store inside his house and soon has taken almost all the space. They now how to sleep in a very small space with only a hanging sheet separating their bedroom from the store. Jose and his wife are now ready to build the first room for their house. It is easier to build a new home because in the space they are living in now is already set up for the store. Jose and his wife make around $1,000 USD a month. Since they are owners of the small shop that basically sells the crops from local farmers, it has been difficult to get a credit for their home from other financial institutions. Jose is asking for the credit to finish buying the materials he needs to build the new room. He wants to make it right this time with a proper roof and a cement floor. He and his wife see this as an opportunity to make something that will last forever. Jose will be trained and will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to make sure that his work meets the safety and quality standards.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a new room

loans.name: Usher Group

texts.en:
Talent (far right in the black top) is a single mother of one primary school-going child. She lives in Harare, at her parents’ house. She is a cross-boarder and a hairdresser supplying her customers with kitchenware, clothes, blankets and electrical gadgets. Her monthly sales are on average US$750 per month. With this she is managing to pay school fees for her son and assisting her parents to cover family expenses including food and clothing. 

She got $400 in her previous loan and managed to pay it back on time and in full. She now wants $450 to restock from South Africa as the demand for her products is improving. In her plans she is going to have her own house in five years to come, looking mainly from the income from her business.

loans.use: To buy more kitchenware, blankets and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en: Francisco lives in San Martin, Puebla with his family. He works in the countryside. Activity that his father and his grandfather did. He grows different crops all year round. Francisco is excited because a large supermarket chain has agreed to buy all his crops for the next 5 years. This is very exciting for Francisco. For the last 10 years Francisco and his wife have been building a house for their family. They are just missing some materials to finish building and protecting the outside walls. Francisco has seasonal job with a risk of loosing his crops due to natural conditions and makes around $700 USD a month. These conditions make it very hard for him to access credit. Francisco is requesting this loan to buy the materials and finish the work at home. These improvements are a way for Francisco and his family to have a better chance at improving their quality of lives. Francisco will do the construction work and will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish the walls of his house.

loans.name: Mukurumbira Group

texts.en:
Jennie is a widow aged 56, she has four children. She is a hardworking and a consistent cross-border trader, who buys and sells clothes she procures from South Africa and sometimes from Zambia. Jennie procures just the right goods for her customers as she only buys on order. This has helped her maintaining a reasonable amount of working capital as she gets paid for the goods upon delivery.

She started cross-border trading in 2001, soon after her husband passed, when she realised she had to take care of her four children. From her business, Jennie managed to pay school fees for her children and buy a house in Mufakose suburbs where she is staying with her family.

With the loan that she is requesting from Kiva, she would like to purchase clothes in bulk from Tanzania, where the costs are lower, so that she can sell at affordable prices and grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk from Tanzania for resale.

loans.name: Lion Of Judah Group

texts.en:
Tendai is the chairperson of the Lion of Judah group. She is a 37 years old single mother of three. Tendai has been selling hardware, plumbing materials and electrical gadgets for the past 3 years. The group which she is part of is based in Machipisa, a high density suburb in Harare and all members work in the same complex. 

Tendai’s business has been a source of livelihood for her and her children. Selling hardware and electrical gadgets has helped her educate all of her children, despite being single. Her major challenge, however, was the lack of adequate capital not only to meet her demand but to provide a wider product range. 

With the loan from Thrive, she will be able to do all the above. Her vision is to grow her business through the knowledge she got from Thrive training which included lessons on savings, budgeting and keeping daily records of business transactions.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of plumbing and hardware goods for her business.

loans.name: Sylvanus's Group

texts.en:
Sylvanus is 46 years old and a father of 3 children. He works as a manual palm oil processing worker at a local mill in his village. Life is not really easy in this part of the country considering his very low income and the intense labour required to make a little income. His desire to acquire a loan in the past has been unsuccessful considering that Nke-Anyi has limited finance to provide all its members in the rural area every year, but with the new Kiva partnership, his dream is finally coming through. He hopes to use this first ever loan to process palm oil and sale it at the local market.

The income from this loan will go a long way to support him and his family income; especially it will help him to send his kids back to school this year.
   
He thanks all Kiva lenders who support his loan.

loans.use: to process and store palm oil products.

loans.name: Rukuriro Group

texts.en:
Matildah is a 41 years old lady who is very hardworking. She joined the Rukuriro group where she has benefited from the group's support. She is a single mother who lives with her only child in Harare.

Since she got separated from her husband, Matildah has had to take care of their child on her own. She started selling chickens 3 years ago and has since been surviving on this business. She started with a batch of 50 birds, and gradually grew to 200 birds after she got her first loan from Thrive in 2013. 

Matildah wishes to diversify her business through cross-border trading, selling clothes. She is confident that with the training she has received from Thrive, she will be able to manage both businesses. In light of the cross-border business, she recently obtained her passport and plans to travel to South Africa in order to do the buying and selling of clothes. A Kiva loan will help Matildah to grow her business and, in the medium term, build her own house.

loans.use: To add cross border trade to her current poultry business.

loans.name: Helidey

texts.en: Helidey is a young single mother that lives in San Martin, Puebla. Helidey loved watching her mother saw when she was little, but she never imagined to be a seamstress when getting adult.  Helidey lives with her parents in a small bedroom with her son. Her father gave her a small piece of land near the house, so she can start building a home and have her own space. Helidey is really excited to give her son a home were they can have separate bedrooms. Helidey makes around $600 USD a month without work contract or steady income. Hence it is very hard for her to access a credit. She is asking for a credit so she can buy the materials needed to build the foundations and the first room of her house. Her father and brother will help her with the construction work although she also wants to receive the training from Ecoblock to understand what the house needs and supervise the work.  Additionaly, Helidey will receive visits from certified technicians to make sure that the house meets all the safety and quality standards. Helidey cannot wait to see the day when she could have  her own home.

loans.use: to build the first room of her new house

loans.name: Roman

texts.en: Roman lives in San Martin, Puebla with her two children and his wife. Roman works in the field with cattle. He has lived all his live in the town of San Martin and wishes  one day their kids can start their own family in the same town that saw them grow. Roman and his wife live in house that took them a while to complete. When they moved in, they had to use a tin roof since they had no more savings or money to install a proper roof. He also wishes to repair an outside wall that is slowly falling apart. Roman has an informal job and makes around $ 900 USD a month, so this makes it nearly impossible to have access to credit with other institutions. Roman is asking for a credit, so he can buy the materials needed to build a proper roof and repair the wall. He wants to do this work as soon as possible so the house does not suffer any more damage. Roman will do the construction work and a certified technician will make visits to verify that the work done meets the security and quality standards. Roman is excited to see his home completed.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair a wall and build a roof

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: This is Anne, a final year student at University studying journalism. She comes from a single parent family having lost her mother 7 years ago. She has two siblings and desires to one day own her own public relations firm. Despite coming from a difficult background she is not deterred. She is inspired by the fact she is able to give her very best in school and in future get a job to assist her family financially. A Kiva loan will help her pay her tuition cost and enable her to finish her schooling.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees to finish university

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
This is Joseph. He is a small-scale farmer in Kiambu county, Kenya. He is married and blessed with three children. He is committed to having the best for his family. 

He has been in farming for the last seven years and his experience has enabled him perfect his farming where his produce generates adequate income to meet his family needs. He has seen his income grow progressively and so he is confident to become a prominent farmer in Kiambu. 

A loan from Kiva will help him increase his scale of farming and will create employment. It will also contribute to food security in the country.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and scale up his farming business

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
This is Isaac. He is married and has five children. He is involved in vegetable farming, and he grows cabbage, kale and spinach. The horticulture business has shown a lot of prospect, providing for his family needs. He has accumulated enough experience and he is able to maximize from his farm by ensuring that he has vegetables when there is short supply in the market. He has many regular customers, and he cannot always meet the demand.

With a loan from Kiva, Isaac will increase his production to meet his customers' demand and make more profit. His family's living standards will be improved.

loans.use: to increase his horticulture farm production

loans.name: Junta De Saneamiento De Minas Y Guayaibity Group

texts.es:
La Junta de Saneamiento de Minas y Guayaibity fue creada el 6 de octubre del año 2009 y desde la fecha hasta hoy en día provee del líquido imprescindible a los vecinos de la zona. Actualmente la junta de saneamiento cuenta con dos pozos y un tanque de hormigón, la distribución de agua y todos los usuarios cuentan con medidores en su totalidad, lo que permite ayudarles a tener este servicio importante. Gracias a esta Aguateria 757 usuarios pueden tener agua y de esa forma tener acceso a algo tan imprescindible para todo ser humano.
 Solicitan el prestamo para la compra de medidores y caños, con lo cual desean poder seguir haciendo llegar a las personas este servicio tan importante.
Esta Aguateria está ayudando a las personas con este servicio tan grande y es por eso que piden este crédito para poder ir creciendo y que más personas tengan acceso a este servicio.
texts.en:
The Sanitation Board of Minas and Guayabity was created on October 6, 2009, and since that date until now it has provided the essential liquid to the inhabitants of the zone.  Presently, the sanitation board has two wells and a concrete tank.  The water distribution system and all the customers have meters throughout, which allows them to have this important service.  Thanks to this water company, 757 users can have water and in this way have access to something so essential to all human beings.
They are requesting the loan in order to buy meters and pipes with which they wish to be able to continue making this important service available to people.
This water company is helping people with this great service and for this reason they are asking for this loan in order to be able to grow and so that more people will have access to this service.

loans.use: to buy meters and pipes.

loans.name: Erlita

texts.en: Erlita is a 30-year-old, married woman, and a mother of three young children, ages one to three. She is from Carles, Iloilo.  Erlita has been engaged in a fishing business for five years, now. Her husband works as a fisherman. Erlita is asking for a loan to buy hardwood, plywood, and an engine, for their boat. Through this investment, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Erlita dreams of improving their livelihood and saving money for the schooling of her children, in the future.

loans.use: to buy hardwood, plywood, and a boat engine.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en: Riza is a 29-year-old married woman from Carles, Iloilo. She has run a fishing business together with her husband for a long time now. Aside from fish, they also catch crabs. Riza is asking for a loan to buy crab traps and fishing nets. Through this, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch thus allowing them to sell more fish and crabs in the market. In the future, Riza hopes to expand their business and save money for other business ventures.

loans.use: to buy crab traps and fishing nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Tatevik

texts.en:
Tatevik lives in Kapan, Syunik region with her father. She is engaged in the trading business. 

More specifically, Tatevik sells cosmetics and skin care products from her house. For the variety of products she sells, Tatevik has a number of loyal customers, whom she is always ready to help with choices from her great variety. Tatevik has now requested this loan to be able to purchase new stock of cosmetics for covering customers' new orders. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business startup loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of cosmetics for covering customers' new orders

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol, 36, is a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Roame and has six children. Two of her children are in High School, two are in Elementary School and the other two are not of school age yet. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal household needs and to send her four children to school. 

Mirasol operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food.  She earns a profit by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also sells firewood used for cooking. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 300 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business she is requesting a Php 8000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items which are mostly biscuits and some peanut butter. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings are their income source to meet their daily expenses and to send her children to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Mirasol hopes to maintain and grow her business so they could have a better life. She strives hard to give her children the best education possible and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery food items to sell.

loans.name: Nedalyn

texts.en:
Nedalyn is a 24-year-old woman from Carles, Iloilo. She is married to a fisherman, and they have two young children ages 2 and 3. Nedalyn has depended on their fishing business for five years now. She is asking for a loan to buy a fishing boat and a new engine. She knows that a loan will go a long way in her business, allowing them to maximize on their income and in their every effort. The income will pay for healthy food for her family.  

In the future, she hope to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat and a new engine

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is married with five children, and has been in business for three years. He depends on the business to support his family. 

Therefore, he's willing to do whatever it takes to continue improving his business. A Kiva loan helps him to add ten CH-2300 improved charcoal stoves to his inventory, which he'll sell, repay the loan and improve his business with the profits made.

loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is a young man who started his business less than a year ago. Thanks to his Kiva loan, he will be able to add ten CH-2300 improve charcoal cookstoves to his inventory, which he will sell. He will use the profit to improve his business.

loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Maria Hortencia

texts.en: Maria Hortencia works in the market of San Martin, Puebla where she also lives. She has been selling chicharron and other mexican dishes for the last 26 years. Her chicharron is said to be the best in town. Maria Horencia has built her house little by little. She says all her work and effort has paid off. However with the recent summer rains Maria realized that the tin roof holded by sticks and rocks was actually damaging her house and was not keeping the inside dry. Since Maria Horentecia has an informal job and makes $1,200 USD a month, no other institution will give her a credit for her house. She is now asking for a credit to buy the materials needed to replace the roof for a proper cement roof. Maria Hortencia will ask her nephew help for the construction job and will receive training and supervision visits from certified technicians who will make sure the work is properly done.

loans.use: to buy the materials needed to replace the roof of her home for a proper cement roof.

loans.name: Fritz

texts.en:
Fritz is a 32-year old man from Liberia who has been in business for four years now, selling beverages. 

With a Kiva loan, he will be able to add ten CH-2300 improved charcoal stoves to his inventory, which he will sell. He will use the profit to improve his business.

loans.use: to pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Prince Nicholas

texts.en:
Prince is married with two children and has been in business for over ten years selling electronic products in Garnersville, Liberia.

A Kiva loan allows him to add ten CH-2300 improved charcoal stoves to his stock of products. After the sale of these goods, he will repay the loan and use the profit to improve his business.

loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose is a very active single parent. At 69 years she is still fully engaged in oil palm production. Her interest is more in palm tree growing. In the past years, she has volunteered with Nke-Anyi Farmers Multipurpose Cooperative Society in the area of providing nursing and planting of new palm trees training to many young farmers within the rural communities. 

A portion of this loan will help her to nurse more improved palm tree seeds for the local market and part of the balance she will invest it in palm oil processing. 

Presently she suffers rheumatic pains on her left leg, but Rose is still very active in her daily work. She hopes to apportion part of her profit for the purchase of drugs and treatment.

loans.use: to process and store palm oil products.

loans.name: Maria Susana

texts.en: Maria Susana lives in San Martin, Puebla with her husband and her teenage son. Maria Susana sells mole and other Mexican dishes at the market of San Martin. Her husband works in the field and her son is currently studying. Maria Susana and her husband started building a new room detached from the house where they could have a proper kitchen. Right now Maria Susana basically cooks outside of the house under a temporary shack. However, they soon saw that they not calculated correctly and need more materials than initially planned.  Maria Susana and her husband have informal jobs; therefore, getting credit for their house from other institutions is very difficult. Maria Susana is asking for a credit to buy the materials needed to finish the new room. Her husband and son will be trained and receive visits from certified technicians who will make sure that the new room meets the quality and safety standards. Maria Susana looks forward to having a proper kitchen where she can work and cook for her family

loans.use: to finish building the new room at her house.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth, the 4th born in a family of five. She has been raised by one single parent. Her mother is a business person.

Elizabeth is studying for a diploma in early childhood education and development. After graduation, she aims to help and support her family. She is in her final year and with a Kiva loan she will be able to pay her tuition fees and buy a laptop to be able to complete her project.

loans.use: to pay for tuition costs and buy a laptop for her final year at university

loans.name: Marwa

texts.en: Marwa is a 20-year-old Lebanese single woman living with one parent and three siblings. She has worked as a private teacher since 2012. She works from her home where she has arranged a special room to properly welcome her students. Today with her youth loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she will purchase a laptop, books and an encyclopedia with the aim of better organizing her preparations and research and widening her knowledge. Marwa is very optimistic and looks forward to keep on borrowing additional Kiva loans to continue developing her competencies.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop, books and an encyclopedia

loans.name: Rana

texts.en: Rana is a 27-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband, who works at the Lebanese General Security, and her two children, who are still attending school. Rana's family financial situation is not very encouraging and this is why she works in collaboration with her husband with the aim of supplementing their income to be able to pay the high costs of living. Today, Rana seeks to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase teaching materials needed, since she works as a private teacher at her house and wants so badly to improve her job. In the future, Rana looks forward to borrow more Kiva loans and wishes to start working at a local school where she will be able to broaden her capabilities and know-how.

loans.use: to purchase needed teaching materials

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth trabaja en un estudio contable, vive con su madre y hermanos, su madre es empleada  de una empresa.
Está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, y sus metas futuras son la de recibirse y trabajar por cuenta propia para obtener mejores ingresos y ayudar a su familia.
Pide este prestamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de libros para su universidad, de manera a poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en: Ruth works in an accounting firm.  She lives with her mother and her siblings.  Her mother works for a company.  Ruth is studying for a career in accounting, and her goals are to graduate and be self-employed so that she can earn a better income and help her family.  She is seeking this loan to purchase college textbooks so that she can continue studying.

loans.use: purchase books.

loans.name: Ivania Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ivania del Carmen es una joven de 30 años de edad, casada, madre de dos niños en edad escolar. Habita en el municipio de El Sauce desde que se casó y creó su hogar pero ella es originaria de una comarca ubicada a 10 kilómetros de dicho municipio.
Estudió Magisterio y se desempeña como profesora de primaria en una comunidad cercana al pueblo donde tiene más de cinco años de dedicarse a esta profesión, la cual le ha permitido en conjunto con su esposo tener su propia vivienda la que han ido mejorando poco a poco.
Ivania viaja todos los días al ray como generalmente se le dice aquí en Nicaragua cuando le hacen el favor de llevar a una persona en vehículo y cuando no pasan vehículos le toca ir a pie hasta la escuelita lo cual le resulta bastante cansado porque la carretera es inclinada, pero a pesar de todas estas adversidades ella demuestra su entusiasmo de impartir clases a sus alumnos.
Ivania se presentó por primera vez a Ceprodel en busca de un financiamiento, ya que compañeros de trabajo le hablaron de unos inversionistas del extranjero llamados Kiva que le podían apoyar con la necesidad que ella tiene en este momento de mejorar su salud con el cual piensa realizarse unos exámenes médicos y ultrasonidos para chequearse su organismo y encontrar cual es el problema que ella tiene.
texts.en:
Ivania del Carmen is a 30 year old woman.  She is married and the mother of two school-aged children.  She has lived in the city of El Sauce since she was married, but she is originally from a region 10 kilometers away. She studied education, and she currently works as an elementary school teacher in a nearby community, where she has worked for five years.  This career has allowed her and her husband to have their own home that they have improved little by little.  She gets a ride from someone everyday, but when she cannot find a ride she walks to the school, which makes her very tired because the road is uphill.  Despite the adversities, she is enthusiastic about teaching her students.

Ivan approached Ceprodel in search of a loan after her coworkers told her about the Kiva lenders who could help her with current health needs.  She plans to have medical tests and ultrasounds done to check her body and see what her problems are.

loans.use: pay for medical exams and ultrasounds.

loans.name: Valeria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Virgen De Monserrate Del Pollo.
En este lugar vive la señora Valeria, tiene 20 años de edad, está casada y  de esta relación tienen una bebé de 4 meses de nacida. Su esposo es mecánico.
Doña Valeria se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa, vende a crédito  y cobra cada quince días. Tiene más de dos años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo por el bien de su familia.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito para invertir en su negocio ya que le sirve de mucho porque su bebé le ocasiona muchos gastos los cuales su marido no puede solventar ya que el no gana mucho en el campo. Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Lleva cuatro ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así ella se ayuda en su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the Virgen De Monserrate Del Pollo community bank meet twice a month in Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi and famous for tamarind fruit.  
Valeria, 20, is married and has a 4-month old baby.  Her husband is a mechanic.
Doña Valeria operates a clothing sales business.  She goes door to door and sells all kinds of clothing.  She sells on credit and collects from her buyers twice a month.  She has operated the business for more than two years and says that her income helps to support her family.  She wants to roll over the loan now so that she can invest in her business.  Having a baby is expensive, she says, and her husband's income doesn't stretch to pay all the family's expenses. 
Doña Valeria will use the loan to stock her business with articles of clothing: pants, blouses, t-shirts and clothes for children.  This will be her fourth round of funding with the community bank and says that she likes this means of borrowing because it is good for her business.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, shirts and children's clothes.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a fisherman from the town of Carles, Iloilo. He is 20 years old with a three year old daughter to support from his livelihood. Fishing has been his source of income. Joseph is asking for a loan to buy a new fishing boat and engine. With this, he can expand and improve his fishing ventures to increase his catch and his income. In the future, Joseph hopes to make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat and engine

loans.name: Arzeh

texts.en: Arzeh is a 32-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children, who all attend school. In 2010, Arzeh decided to start working at her domicile as a private teacher as publicized in the picture. She receives many students and provides them with the best teaching skills that she can. With her loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, Arzeh will purchase books and an encyclopedia with the aim of enhancing her expertise to be able to receive more students in the seasons to come.

loans.use: to purchase books and an encyclopedia

loans.name: Margarita Del Jesús

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Virgen De Monserrate Del Pollo.
En este lugar vive la señora Margarita, tiene 51 años de edad,  mantiene una relación de unión libre y  fruto de la misma tienen dos  hijos, uno mayor de edad y otro que es de crianza que tiene 7 años de edad el cual estudia en escuela, su marido es agricultor.
Doña Margarita es una muy buena madre y ama casa que además se dedica a la cría de pollos y chanchos, tiene una pequeña granja en su casa, ella compra los pollos y chanchos cuando aun están pequeños y los mantiene por espacio de dos a tres meses a los pollos y a los chanchos un poco más de tiempo y luego cuando están listos los entrega a comerciantes, su marido por su parte se dedica a la agricultura, el siembra en época invernal maíz y maní.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar alimento para pollos y chanchos. Lleva tres años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
In Portoviejo city, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the royal tamarind trees, every 15 days the Virgen De Monserrate Del Pollo credit group meets.

This is where 51 year old Margarita lives. She is married and has two children, one is grown and the other is 7 years old and is in school. Her husband is a farmer. Margarita is a very good mother and housewife, in addition to which she buy chickens and pigs when they are little and keeps them for a few months to raise and then sell them. Her husband farms, growing seasonal corn and peanuts.

This loan is going to be used to buy feed for the chickens and pigs. She has been in the credit group for 3 years and she likes it because the loans help her a lot. Her dreams are to have good health.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Rawlings

texts.en: Rawlings is a 39-year-old, married man, living in Masindi, Uganda. He earns a salary, as his major income source. He decided to start farming, since his salary alone could not sustain his family. He grows maize, beans, and cassava to sell. Rawlings needs a loan to have his garden weeded, so as to get good yields.

loans.use: to have his garden weeded, so as to get good yields from his crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy purple corn, fruit, and containers for her corn pudding business.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a hardworking 54-year-old married man with five children aged 19, 14, 10, 8 and 6 years. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda.

James carries out banana planting, a business he started with an intention of generating funds to satisfy the demands of his family and to improve his standards of living. He earns additional income from selling bathing sponges. He hopes to expand his business, although he faces challenges of weather changes and poor roads that make it difficult for him to transport his ready products.

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for his farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Francisca Adelaida

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Virgen De Monserrate Del Pollo.
En este lugar vive la señora Francisca, tiene 36 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos de 13, 7, 5 y 3 años de edad, uno estudia en colegio y dos en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
Doña Francisca es una muy buena madre y ama casa que además se dedica a la cría de chanchos, ella  espera comprar unos  chanchos pequeños para  luego alimentarlos  por espacio de 5 a 6 meses y luego cuando están listos los entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa. Parte del crédito le da a su marido el cual se dedica a la agricultura, ellos tienen cultivos de plátano, actualmente están en trabajaos de limpieza de los platanales razón por lo cual necesitan de urgencia el crédito. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar chanchos así como también para pagar la mano de obra por el trabajo en la limpieza de los cultivos. Lleva 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta ya que con los créditos ha podido salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener buena salud ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, the members of the Crédito Virgen De Monserrat Del Pollo meet in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manaí, known for many years as the city of the real tamarinds.

Francisca, 36, lives here. She is in a civil union and they have 4 children ages 13, 7, 5, and 3. One is in high school and two are in primary school. Her husband works in agriculture.

Francisca is a good mother and housewife who also works by raising pigs. She hopes to buy some small pigs to feed them for 5 to 6 months. Then, when they're ready, she sells them to vendors from her home. She will give part of the loan to her husband who works in agriculture. They have plantain crops. Right now, they're working on cleaning the plantains, which is why they urgently need the loan.

This loan will be used to buy pigs as well as pay for labor to clean the crops. She has been in this loan group for three years and she likes that the loans have moved her forward. Her dreams are for her and her loved ones to be healthy.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pay for labor.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris sells at a local market in Paynesville, Liberia. She has successfully paid back her first Kiva loan. She is a single mother of three children. 

She is requesting her second Kiva loan to add twenty-five improved charcoal stoves : sixteen CH-2300 and nine CH-2200 models. the profits made will be used to improve her business.

Doris hopes to add solar lighting to her Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) product mix next time.

loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Oscar Jose

texts.en: Oscar lives with his wife and son in San Martin, Puebla. Oscar is self employed and works painting houses and as a gardener. Oscar plans to build his house little by little. However, he wants to make it right from the beginning. He has seen countless times people with no training that invest their saving in something that last only a couple of years because it is not done correctly or with quality materials. Oscar has attended some workshops, so now has the abilities to start building. Since he has an informal job and makes around $ 550 USD a month, Oscar is not able to ask for a credit from other institutions. Oscar is asking for a credit to buy the materials. so he can build the first room and the bases of his new home.  Oscar will get help from his son and support from his wife. The family is excited about the opportunity of having a new home.

loans.use: to build the first room of his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to build a cement roof for his house

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank has a small business selling small electronic products in Monrovia, Liberia. He has been in business for four years.

Through a Kiva loan, Frank is able to add ten CH-2300 improved charcoal stoves to his inventory. He hope this will help him improve his business.

loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a married woman, aged 29 years. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to local neighbours. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments. She dreams of expanding to a café business. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, and maize flour

loans.name: Amata

texts.en:
Amata is married with three children. She has been in business for twenty years selling kitchen appliances in Monrovia, Liberia.

A Kiva loan helps her add ten CH-2300 improved charcoal cookstoves to her inventory.  She will use the profits to repay the Kiva loan and improve her business.

loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Melvin

texts.en:
Melvin has a store selling electronic goods in Garnersville, Liberia. He is married and has one child. His business has been around for four years.

A loan from Kiva helps him add ten CH-2300 improved charcoal stoved to his inventory. He hopes that adding this product to his inventory will improve his business.

loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Pitaba

texts.en:
Pitaba is married with two children and has been in business for two years selling dry goods in Garnersville, Liberia.

A loan from Kiva helps him to add ten CH-2300 improved charcoal stoves to his inventory. After selling these products, he will repay the loan and improve his business with the profit.

loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay her college tuition.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten, 29, is Lebanese. She is married and lives with her husband and her only child. 

In 2010, she decided to start working from her house to increase the family’s income. Her job is to produce homemade foods, which she sells to numerous customers. 

With her youth loan requested from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l, Faten will purchase food provisions and other necessary products. 

In the future, Faten plans to request additional Kiva loans, as she is eager to become the owner of a shop.

loans.use: to purchase food provisions and other products

loans.name: Kapullichayoq Sj Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “KAPULLICHAYOQ SJ” de la Asociación Arariwa, la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de comida y cerveza, la socia lleva años dedicándose   este negocio  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para dé están forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de aceite, carnes, arroz entre otros. (Irene está levantando la mano en la fotografía). 
Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de comida, venta de abarrotes, venta de chicha de Jora, brindando servicios transportes,trabajadora de empresa privada.
 Los socios agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
texts.en:
Our members belong to KAPULLICHAYOQ SJ community bank and its parent organization, Asociación Arariwa.  
Our featured member, Irene, has operated a beer and food sales business for many years.  (Irene is the woman waving at the camera in the photo.) The business is a success, she says, because she works hard at it every day.  She wants to continue the business because it is her means of helping support her family.  
Irene is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her business with the merchandise--cooking oil, rice, etc.--that her customers want.  
The other members of the community bank operate a variety of businesses that include food sales, transportation services, etc.  
The members want lenders to know that they are grateful for their loans.  The loans are helping them fulfill their dreams and all the members are committed to repaying the loans in the agreed-upon time.  
The members pictured outside the main photo asked to be photographed separately because they had to work when the photo was taken.  The person in the main photo whose face is covered is not a member of the community bank.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 31-year-old Lebanese married woman. She has three children. Her husband works at a furniture gallery, and he is the main income source for the family. As for Zeinab, she is a private teacher who has been working in this occupation since 2009. Five years of experience has permitted her to become a well-trained educator, able to provide her students with the minimum required. 

And today, Zeinab plans to take a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase books and encyclopedias so that she can improve herself and offer her learners the best of her capabilities. Zeinab’s only wish is to help her students reach the highest levels in society, and she works very hard to make it happen.

loans.use: to purchase books and encyclopedias

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 19 years old and from Carles, Iloilo. She is a mother to a one-year-old baby girl. She has been engaged in a Sari-sari (variety) store business for three years now. Helen would like to improve her inventory levels and include buying items in bulk for a better profit. She is asking for a loan to buy items such as detergent, shampoo, canned goods, bath soap, chips, candies and seasonings. She hopes that with the help of the loan she will be able to increase her income for her child's needs. She also dreams of sending her child to school someday.

loans.use: to buy items such as detergent, shampoo, canned goods, bath soap, chips, candies and seasonings

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 52-year-old man. He is married to Jane, and they have been blessed with seven children. Jane earns income to add to Samuel's, to support their children's welfare. Samuel has been a livestock farmer for a period of ten years, earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Samuel was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer. Now he is servicing his first loan of KES 30,000. He intends to use this amount to buy goats for rearing.

Samuel plans to use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children. He hopes to become a successful businessman with a bright future.

loans.use: to buy goats for rearing.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie is a 37-year-old married woman from the town of Carles, Iloilo. She has five children ages 2-16. Julie is engaged in fishing, catching crabs and "buying and selling" of crab meat. She is asking for a loan to buy fish nets, fishing weights, crab traps, nylon, ropes and pay for labor. The income will help buy food and pay for the household bills and tuition fees of her children. The loan will help a lot so she can improve her business. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger business that will allow her to earn a bigger profit for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, fishing weights, crab traps, nylon, ropes and pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fishing nets, fishing weights, floaters, nylon, compressor and rope

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a fishing boat, engine, fishing nets, floaters, fishing weights, ropes and nylon

loans.name: Rosy

texts.en:
