Rosy is thankful that she was granted a 40,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy raw ingredients like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments needed in her food stall business. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would like now to apply for another Php 40,000, which she will use to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and paint for her 5-door apartment which she rents out for 11,000 a month. She is positive that her earnings will increase as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.  

Rosy hopes that her business will continue to grow. She dreams to send all her children to the best school until college. She prays her family will lead a godly and quiet life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and paint for her apartment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to finish building a room for her mother.

loans.name: Kajumwa

texts.en:
Kajumwa is a married woman. She lives at a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Kajumwa has been operating a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a challenge of stiff competition from other charcoal operators, in her business.

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Lusine A.

texts.en:
Lusine has been in business for five years selling dry goods. He is married and depends on the business to provide for his family.

A loan from Kiva helps him to add ten CH-2300 improved charcoal stoves to his inventory. He hopes the new focus on SE4ALL will help his business grow.

loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Amadou

texts.en:
Amadou is from West Point, Liberia. He is married with one child. He been in business selling dry goods for fifteen months now, and he enjoys his business. 

A Kiva loan allows him to add five CH-2200 and five CH-2300 improved charcoal stoves to his inventory. He is willing to work hard, to repay his kiva loan, and to use the profits to improve his business.

loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Ma. Riza

texts.en:
Ma. Riza is from Carles, Iloilo. She is 26 years old, with a one-year-old baby boy. Ma. Riza has been been engaged in a fishing business for four years now to support her family. 

She is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy a motor engine and fishing nets. She hopes to continue to expand her business so she can support the needs of her baby, like milk and diapers. 

In the future, she hopes to see her child become successful with his studies.

loans.use: to buy a motor engine and fishing nets

loans.name: Lida Bellita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Virgen De Monserrate Del Pollo.
En este lugar vive la señora Lida, tiene 59 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 6 hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven con ella. Su esposo no trabaja por motivos de salud.
Doña Lida es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder salir adelante con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de productos de  catalogo de Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene dos años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual salen adelante ahora que su marido no puede trabajar.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisuterías. Lleva 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son tener buena salud y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The Virgen De Monserrate Del Pollo community bank meets twice a month in Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi and famous for tamarind fruit.
Sra. Lida, 59, is married and has 6 grown children, two of whom still live at home.  Her husband isn't well and can no longer work.
Doña Lida operates a cosmetics sales business.  She sells Avon and Yanbai beauty products that she orders from catalogs and resells to her customers.  The business allows her to earn an income and still be at home to care for her family.  She works three days a week, two or three hours at a time.  She sells her products on credit and collects from her customers every eight days.  She has operated the business for two years and says that it's a big help now that her husband can no longer work.
Doña Lida will use the loan to stock her business with the products--perfumes, creams, etc.--that her buyers want.  She has been a member of the community bank for 3 years and likes it, she says, because she can easily raise the capital she needs to carry on her business.  Her hopes for the future are for good health and a steady income.

loans.use: to stock her cosmetics sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods to sell, including cooking oil, toiletries, and seasonings

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is a choreographer working at a local art school.
 
She has been providing dancing classes to her students for six years already. Tamara lives with her 21-year-old son, who is self employed. 

To be able to purchase needed materials and equipment needed for dancing classes, Tamara has applied for this loan. She asks lenders to support her in purchasing uniforms for her student's performances, a notebook, and a CD player for dancing classes. 

Tamara has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business startup loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Tamara relies on lenders' support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for uniforms for performance of her students, a notebook and a CD player for dancing training

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a 44-year-old farmer from Kipsebwo village in the North Rift region of Kenya. He has four children, and has been doing mixed-farming for 14 years.  His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, and earnings from side-businesses.

William enjoys milking. Milking to him is a hobby by itself. However, he has not been milking since his cow was pregnant. The cow delivered, but he is still sparing the milk for the calf. This whole situation has had an effect on his livelihood. His own family has not been getting much milk, and also his income has been cut. 

William is seeking a loan to purchase a highly productive dairy cow. The cow will produce more milk than that which an average cow can produce in a day. This will get him back on his feet after months of low income. Having an additional cow will also cushion him against losses associated with such scenarios in the future. 

Returns from this investment will help him to meet some of the high farming-related costs. When he was asked how his family will benefit if he was granted this loan, he said, "The loan will increase the number of my dairy animals. I will use the returns to build a dairy unit that will boost my milk production. The extra income as a result of this loan will help me take better care of my family needs."

loans.use: to purchase a dairy animal

loans.name: Satenik

texts.en:
Satenik is a hairdresser, from Kapan. She lives there with her husband and two children. (She has a five-year-old daughter and a one-year-old son.) Her husband is an army officer, and he also provides auto repair service from the garage near their house.

Satenik has been working in a local beauty salon for three years. Over these years of hard and tireless work, Satenik was able to gain a big number of loyal customers. She provides them nice and high-quality services. The requested loan is needed for Satenik to purchase tools and materials needed for providing hairdressing services (e.g., comb, chair, hair care products). She has been approved for a loan, within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to other credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials she needs, for providing hairdressing services

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo, aged 49,  is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

For the past two years, Mlongo has operated a retail cereal shop business, selling from home to her potential customers, her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Mlongo dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the Kes 20,000 loan that Mlongo is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of wheat, maize, beans and green grams (mung beans). She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of wheat, maize, beans and green grams (mung beans)

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.en: Maria Yolanda lives in San Martin, Puebla. She lives in a small house neighboring her parents. Since she is the only one of the family that never got married, she is in charge of taking care of them. Maria Yolanda is very proud of her work as a seamstress and the effort she has put into building her house. She likes her small home, since she says she doesn't need much. Maria Yolanda wants to change the dirt floor of her house for a new ceramic floor. She is looking forward to have a clean floor and a healthier home. Maria Yolanda is self-employed and makes around $500 USD a month, this situation makes  difficult for her to get credit from other organizations. Maria Yolanda is asking for a loan so she can buy the necessary materials to replace the dirt floor for a new ceramic floor. She has been trained and feels excited to work on her house. She will receive visits from certified technicians who will supervise that the work meets all the quality and safety standards. Maria Yolanda is aware that hard work is what got her until here, and work hard will give her a better place.

loans.use: to buy materials to install a proper floor for her home

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives in Kapan in the Syunik region with her only daughter who is 35 years old. Anahit is a physics teacher who has 20 years of teaching experience. She works at a local secondary school and also provides individual tutoring to her students in one of the small rooms in her house. 

Anahit is now requesting this loan so she can purchase tables, chairs and a printer that she needs to organize her classes more effectively. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tables, chairs and a printer

loans.name: Ilyos

texts.ru: Илёс молодой и трудолюбивый человек. Он живет вместе с женой и 2 детьми в отдаленном регионе. Илёс занимается скотоводством. Он покупает скот, откармливает несколько месяцев и продает на местном рынке. Его жена домохозяйка и помогает Илёсу по скотоводству. Илёс этим делом занимается более 10 лет и имеет большой опыт. Илёс некоторое время находился в России, но не смог найти подходящею работу для себя и вернулся на Родину и теперь продолжает свой бизнес скотоводством. Уже несколько лет он строит новый дом для семьи, но так как его доход маленький, он не имеет возможности достроить дом. Илёс запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки цемента, песка и т.п., чтобы достроить дом.
texts.en:
Ilyos is a hardworking young man.  He's a cattle farmer, and lives together with his wife and two children in a remote region of Tajikistan.  He spent some time in Russia looking for work, but couldn't find anything suitable, so he came back to his homeland to continue farming as before.  He has a lot of experience raising cattle; he's been at it for more than 10 years, typically buying cattle, fattening them for a few months, then selling them at a local  market.  His wife tends to their home in addition to helping Ilyos with the animals.

For the past few years, Ilyos has been building a new home for his family, but hasn't been able to save enough money to finish it.  He's seeking a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy cement, sand, and other building materials to complete the work on his home.

loans.use: buy building materials such as cement, sand, etc. to build a new house

loans.name: Hugo

texts.en: Hugo is a Guatemalan artisan who specializes in jewelry made of wood, bone, and horn. He would like to invest in the purchase of sterling silver earring hooks for his designs. Hugo has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is his story: "I was born and raised by loving parents in the department of Peten. Dad was a welder and I loved watching him work. I started working with him when I finished elementary school. When I was 15, I went to live with my uncle in Belize. He was such an amazing artisan! He taught me how to make things from what he found on the beach: coral, seashells, and more. He taught me how to make sculptures, jewelry, and decorative items from them. By the time I was 17 years old, I was already designing my own jewelry and when I was 20, my uncle encouraged me to start working on my own. I love handicrafts and I love what I do. My primary material is usually what people don't use, burn, or throw away, such as bull horns or cow bones, as well as chapay wood. It's impressive how waste can become a beautiful sculpture or an elegant piece of jewelry. I think a lot about today's youth and the impact that handicrafts may have on the ecology, and I believe now is the time to craft pieces that are eco-friendly." "Thanks for your support! This microcredit will allow me to invest in the raw materials I need. Use the link below to view Hugo's wood, bone, and horn jewelry on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/8206

loans.use: to purchase sterling silver earring hooks for his designs

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, es estudiante y se esta esforzando bastante para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Quiere recibirse para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos, ya que con ello podrá cumplir con su meta. Esta estudiando la carrera de bioquímica, y pide este préstamo para pagar sus cuotas y seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Fabiola is from the city of Caaguazú, is a student, and is working a lot to be able to grow and go forward.

She wants to graduate from school so that she can help her family and loves ones, since with this she will be able to achieve her goal. She is studying biochemistry, and she requests this loan to pay for her fees and to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is 42 years old and comes from Carles, Iloilo. She is married and has six children, ages 2 to 18. Maricris has relied upon her fishing business for 19 years, now, to support her family.

She is asking for a loan, which she will use to make a thorough repair of her damaged fishing boat. She will use her loan to buy plywood, paint, adhesive, a new engine, and nails, and to pay for labor. Maricris and her husband work hard to support their family’s needs, especially food and school fees for their children. In the future, she hopes to make her business bigger and live an abundant life, out of her livelihood.

loans.use: to overhaul her fishing boat, buying a new engine and materials, and paying for labor.

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.es:
Doña Prudencia es una clienta con mucha trayectoria, Emprendedora con mucha experiencia y carácter empresarial. Ha sabido identificar muy bien oportunidades de mercado, y tiene claridad en el servicio al cliente, actual o potencial, colocando al consumidor en el centro de su microempresa. Ella costurera y comerciante, vive con su esposo, una hija y su nieto, cuenta con el apoyo de su familia para los proyectos que emprende. Siempre ha demostrado buena moral de pago. 
Gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por Fundación Mujer, y la buena administración de los recursos, Doña Prudencia continúa fortaleciendo e innovando sus actividades productivas. Siempre con el objetivo claro de contribuir a su hogar y generar ingresos adicionales. El financiamiento será invertido en un nuevo proyecto familiar que es un abastecedor, esto le permite ampliar su gama de actividades y aumentar sus ingresos. 
Costurera desde hace muchos años, confecciona todos los trajes para las ocasiones especiales de la escuela de la comunidad,  uniformes para la entrada a clases, todo tipo de ropa a la medida como vestidos para primera comunión, graduaciones y otras actividades. También hace muchos años vende electrodomésticos,  y ya tiene su cartera de clientes muy bien establecida. Actualmente ella junto a su familia se hicieron cargo de un abastecedor en la misma comunidad, negocio ubicado en un buen punto comercial, que piensan mejorar y surtir con más productos para aumentar las ventas. Ella sabe administrar muy bien su tiempo, ya que va a continuar confeccionando esas prendas que tanto le solicitan.
texts.en:
Prudencia is a client with a long career, a businesswoman with a lot of experience, and an enterprising character. She has known how to identify very good opportunities in the market and has openness in her service to her actual or potential clients, putting the consumer at the center of her small business. She is a seamstress and businesswoman. She lives with her husband, a daughter, and her grandson. She counts on the support of her family for the projects she launches. She has always shown good morals for repayments.

Thanks to the loans given by Fundación Mujer and to the good management of the resources, Prudencia continues strengthening and innovating upon her productive activities. She always works with the goal of contributing to her household and generating additional income. The loan will be invested in a new family project for a grocery store. This will allow her to increase her range of activities and increase her income. 

She has been a seamstress for many years. She makes all of outfits for special occasions in the school and community, uniforms for schools, and all types of tailor-made clothing, including dresses for first communion, graduations, and other activities. She also has many years of experience selling electrical appliances, and she already has a set of very well-established clients. At present, she and her family have taken charge of a grocery store in their community. The business is located in a good commercial area. They plan to improve it and to stock more products to increase their sales. She knows how to manage her time very well, since she is going to continue making garments as requested.

loans.use: to buy groceries, drinks, cleaning products, personal care products, and other things for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel to plaster her house and repair the floor.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
DANAYA est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de TIELE. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne deux enfants. Elles mènent différentes activités  telles la vente dans le restaurant à l’image de DOUSSOU  qui est la première personne assise de la  gauche vers la droite  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TIELE dans la commune rurale dudit Sous-Préfecture de BAGUINEDA (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali).  
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités vente dans le restaurant : riz, haricot et viande. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a huit ans. Elles sont à leur dixième prêt solidaire. 
DOUSSOU, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à TIELE, excelle de la vente dans le restaurant. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de riz et une quantité importante de haricots et de la viande pour leur restaurant.  Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO, sur place  et vend ses aliments à TIELE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et  s’investir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Danaya is a [borrowers'] group of the Benkadi association of Tiele. It is composed of women who know each other as relatives and neighbors. On the average, they are 31 years old, married, with two children. They are engaged various activities, such as cooking food for sale, which is what Doussou does, for example. She is the first seated from left to right in the photo. The group members live in traditional extended families in Tiele, in a rural community of the same name, Baguineda Subprefecture, Koulikoro Region, Mali.

They have been working as vendors for a number of years and have a strong customer demand for their cooked food: rice, beans and meat.
In order to meet the growing demand, eight years ago the group members have decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their tenth solidarity loan.

Doussou, who is the group's leader and well-known in Tiele, excels at selling cooked food. She plans to use her loan to buy two bags of rice and a large quantity of beans and meat for her diner. She stocks up in Bamako and sells in Tiele, retail, for cash and on credit, to a mixed clientele.
She hopes to earn a monthly revenue of 40,000 West African francs, which will allow her to repay her loan and invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy food to cook for sale.

loans.name: Lidieth

texts.es:
Doña Lidieth tiene 50 años, vive en unión libre, hace más de 28 años, y tiene 3 hijos, todos mayores de edad, vive con su hija menor, una nieta y su compañero. Una mujer emprendedora, con carácter empresarial, y muy activa. Pese a su enfermedad crónica, problemas en su columna y una escoliosis importante, ella sigue con todos los deseos y la motivación necesaria para trabajar, y seguir contribuyendo a mejorar la economía familiar. Aunque es jubilada por incapacidad, no se detiene en sus actividades, ya que le gusta mucho lo que hace. Trabaja en costuras y manualidades, además es avicultora. 
 Ella tiene varios años de haber iniciado su negocio y con capital propio, su primer crédito es la oportunidad de invertir en materia prima y consolidar su negocio, para hacer más eficiente su producción. 
Doña Lidieth decidió emprender su actividad, ya que buscaba independencia económica, y aumentar los ingresos al núcleo familiar, se dio cuenta que su negocio es rentable, y que podía hacerle frente a sus gastos de salud, personales y de autocuido. 
Para el desarrollo de su actividad cuenta con el apoyo de su familia, desarrolla de forma paralela 2 actividades, la avicultura y la pequeña industria. Ella confecciona, cortinas, almohadones, edredones, juegos de baño, bolsos y muchas otras cosas. En cuanto a la cría y desarrollo de pollos, es continua,  la demanda es buena, siempre mantiene  pollos en diferentes etapas de su desarrollo. El crédito será invertido en materia prima, como lo es telas, hilos, elásticos, encajes,  y otros materiales para las costuras ya que tiene muchos encargos de cortinas y edredones que se venden muy bien para las temporadas de fin de año.
texts.en:
Lidieth is 50 years old, has been in a common-law marriage for more than 28 years, and has three adult children. She lives with her younger daughter, a granddaughter, and her partner. She is an enterprising woman, with a business-oriented character, and she is very active. Despite a chronic illness, problems in her spine, and scoliosis, she continues with all of her dreams, is motivated to work, and continues contributing to improve her family’s finances. Although she is retired because of a disability, she doesn’t stop her activities, since she likes what she does very much. She does sewing, crafts, and is a poultry farmer. 

It has been many years since she started her business with her own capital. Her first loan provides the opportunity to invest in raw materials and to consolidate her business to be more efficient in her production.

Lidieth decided to start her work since she was looking for financial independence and to increase her family’s income. She says that her business is profitable and would be able to withstand health-related, personal, and self-care expenses. 

As her business has grown, she has counted on the support of her family. Her business grew with two activities in parallel: poultry farming and small industry. She makes curtains, cushions, quilts, bath toys, bags, and many other things. Also, her work raising and growing chickens is continuing; the demand is good. She always maintains chickens in different stages of their growth. 

The loan will be invested in saw materials, such as fabric, thread, elastic, lace, and other materials for sewing, since she has many order for curtains and quilts, which sell very well because of the cold weather at the end of the year.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, including fabric, thread, elastic, lace, and other things for sewing.

loans.name: Runa

texts.en:
Runa is only 27 years old. She is a hard-working entrepreneur residing at a small village, Mauyamari, of Maynaguri in Jalpaiguri district. She is married and lives in a household of five members: she, her husband and three children (two sons and one daughter). All of her children attend primary school. They live in a small house which is made of mud, bamboo and straw and is lacking the basic amenities like water connection and electricity.

Runa's husband, Jiyarul, aged 34 years, works in a small cycle shop, but his income is low. Runa acknowledges the fact that the income from her husband's business is barely enough to meet the daily expenses. With three young kids to take care of and to provide them with good education, she started to rear cattle. She purchased a cow and supplies milk to her neighbors. Despite her childhood being ruined, as she could not get good education and only attended school till grade 7, she never gave up her fighting spirit and became financially independent. She is a young courageous woman who is willing to work harder.

She seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy a dairy cow and to increase her milk-supply business. One more cow means more milk to supply; thus, she can earn more profit. With the increased income and savings, Runa wants to provide higher educational facilities to her children, which she did not get in her childhood.

She gives her hearty thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her milk-supply business.

loans.name: Grechen Del Carmen

texts.es: Grechen del Carmen: Es una mujer luchadora, tiene 44 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad. Desde hace 25 años vive en una casa de concreto con 15 personas. Solicita financiamiento para construir anexo, que será utilizado como cuarto, con el propósito de reducir el hacinamiento. Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Grechen del Carmen is a tenacious woman. She is 44 years old, married, and has three children of legal age. For 25 years she has lived in a concrete house with 15 people. She is requesting funding in order to build on an addition, which will be used as a room with the intention of reducing overcrowding. Her dream is to improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to build on an addition, which will be used as a room.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen opened Gourmet Any Day (right next to Amesbury, MA city hall!) in 2013. She says, “I love to be able to offer fresh and healthy food to my friends and customers!” Even though Gourmet Any Day is a young dining spot, it has already started winning awards. It won North Shore Magazine’s Editor’s Pick for Best Prepared Food in 2014. 

Karen lives with her husband and two children and acknowledges that the largest difficulty in running Gourmet Any Day “is to manage the restaurant, family, and job at the same time.” Karen needs a loan to buy restaurant equipment to better store the fresh ingredients she uses. Ultimately, she would like to open a second location of the restaurant.

loans.use: to buy restaurant equipment

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.en:
Suzanne has close to 30 years of experience in construction accounting and administration. In June 2014, she opened AEF Consulting Inc. Suzanne says, “Being able to have the flexibility and freedom to do it and make real contributions to different contractors is extremely satisfying.” Suzanne supports her daughter, who recently started college.

While Suzanne does not have formal training, she overcomes this difficult through her practical experience. “My clients figure out quickly, experience is the greatest teacher in this business.” She takes great pride when her current clients refer to her as the “best in the business.”

To help her business grow, Suzanne needs a loan to purchase a laptop and a printer/scanner/copier and to develop a marketing strategy. She is excited to work with Accion and Kiva: “After reviewing what Kiva does, I think it’s awesome. I hope to be able to help other one day through this program.” In keeping with Suzanne's compassion towards others, she says “My professional goals include the implementation of a program for single moms trying to provide a decent quality of life for their kids.”

loans.use: to purchase new computer equipment

loans.name: Putul

texts.en:
Putul is a 48-year-old married woman. She lives in Tekatuli in Maynaguri, Jalpaiguri district of West Bengal. She is the loving mother of two children: a son and a daughter.  Both are students of different grades in a local village school. Her husband is a farmer whose income hardly covers the basic needs of the family.

Putul has been running a business of selling milk for many years. She sells milk to many of their neighbors, along with the butter, curds and other dairy products that she makes from the milk in her home. In this way, she earns a good amount of income to contribute to the family fund. With her strong determination and dedication, she has gradually improved her business. Currently, she needs to purchase another cow. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

In order to expand her business, she wants to purchase a cow, and for that she needs money.

So she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). She will utilize the loan for purchasing another cow, and she hopes to improve her milk-supply business. It will provide her a steady income to tide them over rough patches and allow them to save up for their children's education and future.

She is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her dairy business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John came to the US a few years ago from Colombia. This year, he decided to use his extensive experience with video technology to open a digital production company. He produces Spanish-language audiovisual content for major media outlets as well as the Colombian consulate. 

John is most proud of “seeing how much my business has taken off in such a short period of time.” However, there have been some growing pains. John notes his biggest difficulty is “finding financing because I don’t have any credit.”

John needs a loan to purchase some new equipment and establish credit in the US.

loans.use: to purchase new audiovisual equipment

loans.name: Malati

texts.en:
Twenty-two-year-old Malati hails from Maynaguri, in Jalpaiguri district. She is married and a mother of one toddler. She gives financial support to her family by rearing cows. Her husband is a fish retailer and sells fish in the market, but his income is not sufficient to manage all the household expenses of the family. 

Malati rears a dairy cow and sells the milk in her locality. She, hence, feels the need to have a better income and thereby higher savings to stabilize her financial condition.

She moved to BJS (Kiva’s partner) for a loan to purchase a dairy cow. There is always a demand for cow milk, and she believes her monthly income will increase through this purchase. The loan will enable Malati and her family to have a secure and dignified life and the best education for her children.

She is thankful to the lenders for this financial support.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to expand her milk-supply business.

loans.name: Sampa

texts.en:
Twenty-three-year-old Sampa is a woman of audacity and strength. She hails from Maynaguri in Jalpaiguri district, West Bengal. She is married to Manoranjan and blessed with one little son.

Sampa's husband is associated with a mineral water supply business. Sampa decided to give support to her husband financially, thus Sampa wants to sell cow milk to her neighbors. By running her own business, she will be able to support her family and save for a secure future. However, this young ambitious and energetic lady does not want to stop here; now she wants to start her business by selling milk products like butter, curds and cottage cheese along with the milk. Thus, she needs to buy one more cow.

Thus, Sampa applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy a new dairy cow. With this business loan, she is expecting an increase in her business income. With the increased income and savings, Sampa will be able to reach her goal, which includes constructing a new and better house, and to provide a better education for her son.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva for this monetary support.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to start a milk product supply business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies and equipment for her cleaning and errands business

loans.name: Afrose

texts.en:
Afrose is a young entrepreneur, hailing from Dhupguri.  She is a 22-year-old independent woman. She lives with her family of four members in Altagram village in the district of Jalpaiguri, West Bengal.  Her husband Aaliul is a mason by profession.  She has two young children.

She was compelled to leave her education after ninth grade due to the poor economic resources of her family.  Instead of resigning to her fate, she fought hard to regain her dignity. She works hard in her own animal husbandry, which she started after her marriage to support her family. Rearing cattle is a very common occupation in these parts of West Bengal, and she wants to benefit from the growth prospects this business has to offer. She rears one cow and supplies milk to her locality. She wants to increase her household income so she now seeks to buy a new milking cow and expand her business. 

She has sought a loan from BJS (Kiva's field partner) to purchase a cow and hopes to earn better to strengthen her family economy and provide her children with good food, health, and education. She aspires to purchase a car with the profit from the business.

She thanks her generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her dairy business.

loans.name: Chintamani

texts.en:
Chintamani is a 38-year-old woman. She is from the remote village of West Magurmari in Jalpaiguri district. She is married to Kamal. Both Chintamani  and her husband studied up to grade 4. They are raising one daughter and one son. Both attend school.

Chintamani 's husband is an enterprising man who is engaged in a business of selling Ayurvedic medicine (medicine made from medicinal plants and herbs). He thinks it a profitable business. He learned about Ayurvedic Medicine from his father, who was an Ayurvedic doctor.  Ayurvedic medicine has got a very good potential, having much demand in the market. What they need to do is to invest more to purchase medicine in a bulk quantity, but they lack the capital.

She is requesting the loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase medicines from the medicine wholesalers. With the development of the business, she hopes to rent a shop in the local market. She hopes the loan will enable her to fulfill her dream.

Her dream is to expand her business in order to strengthen the family's economy. She is really grateful to the lenders (BJS and Kiva) for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more Ayurvedic medicine for business.

loans.name: Jurabek

texts.ru: Чурабек молодой и целеустремленный человек. Он родился в 1991 году. Чурабек женаи и живет вместе с семьей в сельской местности. У них большая семья. Чурабек с ранних лет помогал родителям по скотоводству и выращивания картофеля. Итак, он имеет большой опыт в этой сфере. Чурабек каждый год выращивает картофель на 1 га земле. Он обратился за займом на сумме 5000 сомони для покупки компьютера для своего брата. Его брат учится в средней школе и нуждается в компьютере, чтобы изучать новые технологии и учить больше литературы с интернета. Чурабек ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Jurabek is young and goal-oriented.  He was born in 1991.  He is married and lives with his family in a rural area.  He comes from a large family. Ever since he was very young, he started helping his parents to take care of the livestock and to cultivate potatoes.  This is how he acquired quite a deal of experience in this field of work. Every year, he grows potatoes on one hectare of land.  He is taking a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy a computer for his brother who is a secondary school student.  His brother needs a computer in order to get familiar with the new technologies and to read more literature on the internet.  Jurabek is awaiting your kindness and relying on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a computer for his brother.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 2 animals from which she hopes to have income in the period of a year.

loans.name: Yulduz

texts.ru: Юлдуз молодая и целеустремленная женщина. Она живет вместе со своим маленьким сыном в отдаленном регионе. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Она в течение 4 лет занимается скотоводством. Юлдуз также выращивает картофель. Она продает на местном рынке полученный урожай. Она также продает молоко местным жителям. Ее рабочий день начинается с раннего утра. Юлдуз собирается проводить церемонию обрезания своего сына и поэтому она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Yulduz is a young, goal-oriented woman.  She lives with her son, who is still very small, in a remote area of Tajikistan.  Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia.  Yulduz has been involved in animal husbandry for four years.  Additionally she grows potatoes, and sells her harvest at the local market.  She also sells milk to the local residents and works from dawn.  She is getting ready to hold a ceremony for her son's circumcision, and for this purpose she is taking a loan of 4,000 somoni.  She is awaiting your kindness and relying on your generosity.

loans.use: to hold a ceremony for her son's circumcision.

loans.name: Dimas Israel

texts.es:
Dimas de 56 años de edad, no estudio sus padres nunca lo mandaron a la escuela ya que desde niño lo ocuparon en actividades de trabajo, su esposa tiene una pequeña tienda, vive con 3 nietos menores de edad.                                                                                                                                                   

Dimas tiene 10 años de experiencia en manejo de ganado de pasto, oficio que aprendió por la misma necesidad de subsistencia junto a su familia, también se dedica a la pesca artesanal para la cual camina 2 Km a pie.                                                                                                                 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una vaca lechera, con esto espera obtener leche para alimentar a su familia.                                                                                                                             

Dimas sueña con que sus nietas se puedan graduar como profesionales, y para lograrlo trabajara muy duro
texts.en:
Dimas is 56 years old. He did not study; his parents never sent him to school. Therefore, he has worked from a young age. His wife has a small store, and he lives with 3 young grandchildren.                                                                                                                                          

Dimas has 10 years of experience with cattle grazing, a job he learned alongside his family due to necessity. He also works in artisanal fishing, for which he walks 2 kilometers on foot.                                                                                                               

The loan he is asking for is to buy a dairy cow, with which he hopes to obtain milk to feed his family. Dimas' dream is for his granddaughters to graduate as professionals, and to achieve this, he will work very hard.

loans.use: to feed a dairy cow, with which he hopes to obtain milk to feed his family.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen De Yuncaypata Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YUNCAYPATA” de la Asociación Arariwa y viven en el distrito de Cusco de la provincia del Cusco, Perú. 

La socia Tisalia continua dedicándose al negocio de crianza de animales como  chanchos, cuyes y pollos, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan como en las diferentes ferias que se realizan por la zona, la socia a la vez continua estudiando en una de las universidades de a ciudad del Cusco, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de eta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de cuyes entre otros.
Los demás socios se dedican a la ganadería, a la agricultura, a la venta de comida, crianza de animales menores.
Los socios agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "Virgen del Carmen Yuncaypata" of the Arariwa Association. They live in the district of Cusco in Cusco, Perú. Tisalia, a member, continues to work in the business of raising animals such as pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens. The member raises these small animals to sell them later to her clients, who buy them at different fairs throughout the area. The member continues studying at one of the universities in the city of Cusco, and she hopes to be able to continue working in order to keep helping her family.

The member asks for a loan to buy guinea pigs (a food source) and other animals. The other members work with livestock, in agriculture, in food sales, and to raise small animals. The members thank those who are a part of this dream through this medium, and promise to fulfill the payments of their quotes in the time allotted.

The person with the covered face does not belong to the communal bank.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs (a food source) and other animals.

loans.name: Putul

texts.en:
Putul is a 46-year-old married woman. By occupation her husband is a farmer who grows different kinds of vegetables. They are raising together their two sons with love and care.  Putul lives in a small village Takatuli, in Maynaguri of the Jalpaiguri District. 

Her husband’s income is too low to run his family smoothly and to care for their only son. Like every mother, Putul also dreams to give her best to her child and so she plans to do something on her own. Now they plan to grow radishes in their farmland to generate more income. They choose this vegetable as there is a great demand for this vegetable in their area and it is the best season to grow radishes.  

Putul has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy farm supplies like seeds, fertilizers, manure, etc., to grow radishes. She hopes that now her financial condition will improve with this farming. She is really thankful and grateful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies like seeds, fertilizers, etc., to grow radishes.

loans.name: Soma

texts.en:
Soma is 30 years old and the proud mother of a very young son. Soma and her husband are bachelor's degree holders. She stays with her husband and son in Maynaguri in rural West Bengal. 

Soma’s husband is associated with the kitchen chimney business. He purchases kitchen chimneys from a wholesale retailer and sells them to local people. Soma also assists her husband in this business after managing her household works. Now they want to expand their business and decided to take a loan with nominal repayment conditions which can help them to expand their existing business. 

For this reason, Soma has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BJS. Soma’s husband is a well-educated person so he may able to review the present trends of fashion and current market rate. This will help him to think differently to develop his business with the Kiva’s loan. Soma is thankful to Kiva and BJS for this financial help. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to their business.

loans.use: To purchase kitchen chimneys (stove vents) to expand their existing business.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel de 31 años de edad, estudio 5ª grado, esta acompañado, su compañera se dedica al oficio del hogar tiene 3 hijas de 12, 11, y 8 años, ellas estudian 4ª y la menor estudian 1ª grado 


Miguel no tiene un trabajo formal, por lo que todo los días trabaja en diferentes actividades, para ganar unos $ 5 dolares por día para la comida de su familia .


Miguel solicita a CREDICAMPO, para la perforación de un paso, del cual obtendrá agua para el consumo de su familia ya que don de vive no hay agua potable.


Miguel sueña con ver a sus 3 hijas graduarse como profesionales, por eso piensa trabajar muy duro y ahorrar dinero.
texts.en:
Miguel is 31 years old, went to school until the fifth grade, and has a partner who makes a living as a homemaker. He has three daughters, ages 12, 11, and 8. They are in the fourth year of school, and the youngest is in the first grade. 

Miguel does not have a formal job, and as such every day he works on different jobs in order to earn about $5 per day for food for his family. 

Miguel is requesting CREDICAMPO in order to drill a well, of which he will obtain water for his family, as where he currently lives does not have drinkable water. 

Miguel dreams of seeing his three daughters graduate, becoming professionals, which is why he plans to work very hard and save money.

loans.use: to drill a well, of which he will obtain water for his family, as where he currently lives does not have drinkable water.

loans.name: Geyddy Barbara

texts.es: Geyddy: Es una mujer joven, alegre, trabajadora, tiene 28 años de edad, madre soltera de un pequeño. Con el propósito de mejorar su vivienda y cubrir gastos universitarios, solicita su segundo financiamiento. Su sueño es terminar su carrera de Derecho, para brindarle  su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Geyddy is a young, happy, hardworking woman. She's 28 years old and the single mother of a small child. 

With the goal of improving her home and covering university fees, she's seeking her second loan. Her dream is to finish her law degree to give her son a better quality of life.

loans.use: to improve her home and cover university expenses.

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en:
Joseline is 36 years old. She is married with three children aged between 11 and 6 years, all of whom go to school. 

She has a shop and has been selling in a business for seven years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice and sugar for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used for welfare and to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more rice and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 36 years old. She is married with three children aged between 14 and 4 years, all of whom go to school. 

She has a salon and has been working in a business for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more hair-cutting machines in order to get more equipment to be used. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more hair-cutting machines

loans.name: Manchana

texts.en:
Manchana is an innovative woman of 35 years from the small village of Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is married and a mother of four children (two sons and two daughters). Two of them attend school and two are below school-going age.

Her husband is engaged in the betel nut business. Manchana has been practicing cattle breeding for many years to give sustenance to her family through dairy.  She finds dairy farming enjoyable and profitable.  She has a dairy cow.  She supplies milk from door to door to her neighbors. In order to increase her business she needs to purchase one more cow.  But the biggest challenge she faces is limited funds.

Manchana is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow.  It will produce enough milk to enable her to supply more and satisfy her customers, thus earn more.  So she has taken a loan from BJS.  The loan will greatly help her to organize her business in more effective ways. She wants to assist her husband economically and educate her children properly to establish them in their life.

She gives her heartiest thanks to her lenders BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her existing milk supply business.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is from Kapan city of the Syunik region, where she lives with her 28-year-old son. She has been engaged in clothing sales for three years. 

Now she wants to enlarge her business with the help of a Kiva loan. Anahit sells a very nice assortment of baby clothes, bedding and covers, towels, toys, and shoes. For all this she has a great number of loyal customers, whom she is always happy and ready to help with choices among the great variety. 

Her son helps her in business, especially in the process of bringing in new products for selling. Anahit asks for this loan to be able to purchase  new stock of clothing for winter season to sell to customers. 

She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business startup loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing for winter season to sell to customers

loans.name: Las Flores Group

texts.es:
Fortunata es una mujer de 41 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 22 años y su negocio es la venta de pollo frito.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, luchadora, fuerte, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en el barrio ‘plan 3000’ una zona caracterizada por el crecimiento constante del comercio en todas las áreas.
Fortunata es de tez morena, estatura baja, cabello negro largo trenzado, su forma de vestir es típica (manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español para el comercio (parada al centro de todos). Debido a su necesidad de trabajar en su negocio propio, formó una banca de personas con negocios diferentes y necesidades similares para solicitar un préstamo. Su negocio es la venta de pollo frito; ella realiza la compra de pollo, lo sazona y lo fríe, junto a otros acompañamientos como arroz y papas fritas, labor que realiza de lunes a domingo sin descanso en su puesto de venta. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como transportista y su hijo que se dedica al estudio técnico en informática. Ella sueña con tener un local propio, amplio para brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Su deseo es ampliar su negocio realizando la compra de una cocina y cuatro juegos de mesas y sillas, los beneficios que obtenga los utilizará para incrementar su capital de trabajo y agrandar su negocio.
Es por esos motivos que Fortunata solicita un préstamo para la compra de cocina y cuatro mesas y sillas para su puesto de venta de comida.
texts.en:
Fortunata is a 41 year-old woman. She lives with her partner. She has 22 year-old son, and her business is selling fried chicken.
She is entrepreneurial, independent, feisty, strong, responsible and hardworking. She does her work in the neighborhood "Plan 3000" a zone known for its constant commercial growth in all areas.
Fortunata is of dark complexion and short stature, has long black braided hair and is wearing traditional clothing (apron and skirt). Her mother tongue is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish for business (common to everyone). Due to the need to work on her own business, she formed a bank of people with different businesses and similar needs to request a loan. Her business is the sale of fried chicken; She purchases the chicken, seasons it and fries it together with other sides like rice and french fries. She does this work Monday through Sunday tirelessly at her stall. She shares her life with her partner that works as a driver, and her son who is a student of technology. She dreams of having her own shop, growing to provide more comfort to her customers. Her desire is to grow her business making the purchase of a kitchen and 4 sets of tables and chairs. The benefits she will have are utilizing them to increase her working capital and to grow her business.
It is for these reasons that Fortunata is requesting a loan to buy a kitchen and four table and chairs for her stall selling food.

loans.use: to buy a kitchen and 4 tables and chairs for her stand selling food.

loans.name: Ana Del Milagro

texts.es:
Ana de 48 años de edad, es ama de casa y su nivel de estudio fue hasta el quinto grado no siguió estudiando ya que no le interesaba mucho aprender y decidió acompañarse en donde procreo 4 hijos de 30, 28, 26 y 24 años de edad de los cuales ya solo uno se encuentra con ella los demás ya tienen su propio trabajo por lo tanto ya no dependen de ella.

 Ana vive con un hijo y un sobrino que esta cuidando, ahora en día es una mujer soltera ya que su compañero de vida decidió alejarse del hogar.

Ana se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y al cuido de su sobrino, ya que por eso ella recibe ayuda para la alimentación diaria y para sus gastos.

El crédito que esta solicitando, es para la compra de materiales de construcción como cemento, grava, arena, tablas y para pago de mano de obra ya que necesita mejorar su vivienda.

El sueño de Ana es que su hijo siga estudiando para que sea profesional, tener 3 animales y tener una granja de pollos de engorde.
texts.en:
Ana, 48 years old, is a housewife. She studied until 5th grade and did not continue studying as it didn't interest her, and she decided to get married. She now has 4 children ages 30, 28, 26, and 24 years old, of which only one is with her. The rest have their own work and for the most part do not depend on her.

Ana lives with her son and a nephew that is in her care. Today she is a single woman as her life partner decided to move away from home.

Ana takes care of the household and cares for her nephew, as for this she receives help for the daily food and expenses.

The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of construction materials like cement, gravel, sand, tables and to pay for manual labor that she needs to improve her housing.

Ana's dream is that her son continues studying to be a professional, to have 2 animals, and to have a farm raising chickens.

loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, sand, tables and to pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeannette is 33 years old. She is married with 2 children aged between 10 and 6 years old, all of them in school. She has a bar and has been selling in this business for the past year. 

After getting her loan, she would like to buy more beer to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: To buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: Zulma Yessenia

texts.es:
Zulma de 22 años de edad, es ama de casa y su nivel de estudio fue hasta el tercer grado, y no siguió estudiando para ayudarle a su madrecita en el negocio, ya que su padre se puso bien mal de salud y no pudo continuar trabajando con el tiempo su padre murió y ahora solo vive con su madre, esta soltera, no tiene hijos.

Zulma se dedica a la venta ambulante desde hace 10 años de verduras, carnes y frutas de casa en casa, trabajo que lo aprendió de su madre quien siempre se ha dedicado a esto, trabaja en el horario de 8:00 am a 11:00 am todos los días y tambien realiza cultivos de maíz.

El préstamo que se esta solicitando, es para comprar mas frutas y verduras para surtir mas la venta y así poder satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes y obtener mas ingresos para la alimentación y tendrán una mejor calidad de vida.

El sueño de Zulma es tener un negocio estable y dejar de andar vendiendo de casa en casa, y pagar las cuotas de su crédito sin ninguna inconveniente.
texts.en:
Zulma, 22 years old, is a homemaker. She studied until the third grade and did not continue studying to help her mother with the business, as her father was in poor health and couldn't continue working. With time, her father died and now she only lives with her mother. She is single and does not have children.

Zulma has sold vegetables, meat, and fruits door to door on foot for 10 years. She learned the work from her mother who has always done this for a living. She works on a schedule of 8:00 AM to 11:00 AM every day and also cultivates maize.

The loan that she is requesting is to purchase more fruits and vegetables to supply more sales and satisfy the needs of her customer to obtain more income for food and to have a better quality of life.

Zulma's dream is to have a stable business and stop selling door to door and to easily make her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to supply more sales.

loans.name: José Medardo

texts.es:
José de 45 años de edad, es jornalero y estudio hasta el cuarto grado no siguió estudiando porque no le gustaba y mejor decidió trabajar para ayudar a su familia en los gastos del hogar, esta acompañado y es padre de 2 hijos los cuales están estudiando.

José vive con su compañera de vida, su madrecita y sus dos hijos. Su compañera de vida se dedica a la siembra de maíz (agricultura) para el consumo propio también se dedica al cuido de sus animales trabajo que lo aprendió de sus padres.

El crédito solicitado en credicampo, es para comprar un toro para que cargue sus vacas y así podrá incrementar sus animalitos y durante un periodo lograra obtener un poco mas de ingresos para el sustento de su familia.

El sueño de José es tener más animales y que sus hijos estudien mucho.
texts.en:
José, 45 years old, is a laborer and studied until the fourth grade. He did not continue studying because he didn't like it, and decided it was better to work to help his family with the household expenses. He is in a common law marriage and is the father of 2 children who are studying.

José lives with his life partner, his mother, and his two children. His wife grows maize for a living for their own consumption. He also cares for the animals, work that he learned from his parents.

The loan requested from CrediCampo is to buy a bull to breed his cows and therefore he will be able to increase his young animals and after a time he will be able to obtain a little more income to sustain his family.

José's dream is to have more animals and for his children to go far in their studies.

loans.use: to buy a bull to breed his cows.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en: Immaculee is 30 years old. She is married with three children aged between seven and four years old and all of them go to school. She sells clothes and has been doing this business for eight years. With the loan, she would like to buy more t-shirts and trousers to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and welfare.

loans.use: to buy more t-shirts and trousers to sell

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is 30 years old. She is married with 4 children aged between 13 and 3 years, all of them go to school. She sells local drinks and has been doing so for 4 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum for making more local drinks for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum for making more local drinks for sale.

loans.name: Simion

texts.en:
Simion is a dairy farmer based in Koyo village in the North Rift region of Kenya, which is a primary milk producing area. He resides with his gorgeous wife, Jepkemboi, and 4 children. His primary income source is milk.

He has only been farming for a period of 1 year but he enjoys everything about it. He is looking to establish himself as a farmer and also diversify into other areas such as poultry farming. 

Simion is seeking a loan of KES 65,000 to purchase dairy feed and poultry. He is currently feeding his cow locally grown grass from his compound. This works well for most farmers but not for Simion. He feels that key ingredients are lacking in single source of nutrition. He is going to use your loan to purchase more nutritious feed to keep his cow healthy. 

Simion will also spend the money to acquire poultry. The hens will not only provide food for his family but also produce eggs for sale. Besides, his wife and children would love the liveliness that the hens will bring to the compound. 

When asked, ""How will this loan benefit your family?", Simion replied, "Income and food security."

loans.use: to purchase dairy feed and poultry

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 37 years old. She is married with three children aged between 6 and 10 years; all of them go to school. She sells foodstuffs and has been doing this business for 10 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more potatoes and cassava for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes and cassava for sale.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.en:
Nicolas and his family were very enthusiastic when they heard about the opportunity to purchase a 12 cubic meter biodigester. They raise animals and grow crops on their small farm and see the biodigester as a tool to close the natural cycle of their daily work. Producing biogas and biofertilizer from their animals' feces allows them to transform what they considered as waste into renewable energy to cook and heat bathwater, as well as into potent organic fertilizer to improve the productivity of their crops in a natural way. 

They will progressively be able to fully displace the expensive LP gas and chemical fertilizers they currently rely on, saving money while reducing their carbon footprint and improving hygiene on their farm (no more waste piling up outside, less flies and risk of disease contamination).

This loan represents 48% of the total cost of the Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a 12 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Devorah is the coordinator of the group Nuevo Amanecer (New Dawn) 1, 2 & 3, located in the city of Samana, in one of the rural areas surrounded by the water of the Atlantic ocean. Many of the members are selling goods like shoes, clothing, food or cosmetics. Others sell seafood, run fried food stalls and other businesses.

Devorah lives together with her family. She is still single and has no children. She is selling miscellaneous products like clothes, cosmetics, nail brushes, and other items. This is her sixth loan with Esperanza International and she will invest it to increase her inventory. Devorah will buy new clothes, different cosmetics and nails accessories, etc. She said that her most difficult challenge was to get capital to start her business and thanks to the Lord, her neighbors, and Esperanza, this can be possible. She is hoping to make her dreams come true: to have a prosperous life and a good business. She thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy miscellaneous products like clothes, cosmetics, nail accessories, etc., to sell

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en:
Her name is Virgincita, 38, a resident of Malibay, Pasay City, Philippines. Married to Rogelio, she manages her own household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income for their daily household needs 

Virgincita is into a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct-selling brands like Natasha and Boardwalk. Dealers buy the products at a lower price shown on the catalogue of the customers and sell them at a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, friends, family and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 400 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales a day.

To help her sustain her business, she is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy merchandise items and orders of beauty products, footwear and undergarments for her customers. Filipinos prefer to buy these branded personal goods for their good quality. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return of her investment and for the financial help that will be given her. 

Virginicita hopes to grow her business for a better future. She dreams to live a quiet life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for beauty products and footwear to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is 27 years old and married with 5 children. 

She owns and operates a small store selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 5 years. Helena needs a loan to buy 2 large display fridges, a chest freezer, canned food, frozen goods, snacks, drinks, bags of flour, sugar and salt. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy 2 large display fridges, a chest freezer, canned food, frozen goods, snacks, drinks, bags of flour, sugar and salt

loans.name: La Union Group

texts.en:
Ezequiel is the coordinator of his group, La Union (The Union). This group consists of 15 micro-entrepreneurs located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris, where Ezequiel makes his home in a simple structure with his long-term partner and one of his nine children. His most difficult challenge consists of working hard to provide for his family and support his children. 

Ezequiel has sold food for around five years, having started the business with his own savings. He is running a food store called a colmado, where he sells goods for daily meals to his neighbors. 

He is excited to be taking his fifth loan with Esperanza International, with which he will use to purchase rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, vegetables, flour, etc. Ezequiel will reinvest the profits in his business to improve it more and save some for any family needs that may arise. He also wants to save and have a prosperous business. 

He thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, vegetables, flour, etc.

loans.name: Vaelua

texts.en:
Vaelua is 40 years old and married with 6 children. 

She owns and operates a small store selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 5 years. Vaelua needs a loan to buy frozen goods, snacks, drinks, a display fridge, shoes, clothes, new hanging scales and a chest freezer. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy frozen goods, snacks, drinks, a display fridge, shoes, clothes, new hanging scales and a chest freezer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to upgrade her daycare center with laminate flooring and technology

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Though he is youthful in appearance, Christopher already has the trappings of a consummate businessman. Currently pursuing an associate’s degree in accounting, Christopher was crunching the numbers on several potential business ventures when he began to consider auto detailing. He noted the low overhead, with high margins and fixed expenses that can be resold for 50% of full retail were the business to go under. Despite his inexperience in the industry, Christopher decided to pursue the business.

Christopher likes to throw himself headlong into a new venture, and he isn’t afraid to face novel challenges. In addition to being an outsider to the auto detailing industry and facing stiff competition from established businesses run by experienced professionals, his main challenge has been in marketing and getting his name out. Rather than being discouraged by these difficulties, Christopher sees them as learning experiences, and he is always on the lookout for new ways to get new customers without being overly aggressive.

Christopher initially sought business financing not because he didn’t have the cash on hand to self-finance, but as an opportunity to learn how larger businesses run in a smaller-scale environment. He will use his Kiva loan to purchase necessary equipment, including a power washer, power generator, vacuum, water tank, and soaps, as well as to pay licensing costs. 

With the help of generous Kiva lenders, Christopher will embark on a lifetime of learning and entrepreneurship.

loans.use: to purchase necessary equipment, including a power washer, power generator, vacuum, water tank, and soaps, as well as to pay licensing costs

loans.name: Faatali

texts.en:
Faatali is 45 years old and married with 5 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 7 years. 

Faatali needs a loan to buy bags of flour, frozen goods, canned foods, cigarettes, matches, drinks, snacks and a display fridge. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2007 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, frozen goods, canned foods, cigarettes, matches, drinks, snacks and a display fridge.

loans.name: Matavai

texts.en:
Matavai is 74 years old and a widow with 5 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 7 years. 

Matavai needs a loan to help renovate her house and also re-stock her shop, she'll buy iron roofing sheets, bags of cement, timber, bricks and atso stock for her shop. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2007 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy iron roofing sheets, bags of cement, timber, bricks for house repair and also stock for her shop.

loans.name: Susitina

texts.en:
Susitina is a 40 year old married woman with 5 children. She runs a small canteen in her community and also a bakery to earn extra income. She has 4 years of experience with this business. 

Susitina needs a loan to buy bags of flour, a boiler, sugar, a barrel of cooking oil, large pots, chairs, tables and a large chest freezer. She plans to use her profits to expand her 2 businesses and also help with her family's weekly expenses. 

Susitina has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, a boiler, sugar, a barrel of cooking oil, large pots, chairs, tables and a large chest freezer

loans.name: Asolima

texts.en:
Asolima is 33 years old and married with 4 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

Asolima needs a loan to buy a new fridge, a freezer, snacks, frozen goods, a hanging scale, bags of flour, sugar and salt. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new fridge, a freezer, snacks, frozen goods, a hanging scale, bags of flour, sugar and salt

loans.name: Winny

texts.en:
Winny is a factory worker. She is from Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines and she has two children. She is one of the beneficiaries of the employment program of CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Winny works as a Garment Production Worker. She plays an important role in the garment making process, from cutting to sewing, pressing, packing, tagging and shipping.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Winny is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses, and they have no access to savings or credit, a situation that has made them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral.

For this reason, Winny is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to any loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem in repaying since the loan payment is being deducted every pay day. She looks forward to your positive response and any help from you will surely be of great help. She will use the loan to pay for her children’s educational needs and other expenses.

Winny hopes to be always healthy and strong.  She wants to give her children a better life and future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work.

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to pay for the educational needs of her children and other expenses.

loans.name: Astra

texts.ru: Астра успешно погасила предыдущий кредит, использовав его по назначению, и получила бонусный возврат 5%. Она очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем инвесторам, помогшим ей в финансировании. У Астры в прошлом году родился сын. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Астры есть 1 дойная корова, 2 теленка и 5 овец. Благодаря доходам от животноводческой деятельности ей удалось построить дом для своей семьи. Ежемесячная прибыль Астры составляет около 16,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 лошади и 1 коровы. Доходы от кредита Астра будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Astra successfully repaid her previous loan after using it as intended and making in return a 5% profit.  She is very grateful to Kiva and to all its lenders who financed this loan.  Last year Astra also had a baby boy.  Her animal husbandry business now consists of one dairy cow, two calves and five sheep.  Thanks to the earnings generated through this activity,  she was able to build a house for her family.  Astra makes a monthly income of about 16,000 som (KGS).  She has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase one horse and one cow.  She plans to re-invest the earnings from her loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase one horse and one cow in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Rosina

texts.en:
Rosina has worked at the same taco shop in San Diego for the past 16 years, working her way up to managing the shop and literally becoming the face that all of its loyal customers remember when they come to eat. So when the opportunity came up to take over the shop from its previous owner, she knew that she couldn’t pass it up.

Pulling together what little funds she had, she took over the shop and immediately changed its name to Rosy’s Mexican Food to reflect her new ownership. She kept the shop’s existing seven employees and committed to continue offering the same high-quality food to their loyal customers. Her long time presence in the community is clear, as she greets regulars by name when they walk in the door.

Though she’s been operating the shop with consistent revenues for the past four months, Rosina realized that she would need some additional capital to really take the business to the next level.  She will use her Kiva loan to stabilize cash flow as well as make some improvements to the signage of the shop and run some marketing campaigns. 

She hopes to continue to grow the shop's revenue, and eventually branch out to opening new shops, training her employees in managing their own shops.

loans.use: to stabilize her cash flow, make some improvements to the signage of the shop and run some marketing campaigns

loans.name: Lyneth

texts.en:
Lyneth is a resident of Dasmariñas Cavite, Philippines. She has a child and she is working in a garment factory. She was employed through the assistance of Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Lyneth is a Quality Control Officer.
