She inspects garments, such as men's denim bottoms, during manufacturing operations to determine the number of defects per worker and reasons for rejects by examiners. She counts the number of pattern parts, layers of cloth prior to cutting, number of stitches per inch during sewing operations and collects other measurement knowledge.

One of the main dilemmas of employees, like Lyneth, is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses and they have no access to savings or credit, a situation that makes them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who captured their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collaterals. 

For this reason, Lyneth is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to any loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem in returning it back since the loan payment is being deducted every pay day. She looks forward to your positive response and any help from you will surely be of great help. She will use the loan for her child’s education and also to help her extended family who is in need.

Lyneth wants to be always efficient and productive in her workplace. She dreams of giving her family a better future through all her hard work. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects.  The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families.  Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conducts fellowship meeting for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre and post working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to pay for the educational needs of her child and also to help her extended family.

loans.name: Peniamina

texts.en: Peniamina is 24 years old and single with no children. He has a small vegetable garden where he grows cabbages and tomatoes that he can sell in his community or at the market. He has been doing this for five years. Peniamina needs a loan to buy a new watering hose, chemicals, insect repellent, sprayers, a machete and a tiller. He has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Peniamina will use the profits from his sales to pay for his family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new watering hose, chemicals, insect repellent, sprayers, a machete and a tiller

loans.name: Matauaina

texts.en: Matauaina is a 40 year old woman who is unmarried with four children. She has a small business sewing business and to earn extra income, she also has a small plantation. She has been doing this for 10 years. Matauaina needs a loan to buy two new sewing machines, material, chemicals, a machete, a tiller, a spade and gloves. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Matauaina joined SPBD in 2004 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy two new sewing machines, material, chemicals, a machete, a tiller, a spade and gloves

loans.name: Upu

texts.en: Upu is 33 years old and married with two children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for four years. Upu needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, new gloves, a spade, new overalls and a sprayer. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Upu will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, new gloves, a spade, new overalls and a sprayer

loans.name: Iulai

texts.en: Iulai is a 58-year-old married woman with six children. She makes and sells fine mats and also makes German buns and pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has five years of experience with this business. Iulai needs a loan to buy a small weaving table, a large new outdoor stove, bags of flour, cooking oil, icing sugar, a new frying pan, yeast and brown sugar. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Iulai has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy a small weaving table, a large new outdoor stove, bags of flour, cooking oil, icing sugar, a new frying pan, yeast and brown sugar

loans.name: Mu

texts.en: Mu is 45 years old and married with five children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. Mu needs a loan to buy a spade, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, fertilizer, gloves and overalls. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Mu will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a spade, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, fertilizer, gloves and overalls

loans.name: Faasalafa

texts.en: Faasalafa is 51 years old and married with two children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for three years. Faasalafa needs a loan to buy drinks, frozen goods, canned items, bags of flour, sugar and salt. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy drinks, frozen goods, canned items, bags of flour, sugar and salt

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
This is Samson. He is thankful for the financial assistance that was extended to him as he was able to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business. His earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another loan, this time amounting to 26,000 PHP. He will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to his inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his family's daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Samson hopes to become a successful entrepreneur and he wants to give his family a better life. He meets up every week with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which he studies.

All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: José Orlando

texts.es:
José de 54 años de edad muy trabajador, es agricultor y su nivel de estudio fue hasta el segundo grado no continuo sus estudios debido a que tenían que andar trasladándose de un lugar a otro por motivos de la guerra, esta casado y es padre de 3 hijos de 20, 12 y 10 años de edad de los cuales uno le ayuda en el trabajo y los otros dos aun se encuentran estudiando.

Su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y a la venta de pupusas, mientras que José se dedica a la agricultura desde hace veinte años, trabajo que lo aprendió de unos amigos y también debido a la necesidad económica que tenia, también se dedica a la venta de queso y le ayuda a su esposa en el negocio de pupusas. 

Para ir a traer el producto de queso a la ciudad, viaja en bus 30 kilómetros.

El crédito que esta solicitando en credicampo, es para surtir mas el negocio de pupusas comprando carne, aceite, quesillo, leña, repollo etc. así podrá ampliar un poco mas la pupuseria y obtendrá un poco mas de ingresos para el sustento de su familia.

El sueño de José es comprar un carro, que sus dos hijos estudien muchísimo para que sean profesionales y mejorar y ampliar mas el negocio de pupusas.
texts.en:
Jose, 54, is a hard-working farmer who has a second grade education.  He was unable to continue his education because of displacement to another place due to war.  He is married and has three children, ages 20, 12, 10.  One of them helps out with work and the other two attend school.

His wife is a homemaker and sells "pupusas" (stuffed tortillas).   Jose has worked in agriculture for 20 years.  He learned the trade from some friends because of the economic needs he had then.  He also sells cheese and helps his wife in her business.  He travels by bus 30 kilometers to buy cheese in another city.
  
The loan he is requesting through Credicampo is to stock the pupusa business with ingredients such as meat, oil, cheese, firewood, cabbage, etc.  This is to expand the business a bit more to earn more income to support the family.

Jose's goals are to buy a car, make sure his children get an education to become professionals, and to improve and expand the pupusa business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as meat, oil, cheese, firewood, cabbage, etc. to make pupusas.

loans.name: Los Mangales Group

texts.es:
Yoly es una mujer de 32 años de edad, soltera, madre de cuatro niños de 12, 8, 6 y 4 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es emprendedora, buena madre, independiente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘El torno’ un sitio caracterizado por el comercio de productos rurales, como; fruta, carne, animales, semillas y todo  tipo de comercio agrícola y ganadero.
Yoly es de tez trigueña, cabello negro largo, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el español y conoce el guaraní por herencia familiar (al centro con blusa rosada). Debido a su necesidad por generar mejores ingresos económicos para el bienestar de su familia, formó una banca de personas con negocios diferentes y necesidades similares para solicitar un préstamo. Su negocio es la venta de comida en su puesto de venta. Ella realiza comidas típicas de su ciudad como; el majao, sopa de maní, locro, etc. Su labor comienza la noche anterior realizando la preparación de la carne, sazones, pelando papas, etc. Para que al día siguiente todo esté listo, ella lleva más de dos años en este rubro. Su sueño es ver a sus hijos profesionales, ella desea realizar la compra de insumos de cocina como; arroz, papa, fideo, etc. Por mayor, para generar mejores ingresos económicos y pagar los gastos escolares de sus 4 hijos.
Es por esos motivos que Yoly solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina por mayor y con los beneficios pagar los gastos escolares de sus 4 hijos.
texts.en:
Yoly, 32, is single and has four children, ages 12, 8, 6 and 4.  Her business is selling food.  She is an enterprising, independent, responsible, hard-working good mother.  Her business is located in and area called "El torno" which is known for its commerce of rural products such as fruit, meat, animals, seeds and all types of farm and livestock trade.

Yoly has a dark complexion, long black hair, is of medium height and her native tongue is Spanish.  But she does know Guaraní through her family (she is in the center of the photo in a pink top).

In order to generate more income for her family's well-being, Yoly set up a communal bank with people in different businesses but with similar loan needs.  She has a food stall and sells typical dishes such as "majao" (rice), peanut soup, "locro" (stew), etc.  Her work starts the night before when she prepares the meat, seasonings, pealed potatoes, etc., so the next day everything is ready.  She has been in business for over two years.  Her dream is to see her children become professionals.  She wants to buy cooking supplies such as rice, potatoes, noodles, etc. wholesale to generate more income for the household and pay for her children's education.

Yoly is requesting a loan to buy wholesale cooking supplies so she can use the profit to pay school costs.

loans.use: To buy wholesale cooking supplies and use the profits for her children's education.

loans.name: Marietha

texts.en:
Marietha is thankful for the financial assistance that was granted to her as she was able to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

In the future, Marietha wants to make improvements to her business and the general living conditions of her family. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Armando De Jesús

texts.es:
Armando de 37 años de edad, es empleado y su nivel de estudio fue hasta el bachillerato, no continuo estudiando porque decidió trabajar para poder ayudar en los gastos del hogar. Esta acompañado y es padre de 3 hijos de 11, 9 y 2 años de edad, de los cuales dos se encuentran estudiando. Su compañera de vida se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y a cuidar sus hijos mientras que Armando se dedica a atender clientes en una pupuseria, trabaja como mesero desde hace 3 años, trabajo que lo aprendió por la misma necesidad de darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, para llegar a su trabajo Armando viaja en bicicleta un kilometro, trabajando en el horario de 6:00 am a 4:30 pm todos los días.

El crédito que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para pagar unos gastos médicos ya que sus hijos se encontraban muy mal de salud y no tenia los recursos económicos suficientes para cubrir esos gastos.

El sueño de Armando es tener un negocio propio de su pupuseria, ya que en el trabajo actual ya tiene mucha experiencia, darles estudios a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y tengan mejores posibilidades de un buen trabajo y mejorar su vivienda, ya que la que tiene esta en mal estadio y es de adobe.
texts.en:
Armando is 37 years old, employed, and his level of study was up to high school. He did not continue school because he decided to work in order to be able to help with the household expenses. He has a partner, and is the father of three children, ages 11, 9, and 2, two of which are in school. His life partner does household chores for a living and looks after his children while Armando makes a living tending to customers in a 'pupuseria' (a business that sells pupusas, a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans). He has been working as a waiter for three years, a job that he learned for the same need to give his family a better quality of life. In order to get to his job, Armando travels a kilometer by bike, working from 6:00 am to 4:30 pm every day. 

The CREDICAMPO loan that he is requesting is to pay some of the medical expenses since his children became very ill and he didn't have sufficient financial resources to cover the expenses. 

Armando dreams of having his own pupuseria business since in his current job he already has a lot of experience. He also dreams of giving his children an education in order for them to be professionals and have better chance of a good job, and improving his home, as it is in poor condition and is made from clay.

loans.use: to pay for his children's medical expenses.

loans.name: Meafou

texts.en: Meafou is 30 years old and unmarried with five children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years. Meafou needs a loan to buy fertilizer, gloves, sprayers, chemicals, a new wheelbarrow and a crowbar. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Meafou will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, gloves, sprayers, chemicals, a new wheelbarrow and a crowbar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance and accessories for her kuliglig

loans.name: Kimheang's Group

texts.en:
Kimheang, 47, is the mother of one child. She lives in Kampong Cham province. To support her family, she grows pepper as her main source of income. Moreover, she works for others for a fee to earn extra income. She has been involved this business for ages and earns about 35,900 KHR per day.

This is the second time for Kimheang with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan. In a group of two members, she is a group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer. She hopes that she can get more crop yields than she could before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rolls of material, needles, threads, measuring tape, 4 new sewing machines and hangers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy barbed wire, timber, nails, iron poles, cattle food and a new wooden tub for water.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a 25-year-old single woman with 1 child. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living, and she has 3 years of experience with this business. 

Anna needs a loan to buy coffee, sugar, a new boiler, a toaster, a sandwich maker, drinks, cups and paper plates. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Anna has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, a new boiler, a toaster, a sandwich maker, drinks, cups and paper plates

loans.name: José Fredys

texts.es:
José de 34 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, actualmente está casado y tiene 3 hijos que estudian educación básica, su esposase dedica a trabajar en costura desde hace 3 años.

José se dedica al comercio de ganado, tiene 4 años de realizar esta actividad que aprendió de su amigo, además José trabaja en la agricultura, él siembra maíz y fríjol y el lugar donde cultiva está a una distancia de 2 Km de su casa lo cual viaja en una motocicleta. 

Él necesita el crédito para comprar ganado de repasto para luego venderlos.

Su sueño es trabajar fuerte con el negocio de ganado para mejorar y sacar adelante a sus hijos para que puedan superarse con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Jose is 34 years old and is a bachelor student.  He is married and has three children who attend school.  His wife has been working as a seamstress for three years.

Jose sells livestock and has been doing this for four years.  He learned from a friend.  He also raises corn and beans on a plot of land 2 km from his home.  He travels there by motorcycle.

He needs this loan to buy livestock that he can raise and later sell.

His dream is to work hard in his livestock business to improve and get his children ahead so they can succeed with their educations.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Maasoama

texts.en:
Maasoama is 32 years old and single with 1 child. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

Maasoama needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, sprayers, a new tiller, a spade, a crowbar and a machete. She will use the profits from her sales to pay her family's weekly expenses.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, sprayers, a new tiller, a spade, a crowbar and a machete

loans.name: Paepaefoa

texts.en:
Paepaefoa is a 51-year-old widow with 3 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 1 year. 

Paepaefoa needs a loan to buy fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, gloves, a new pair of overalls, sprayers and a tiller. She will use the profits from her sales to pay her family's weekly expenses.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, gloves, a new pair of overalls, sprayers and a tiller

loans.name: Litia

texts.en:
Litia is 49 years old and married with 6 children. She makes and sells Elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for 1 year. 

Litia has requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, brushes, stencils, a cutter and new rollers. She plans to use her profits to pay her family's weekly expenses. 

She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, brushes, stencils, a cutter and new rollers

loans.name: Pelenatete

texts.en:
Pelenatete is a 53-year-old woman with 2 children. She runs a small business with her plantation and sells her produce at the market to earn a living.

Pelenatete has requested a loan to buy a wheel barrow, a cooler, a knife, taro roots and banana roots to improve her business for her family's future.

loans.use: to buy a wheel barrow, a cooler, a knife, taro roots and banana roots

loans.name: Tiliga

texts.en:
Tiliga is 43 years old and married with 6 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. 

Tiliga needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, gloves, a new wheelbarrow and new boots. She will use the profits from her sales to pay her family's weekly expenses.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, gloves, a new wheelbarrow and new boots

loans.name: Eunesi

texts.en:
Eunesi is 27 years old and unmarried with 3 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 1 year. 

Eunesi needs a loan to buy gloves, overalls, chemicals, fertilizer, a tiller and a new wheelbarrow. She will use the profits from her sales to pay her family's weekly expenses.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy gloves, overalls, chemicals, fertilizer, a tiller and a new wheelbarrow

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.es:
Alexandra es una persona muy alegre y amable, trabaja en una tienda de ropa de su ciudad natal, Ica. Actualmente está estudiando una profesión porque tiene muchos deseos de superación, ella dice que nunca es tarde para comenzar a estudiar, es el ejemplo para sus hermanos, siempre luchando por su familia, para que puedan tener un futuro mejor.
Alexandra tiene muchos deseos de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia es por ello que con el crédito otorgado piensa comprar un electrodoméstico para su casa, ella está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad porque con esto su familia vivirá más cómoda y con mayor bienestar. Más adelante ella tener por sueño emprender su propio negocio de venta de ropa para así poder sacar adelante a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Alexandra is a very happy and friendly person.  She works in a clothing store in her hometown of Ica.  She is currently studying for a career because she really wants to succeed and says that it’s never too late to get an education and she is the example for her siblings.  She is always striving for her family so that they can have the best of things.

Alexandra wants a better quality of life for her family, so she wants to use the money from this loan to buy an appliance for her home.  She is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity because this will allow her family to live more comfortably.  In the future she wants to start her own clothing business so she can get her loved ones ahead.

loans.use: to buy an appliance.

loans.name: Faalagilagi

texts.en:
Faalagilagi is 30 years old and married with three children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. 

Faalagilagi needs a loan to buy boots, fertilizer, chemicals, a new tiller, a spade, a machete and a chainsaw. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Faalagilagi will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy boots, fertilizer, chemicals, a new tiller, a spade, a machete and a chainsaw

loans.name: Lauren Teresa

texts.es:
Trabajar fuerte todos los días, es el lema de Lauren, una joven emprendedora de 21 años de edad. Hace cuatro años, ella empezó con la ayuda de sus padre, ahora está agradece no solo a ellos, también  a todas las personas que la ayudaron con el préstamo anterior, ya que con ese pudo comprar más mercadería de su pulpería para crecer. Con ese último préstamo, las ventas crecieron, ya que pudo vender cosméticos y granos básicos al mismo tiempo.
Ahora Lauren quiere seguir invirtiendo en el negocio, por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar ajo, aceite, arroz, perfumes, shampoo, detergente, canela, entre otros productos que vende. Esto le permitirá aumentar la mercadería del negocio, poder complacer con las necesidades de sus clientes y tener mayores ingresos económicos. Por el momento no se siente una persona autosuficiente porque quiere seguir invirtiendo en el crecimiento de su pulpería, pero sabe que siguiendo trabajando fuerte lo puede lograr.
texts.en:
Work hard every day is Lauren's motto. She is an enterprising 21 year old. Four years ago, she started with her parents' help. Now she thanks not only them, but also the people who helped her with the previous loan. With it she was able to buy more merchandise for her store to grow. With that last loan, her sales increased because she was able to sell cosmetics and basic grains at the same time. 

Now Lauren wants to keep investing in the business. That is why she is asking for a new loan to buy garlic, oil, rice, perfumes, shampoo, detergent, cinnamon and more products that she sells. This will allow her to increase the merchandise in her business, meet the needs of her customers and have more income. Right now she doesn't feel self sufficient because she wants to keep investing in the growth of her store, but she knows that by continuing to work hard she can achieve it.

loans.use: to buy garlic, oil, rice, perfume, shampoo, detergent, cinnamon and more.

loans.name: Mere

texts.en:
Mere is a 67-year-old woman who still handles running her business of sewing dresses and selling them at the market and in her community to earn a living.

She requested for a loan to buy rolls of fabric, a box of needles, scissors and measurements to help her improve her business.

In the future, Mere hopes to use her business profit for her family's needs. She joined SPBD in 2010.

loans.use: to buy rolls of fabric, a box of needles, scissors and measurements

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is a 19-year-old single woman with one child. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Antonina needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, a strainer and a gas bottle. 

She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Antonina has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, a strainer and a gas bottle

loans.name: Petimara

texts.en:
Petimara is a 40-year-old woman who runs a small plantation business; she sells at the market and in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than three years.

Petimara requested a loan to buy a wheel barrow, weed spray, vegetable seeds, a knife, taro roots, and banana roots to improve her business.

She hopes to use her business profits to satisfy her family's everyday needs. Petimara joined SPBD in 2010.

loans.use: to buy a wheel barrow, weed spray, vegetable seeds, a knife, taro roots, and banana roots

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself as honest and goal-oriented. 

Ann runs a chemist's where she sells medicine. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. It is located in a good area and her primary customers are retailers and wholesalers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. 

Ann will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of medicine. She hopes that in the future she will have a clinic and will be financially stable. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank and her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of medicine

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 6 to 12 years old. She describes herself as good. 

She operates a catering business where she sells food stuffs. She has been involved in this business for 5 years, and it is located in a good area. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more catering equipment. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank and her previous loan was repaid successfully. 		

Winnie hopes that in the future she will be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more catering equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a married woman. She describes herself to be aggressive. She operates a retail business where she sells water. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a strategic location. She describes her biggest business challenge to be water shortages. 

She will use the Kes 16,200 loan to buy a water tank. 

Her business goal is to have a water bottling company within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a farm where he grows tea. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor weather conditions. 

Benard will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more tea leaves to sell. 

His business goal is to excel within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more tea leaves

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be experienced. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals and animal feed. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a viable location, and her primary customers are farmers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. 

Grace will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals and animal feed. 

Her business goal is to be successful within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals and animal feed

loans.name: Kahindi

texts.en:
Kahindi is a male Kiva borrower. He has two children. He describes himself to be aggressive. He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a strategic location, and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor roads, which affect transport. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. 

His business goal is to grow and offer other products within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will grow his business. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates as chemist, where she sells medicine. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area with many customers, and her primary customers are locals. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of medicine. 

Her business goal is to excel within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be self reliant.

loans.use: to buy more stock of medicine

loans.name: Oriette Alejandra

texts.es:
Todas las mañanas, Oriette despierta con el propósito de convertirse en una de las mejores diseñadoras de su país. Esta joven de 20 años de edad y protectora de los animales, lleva el primer año de su carrera de Diseño y Comunicación Visual. Licenciatura que no dudo en elegir, ya que desde pequeña ella se sentía apasionada por crear algo nuevo. A su corta edad ella está casada, pero eso no la detiene en cumplir con sus sueños, al contrario, cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo, quien trabaja en una empresa de arquitectura e ingeniería eléctrica. 
El talento de Oriette la ha llevado a hacer pequeños trabajos donde se realiza profesionalmente, no obstante, no cuenta con el equipo completo para poder cumplir con estos trabajos fácilmente. Razón por la cual solicita un préstamo para comprar una laptop y una cama fotográfica. Estas herramientas le permitirán cumplir sin ningún problema sus tareas de la universidad y cualquier trabajo profesional. En sus planes está tener su propia empresa de publicidad y comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Oriette wakes up every morning with the goal of becoming one of the best designers in her country. This young woman is an animal protector and is in the first year of Visual Design and Communication. She did not doubt when choosing what to study because she has always felt passion for creating new things. Despite being young, she is married. However, this is not an obstacle for her to achieve her goals; on the contrary: her husband supports her unconditionally. He works for an architecture and electric engineering firm.

Oriette is a talented person, which is why she has been able to work in small projects. However, she does not have all the equipment she needs to make her work easier. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy a laptop and a camera. With these tools, she will be able to finish without any problem her university and professional projects. In the future, she would like to start her own advertising company and buy a car.

loans.use: to buy a laptop and a camera.

loans.name: Fidel Ángel

texts.es:
Fidel de 53 años de edad, es mecánico y su nivel de estudio fue hasta el noveno grado, luego decidió aprender el oficio de mecánico, esta casado y es padre de 4 hijos de los cuales dos se encuentran estudiando y los otros dos ya están casados y trabajan aparte para los gastos de sus hogares.

Su esposa se dedica a la venta de pupusas en la plaza publica de la comunidad, mientras que Fidel se dedica a manejar un bus de su propiedad en su comunidad, trabaja desde hace 15 años, además de eso tiene algunas vacas lecheras que las ordeña en la mañanita, su horario de trabajo es de 5:00 am a 6:00 pm todos los días.

El crédito que esta solicitando en la institución, es para la compra de materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, piedra, ladrillo etc., para construir un cafetín a su esposa en la plaza publica para que su esposa tenga un lugar mas seguro para vender sus pupusitas y así podrá darle una mejor comodidad a sus clientes y se sientas satisfechos, así podrá obtener un poco mas de ingresos para los gastos del hogar.

El sueño de Fidel es tener un bus más nuevo donde podrá brindar un mejor servicio a los clientes y que sus hijos estudien mucho.
texts.en:
Fidel is 53 years old. He is a mechanic and went to school up to the ninth grade. Later, he decided to learn the trade of a mechanic. He is married and is the father of 4 children. Two of them are in school and the other two are already married and work in their own for their household's expenses. 

His wife sells pupusas in the public plaza in the community, while Fidel works driving a bus he owns in the community. He has done this for 15 years. In addition, he has dairy cows that he milks in the morning. His work schedule is from 5:00 am to 6:00 pm every day.

The loan he is asking for in the institution is to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, stone, brick, etc., to build a cafe for his wife in the public plaza so that she has a more secure place to sell her pupusitas. This way she can give her customers more comfort and they can feel satisfied. She will be able to obtain a little more income for the household expenses.   

Fidel's dream is to have a newer bus where he can offer a better service to his customers and for his children to study a lot.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, stones, bricks, etc. to build a cafe for his wife in the public plaza.

loans.name: Grupo La Cumbre Chuilajkalquix Group

texts.es:
De 41 años de edad ya con grandes aspiraciones en dar a conocer a su comunidad y a todos los que la visitan la actividad que ella realiza con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación, es casada y vive con sus hijos con el deseo de superar en la vida e alcanzar grandes sueños que ella quiere realizar en la vida los tres hijos de ella son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad. (Paula es la que se encuentra de 2da de izquierda a derecha de la fotografía)

El trabajo que ella realiza con tanto esmero es la compra y venta de cortes típicas dicha actividad lo realiza en su casa y en lugares cercanos de su comunidad donde ella vive, la segunda actividad que ella realiza es la venta de refrescos negocio que realiza con una hermana por más de dos años porque les genera una ganancia para el bienestar de su familia y mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia y comunidad.

Ella ha sido un ejemplo en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se han unido a Paula para poder emprender sus negocios para que cada uno de ellas pueda supera y tener ingresos importantes.

El uso que ella le dará al préstamo que ella está realizando es para la compra de mercadería o corte típica para luego su respectiva venta por los alrededores. Uno de las aspiraciones de ella es tener un local en el mercado de su comunidad para poder realizar ventas mayores.
texts.en:
Paul is 41 years old, with great aspirations to become known in her community and to all who visit her in the activity she does with so much hard work and dedication. She is married and lives with her children. She wants to get ahead in life and attain her big dreams. Her three children are excellent students in the community school (Paula is the second one from the left in the photograph).

The works she does with so much dedication is buying and selling traditional clothing and in places close to her community where she lives. The second activity she does is selling beverages, a business she has done with her sister for more than two years because it generates profits for them for their family well being and to improve the financial conditions of her family and community.

She has been an example in her community and that is why a group of women got together with Paula to be able to start their businesses so that each of them can get ahead and make important income. 

The use she will give the loan is that she is buying traditional clothing merchandise to later sell in the surrounding areas. One of her goals is to have a locale in the market in her community to be able to make bigger sales.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing merchandise.

loans.name: José Fredy

texts.es:
José de 53 años de edad, es agricultor, su nivel de estudio fue hasta el noveno grado, no continuo sus estudios debido al conflicto armado, estuvo acompañado y con su compañera de vida procrearon 3 hijos de las edades siguientes, 28, 26 y 19 años de edad, de los cuales ya no viven con él porque viajaron para los Estados Unidos. Ahora él se volvió acompañar y vive con un hijo de su esposa actual.

Su compañera de vida se dedica a la venta de tortillas, donde obtiene un poco de ingresos para poder ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos, mientras que José se dedica a la agricultura y a la albañilería desde hace mas de 30 años trabajo que lo aprendió con sus amigos y por la necesidad en que tenia para poder sacar ingresos para la alimentación diaria, para llegar a su trabajo viaja en vehículo un kilometro trabajando en el horario de 6:00 am a 11:00 am. 

El crédito que esta solicitando en la institución, es para comprar materiales agrícolas como semilla, abono, veneno y para pago de mano de obra para cultivar maíz, donde espera obtener una buena cosecha para tener un poco mas de ingresos y así darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

El sueño de José es tener un negocio, tener una vivienda digna para él y su familia y tener 10 animales.
texts.en:
José is 53 years old, and is a farmer. He studied until ninth grade, and then had to abandon his education due to armed conflict. He had a partner with whom he had three children, now aged 28, 26 and 19. They no longer live with him because they moved to the United States. He now has a new partner and lives with her and their child.

His partner makes a living selling tortillas. She makes a small income to support her husband with expenses. José has worked in agriculture and masonry for over 30 years. He learned these trades with his friends, in order to make money to eat. He travels to his work, one kilometre away, by vehicle, and works from 6:00 am to 11:00 am. 

The loan he is requesting from the organisation is to buy agricultural materials such as seeds, compost, poison and to pay for labour to grow corn. He hopes that he will get a good harvest to boost his earnings and give his family a better quality of life.

José's dream is to have a business, have decent housing for him and his family, and have ten animals.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials such as seeds, compost, poison and to pay for labour to grow corn.

loans.name: Noel Rosario

texts.es: Noel: Es un hombre sociable, trabajador. Desde hace 4 años vive en una casa minifalda de concreto y madera con 5 personas. Con el propósito de ampliar su vivienda, solicita su primer financiamiento, para comprar materiales de construcción: cemento, bloque, madera, clavo, zinc y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener una vivienda con las condiciones adecuadas.
texts.en: Noel is a sociable and hardworking man. For the past 4 years he has lived in a minifalda house made of concrete and wood with 5 people. With the goal to expand his home, he asks for his first loan to purchase construction materials: cement, concrete blocks, wood, nails, zinc and to cover labor costs. His dream is to live in a house with suitable conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials: cement, concrete blocks, wood, nails, zinc, and to cover labor costs.

loans.name: Hardy Kellith

texts.es: Hardy: Es un hombre luchador, originario de Waspam. Con el propósito de contar con su propia fuente de ingreso desde hace un año vende madera, anteriormente  vendía sus productos por pedido, con el incremento de sus ventas, le han permitido establecer sus negocio en un local que alquila. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar diversas variedades de madera y venderla a precios accesibles en Puerto Cabezas. Su sueño es tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en: Hardy is a determined man, originally from Waspam. With the goal to have his own source of income, he has sold wood for the past year; previously he sold his products to order, the increase in his sales has permitted him to establish his business in a retail location he rents. He asks for his first loan to purchase a diverse assortment of wood and sell it at accessible prices in Puerto Cabezas. His dream is to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to purchase a diverse assortment of wood and sell it at accessible prices in Puerto Cabezas.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
Faustino de 50 años de edad, no asistió a la escuela, esta casado desde hace 15 años y su esposa es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de frutas, solo tiene una hija de 9 años que asiste a tercer grado.

 Ademas, vive con ellos la mamá de su esposa, Faustino es empleado en una empresa de seguridad desde hace 5 años, el trabajo esta 30 minutos en bus desde su casa, realiza turnos de 24 a 12 horas; pero también Faustino trabaja en la agricultor sembrando maíz para consumo familiar.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar fertilizantes y abonar sus cultivos de maíz y hortalizas y la otra parte para comprar frutas para el negocio de su esposa.

 Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y tener un negocio mas fuerte junto a su esposa, ademas ver su hija crecer y verla feliz.
texts.en:
Faustino is 50 years old. He didn't go to school; he has been married for 15 years and his wife is a businesswoman, who works selling fruit. He only has a 9-year-old daughter who is in the third grade. 

In addition, his wife's mother lives with them. Faustino has been employed at a security business for the past 5 years, the work is 30 minutes by bus from his house. He has shifts of 24 to 12 hours, but Faustino also works in agriculture growing corn for family consumption. 

The loan that he is requesting is to purchase fertilizers and fertilize his corn and vegetable crop and the other part is to purchase fruit for his wife's business. 

His dreams are to continue working and have a stronger business with his wife and, in addition, to see his daughter grow and see her happy.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and fertilize his corn and vegetable crops and the other part is to purchase fruit for his wife's business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for travel costs and university fees.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Andrés: Es un hombre alegre y luchador. Desde hace 3 años habita en casa de familiares con 4 personas. Con el propósito de construir su cuarto de habitación, solicita financiamiento, para comprar materiales de construcción: Zinc, madera, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es estudiar su carrera universitaria de Derecho.
texts.en: Andrés is a happy and determined man. For the past 3 years he has lived in the house of relatives with 4 people. With the goal to build a bedroom, he asks for a loan to purchase construction materials: zinc, wood, nails, and to cover the labor costs. His dream is to study for a degree at the law school.

loans.use: to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a toilet and piping for a latrine, and build a drain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and raw materials and inputs for sewing.

loans.name: Alegre Group

texts.es: Medolina: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario Alegre, integrado por 4 mujeres contentas y luchadoras. Tiene 39 años de edad, casada. Tiene 3 hijos. Con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente ingreso y apoyar en los gastos del hogar. Su esposo, es marinero. Desde hace 5 años estableció su pequeña pulpería. Solicita financiamiento para comprar mercadería: Granos básicos, chiverías, pollo, carne molida, entre otros productos. Su sueño es mejorar la infraestructura del local de su  negocio.
texts.en:
Medolina is the coordinator of the solidarity group, Alegre, made up of four happy and hard-working women. She is 39 years old, married, and has three children. Five years ago she set up her small store, with the aim of having her own source of income and helping out with the household expenses. Her husband is a sailor.

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise including basic grains, snacks, chicken, minced meat, and other products. Her dream is to improve the infrastructure of her business premises.

loans.use: to buy merchandise including basic grains, snacks, chicken, minced meat, and other products.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia is 25 years old and lives in the village of Mundri in the Western Equatoria state region of South Sudan. She is married and has 03 children. For the past 3 years, Cicilia has been working hard to manage her produce, selling posho (corn meal), cassava flour and beans. 

To help expand her business, Marry has requested a loan of 1,000  SSP from WOYE MFI. The loan will be used to purchase more sacks of posho, cassava flour and beans, and will help Marry to generate greater profits and improve family's standard of living. Cicilia hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Cicilia is a member of WOYE's Micro Enterprise Lending Program (MEL). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Cicilia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: To buy new items for her shop

loans.name: Girasol Group

texts.es: Rosita: Es integrante del grupo solidario girasol. Es una mujer luchadora. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde más de una década estableció su negocio de bastimentos, refresco naturales, gaseosas y  venta de pollo, bebidas, en un tramo que alquila. Solicita financiamiento para comprar mercadería: Yuca, quequisque, malanga, nancite, coco, frutas para elaborar sus refrescos, azúcar. Su sueño es tener su propio tramo en el mercado.
texts.en: Rosita is a member of the solidarity group Girasol. She is a hard-working woman. With the aim of having her own source of income, over a decade ago she set up her business selling groceries, natural fruit juices, fizzy drinks, chicken, and drinks on a rented stall. She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise such as yucca, coco yam, taro, nance, coconut, fruits to make her fruit juices, and sugar. Her dream is to have her own market stall.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as yucca, coco yam, taro, nance, coconut, fruits to make her fruit juices, and sugar.

loans.name: Haid

texts.en:
Haid is a 30-year-old mother of four from the Mundri County of South Sudan. Haid operates her own business. She buys and sells grocery items such as sugar, cooking oil, soap, stationery, candles, flour, milk, juice, salt, and cornmeal. 

Haid is requesting a loan from WOYE MFI so that she can expand her business. She will be able to increase her stock and boost her sales. Haid hopes to build her own shop in the community and improve her family’s living standards

loans.use: to buy more goods for her shop

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday is 24 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She has run a general store in the South Sudan for the past 06 years.

Sunday has requested a SSP 2,000 loan through WOYE MFI to purchase additional grocery items such as canned goods, soft drinks, sugar, milk, noodles, etc. to sell. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family

loans.use: to buy more goods

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 24 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She has run a general store in South Sudan for the past six years.

Alice wants to use this loan to purchase additional grocery items, such as canned goods, soft drinks, sugar, milk, noodles, etc., to sell. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy new foods for her shop.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is 48 years old and married with four children, all of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She has run a medicine shop  in the South Sudan for the past six years.

Phoebe has requested a SSP 4,500 loan through WOYE MFI to purchase additional medicine items.

loans.use: To buy medicine for her shop

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy, 29, years old and lives in the village of Mundri in the Western Equatoria state region of South Sudan. She is married and has 04 children. For the past 4 years, Joy has been working hard to manage her produce, selling posho (corn meal), cassava flour and beans. 

To help expand her business, Joy has requested a loan of 700  SSP from WOYE MFI. The loan will be used to purchase more sacks of posho, cassava flour and beans, and will help Joy to generate greater profits and improve family's standard of living. Joy hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Joy is a member of WOYE's Micro Enterprise Lending Program (MEL). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more food for her shop

loans.name: Marcos Jesús

texts.es:
El Joven Marcos Jesús,  casado  docente labora para  un centros Escolar  de la ciudad de León, se dedica a este trabajo desde hace cuatro años, inicia sus labores de siete de la mañana y finaliza a las tres de la tarde  de lunes a viernes en este mismo horario, el realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento  a su hogar.

Marcos Jesús,  se acercó a Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito el que utilizara  para comprar una Refrigeradora y así tener un mejor nivel de vida junto a su esposa.
texts.en:
Marcos Jesús is married and works as a teacher. He works for a school in the city of León. He has made a living in this way for four years. He begins work at seven in the morning and finishes at three in the afternoon, from Mondays to Fridays, to support his family.

Marcos Jesús approached Ceprodel to request a loan which he will use to buy a refrigerator to improve his life with his wife.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Shes Group

texts.es: Ángela: Es una mujer amable, trabajadora, tiene 35 años de edad, casada. Tiene 6 hijos, en edad escolar. Con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente ingreso y mejor la calidad de vida de su familia desde hace 4 años estableció una pulpería. Solicita financiamiento para comprar mercadería: granos básicos, chivería, huevos, entre otros. Su sueño es  tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en: Ángela is a kind, hard-working woman who is 30 years old and married. She has six, school-aged children. Four years ago she set up a grocery store with the aim of having her own source of income and improving her family's quality of life. She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as basic grains, snacks, eggs, and other items. Her dream is to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as basic grains, snacks, eggs, and other items.

loans.name: Matilde Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Matilde Argentina, es madre de ocho hijos y se dedica al comercio desde hace 9 años, donde su negocio actual es la venta de marisco anteriormente vendía frutas y verduras,  ella inicia a ofertar el producto a su clientela a la seis de la mañana y finaliza a las dos de la tarde  realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento  de sus dos pequeños hijos que están en edad escolar.   

Doña Matilde  solicito  a Ceprodel un crédito el que utilizo  para  incrementar su inventario  con variedad de pescados, camarones de exportación y conchas para lograr mayor venta y  así tener un  mejor  nivel de vida junto a sus lindo hijitos.
texts.en:
Señora Matilde Argentina is a mother of eight who has made a living as a trader for nine years. Her current business sells seafood, and in the past she sold fruit and vegetables. She starts selling her produce to customers at six in the morning, and finishes at two in the afternoon. She does this work to support her two young, school-age children.  

Matilde is requesting a loan from Ceprodel which she will use to increase her inventory with a variety of fish, prawns, and shellfish to increase sales and in this way, enjoy a better quality of life alongside her beautiful children.

loans.use: to buy prawns, shellfish and fish.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, tiene 32 años, él emprendió su actividad como cobrador, luego de muchos años empezó a surtir para su propios productos al cual se dedica actualmente con la ayuda de su cuñado, de esa forma se están esforzando por poder salir adelante.
 Armando es muy trabajador y sacrificado, tuvo que superar varios obstáculos para logar todo lo que actualmente posee.
Necesita el préstamo para la compra de productos varios para la venta y seguir creciendo su negocio.
texts.en:
Armando is from the city of Paraguarí. He is 32 years old, and learned to be an accountant. After many years, he began to stock his own products, and this is his job today with the help of his brother-in-law. They work hard in this way to succeed.

Armando is very hard-working and dedicated. He had to overcome a number of obstacles to achieve everything he has today. 

He needs the loan to buy various items to sell and continue growing his business.

loans.use: to buy various items to sell.

loans.name: Diema Group

texts.fr:
DIEMA est un groupe de l’association SIGUIKAFO de TIELE. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne cinq enfants. Elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments  à l’image de KADIA  qui est la première  personne debout de la gauche vers la droite  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles  à TIELE commune rurale dudit lieu, dans la Sous-Préfecture de BAGUINEDA (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat  vente de condiments : tomate, choux et oignon.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a six ans. Elles sont à leur neuvième  prêt solidaire. 
KADIA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à  TIELE, excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,  5 paniers de tomate et une quantité importante de choux et oignon.  Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses condiments à  TIELE en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composés d’hommes et de femmes.    
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA  somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et s’investir dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Diema Group is affiliated with the Siguikafo Association in Tiele. This group is made up of women who know each other through the bonds of family and community. On average, each group member is 40 years old, married, with an average of five children each. They each carry out different activities, such as buying and selling foodstuffs. This is the main source of income for Kadia, the woman standing to the left of the photo. These women all live within large traditional families in Tiele, within Baguineda Sub-Prefecture (Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali).

These women have been carrying out this work for several years and are very much sought-after for the foodstuffs they trade in, such as tomatoes, cabbages and onions. In order to satisfy their customers' growing needs, the members of this group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso Lending Scheme six years ago. This will be their ninth group loan.

Kadia, who is the group's president and who is very well-known around Tiele, excels in selling foodstuffs. She plans on using her part of the loan to purchase five baskets of tomatoes and large quantities of cabbages and onions. She gets her supplies from the wholesalers in Bamako then sells these items in Tiele in exchange for both cash and credit to a customer base made up of both men and women.

She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA, which will allow her to pay back the loan and reinvest into her business.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is a married man, and he has two children. He describes himself to be focused. 

Leonard operates a retail business where he sells bread, flour, sugar and other items. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in an area suitable for business, and his primary customers are locals. 

Leonard will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, bread and other items. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. He will use the anticipated profits to buy land.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, sugar, bread and other items

loans.name: Ephely

texts.en:
Ephely is a married woman. She describes herself to be committed, honest and cheerful. 

Ephely operates a grocery store where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a highly populated area, and her primary customers are retailers. Ephely describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. 

Ephely will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of green groceries. Her business goal is to be able to sell in wholesale within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is Ephely's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of green groceries

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is a married man, and he has four children. He describes himself to be optimistic. 

Erick operates a retail business where he sells bags. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive place and his primary customers are the general public. Erick describes his biggest business challenge to be financial constraints. 

Erick will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of bags. His business goal is to have a big stall within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved living standards. This is Erick's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, iron, sand, breeze blocks and gravel.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman, and she has two children. She describes herself to be a risk taker. 

Margaret operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are daily customers. Margaret describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. 

Margaret will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will create employment. This is Margaret's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Koeju Group

texts.es:
Koeju se llama este grupo formado en el chaco, está dentro del programa de eliminación de pobreza, son 17 mujeres con muchos deseos de poder salir adelante.
Evangelista es una de las integrantes, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora, que trabaja y lucha para poder salir adelante, es una mujer que a pesar de los obstáculos está creciendo. Ella se dedica a la venta de carbón, y pide este préstamo para poder surtirse con más carbón, y seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
This group is called Koeju and it was formed in the region of Chaco, within the programme for the elimination of poverty. They are 17 women who all want to get ahead in life. 

Evangelista, one of the members, is a very enterprising woman, who works and fights to get ahead. She is a woman who, despite various obstacles, is bettering herself. She makes a living selling coal, and she is asking for this loan so that she can purchase more coal and continue with the work that she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy coal for resale

loans.name: Suglo  Mbori Buni - Nyolugu Group

texts.en:
Samata is a 45-year-old hardworking woman from Nyolugu in the Northern region of Ghana. Samata is married and has six children with all of the children attending school. Samata is the individual pictured in the middle among members squatting.

Samata is a member of a shea butter processing group that has been in business for the last fifteen years. The name of the group is ‘Suglo  Mbori Buni - Nyolugu’. Samata earns a good profit from the business as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to improve their shea butter processing business so that they can always produce premium quality products for the local and non-local markets.

Samata and ‘Suglo  Mbori Buni - Nyolugu’ have asked for a loan of GHS 7,300. Samata’s share of the loan will help her to buy four bags of shea nuts for processing. Samata aspires to earn more income as well as to repay this loan and support her children with food and educational materials.

Samata thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy four bags of shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheeting and wood, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
La Sra. Laura es soltera, de la ciudad de San Lorenzo,  y se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comestibles y lo realiza de manera ambulante. Su día empieza desde muy temprano, ya que se le levanta a preparar los comestibles que vende.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de un congelador, ya que le será muy útil para poder seguir con su trabajo. Comenta que sueña con comprar un vehículo y seguir con la misma actividad y  dar fuente de trabajo  a las personas.
texts.en:
Laura's single.  She's from the city of San Lorenzo and works making food and selling it as a street vendor.  She starts her day very early because she gets up to prepare the food she sells.

She's requesting this loan to buy a freezer because it will be very useful to her in being able to keep on doing her job.

Laura said she dreams of buying a vehicle and of continuing with her job and giving people a source of work.

loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, 40, is married and has four children, two of whom are currently in school.

Evelyn is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a 15000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Evelyn has been raising livestock for 5 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain this business.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Edelita

texts.en:
Edelita is 60 years old and married with six children.

Edelita is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Edelita requested a 24000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Edelita has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. 

Edelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additonal livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: San Jeronimo Group

texts.es:
Dacia: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario San Jerónimo, le nombraron así en honor al patrono de Masaya, ya que dos de las integrantes son originarias del Pacifico y se trasladaron a Puerto Cabezas, con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y establecer su negocio en el mercado San Jerónimo. Este grupo solidario es uno de los pocos grupos mixtos, integrado por un varón, originario del Caribe de Norte de Nicaragua, que también vende sus productos en el mercado San Jerónimo.

Es una mujer  alegre, trabajadora, tiene 30 años de edad, casada con tres hijos en edad escolar Su esposo vende mariscos de manera ambulante. Desde hace 8 años, estableció su salón de belleza. Solicita financiamiento para comprar productos de bellezas: Pinturas de uñas, tintes, maquillaje, perfumes, cremas corporales. Su sueño es tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
Dacia is the coordinator of the solidarity group "San Jerónimo". which they named such in the honor of the patron of Masaya as two of the members originate from the Pacific and moved to Puerto Cabezas with the objective to have their own source of income and establish a business in the market of San Jerónimo. This solidarity group is one of the few mixed groups, with a man, who originates from the North Caribbean of Nicaragua, that also sells his produce at the market of San Jerónimo.

She is a happy, hard working woman who is 30 years old, married and has three children in school age. Her husband sells seafood ambulatory. 8 years ago she established her beauty salon. She requests funding to buy beauty products: Nail polish, dyes, makeup, perfumes, body creams. Her dream is to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy beauty products: nail polish, dyes, makeup, perfumes, body creams

loans.name: Nathalia

texts.es:
Nathalia tiene 25 años de edad, es  madre soltera y vive en la ciudad de Carapeguá, comenta que está luchando por su hijo, para poder darle todo lo que no pudo.
Esta señorita al cumplir su mayoría de edad empezó a trabajar como empleada en una farmacia, pasados dos años juntó un poco de capital para poder empezar su propio negocio que es la venta de perfumes en general y así poder generar más ganancia ya que su sueldo como empleada era muy poco, actualmente ya tiene clientela formada, que siempre le hace pedidos.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de perfumes ya que en esta temporada lo solicitan mucho sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nathalia, 25, is a single mother who lives in the city of Carapeguá.  She said she's striving to give her son everything she couldn't have.

This young woman started working as an employee in a pharmacy when she became of age.  In two years she got together a bit of capital to be able to start her own business selling a variety of perfumes.  That way she was able to earn more profits, because her salary as an employee was very low.  Currently she has steady customers who always order from her.

She's requesting the loan to buy perfume because her customers request it frequently this time of year.

loans.use: to buy perfume

loans.name: Contiguo Al Puente Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario, es el único grupo esta integrado por 2 varones y una mujer, que se organizaron desde hace 6 meses, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para mejorar sus negocios.

Hipolito: Es el coordinador del grupo solidario: Contiguo al puente. Es un hombre trabajador, tiene 40 años de edad, tiene 6 hijos, mayores de edad. Con el objetivo mejor su calidad de vida y apoyar al desarrollo profesional de sus hijos desde hace un año estableció un pequeño negocio de hospedaje. Solicita financiamiento para mejorar la infraestructura del hospedaje y ofrecer un adecuado servicio a sus clientes. Su sueño es tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is the only one that comprises of 2 men and a woman, that organized themselves 6 months ago with the intention to access funding to improve their businesses.

Hipolito is the coordinator of the solidarity group "Contiguo al puente". He is a hard working man, he is 40 years old and has 6 adult children. With the objective to improve his quality of life and support the professional development of his children, one year ago he established a small lodging business. He requests funding to improve the infrastructure of the lodging and offer adequate service to his clients. His dream is to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure of the lodging and  offer an adequate service to his clients

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comité San Cayetano está en su 6to. ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres emprendedoras, donde todas mantienen una actividad propia emprendidas por ellas mismas, trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante.
Son mujeres emprendedoras donde la mayoría tienen su actividades particulares donde invierten todos sus esfuerzos.
Ana es una persona muy trabajadora, vende cosméticos variados y gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo esta ayudando a su familia y dándoles todo lo que ella no pudo tener y que no pasen por ningún tipo de necesidades.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos para poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradecen todas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo y mejorar.
texts.en:
The committee San Cayetano is in its 6th cycle of the program of the committee of entrepreneurial women, where all maintain their own entrepreneurial activities themselves, work and help themselves to get ahead. They are entrepreneurial women and the majority has their particular activities in which they invest all their effort.

Ana is a very hard working person, she sells a variety of cosmetics and, thanks to her work and effort, she is helping her family and giving them everything that she could not have and they do not have be in any kind of need.

She requests this loan to be able to invest in the buying of cosmetics to be able to continue her work as she has been doing. They are all grateful for the opportunity that they are receiving to be able to continue growing and improving.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Himani

texts.en:
Himani is a rural housewife from Dhupguri. She is 26 years old, and together with her husband is raising three children (one son and two daughters). She resides with her husband and children in their own house made of mud and straw. She studied up to grade 8, and her husband could not continue after primary education. One of her children is a student in grade 3; the other two are too young for school. 

As the main source of income for the family, her husband practices crop farming. He helped his parents with this business since childhood and now he runs his own agricultural business. He has a plot of land on which he grows vegetables with the active support of Himani. Additionally, they also cultivate paddy on their farmland. All of her harvested, eco-friendly produce is sold at the local market or to wholesale buyers. As paddy cultivation is very profitable, being an all-season crop, they want to concentrate on the cultivation of this crop.

Currently, Himani is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy agricultural supplies such as paddy seeds, fertilizers, etc., to improve their paddy cultivation. She has a lot of faith, and she hopes to get ahead because her household expenses depend on this work.

Her dream as a mother is to give a good education to her children so they can prosper in life. With her profits, she plans to upgrade their house with all the basic amenities and comfort.

She thanks her lenders for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Kabita

texts.en:
Kabita hails from Dhupguri. She is a woman of 53 years. She is a widow with three children (one son and two daughters). Her husband was engaged with a timber-selling business, and after his death, his son looks after the business. One of her daughters is in college. She lives with her children in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Kabita's son is now managing their timber business, which sells wood and timber. They have a small wood shop near their house. Her husband started up the business using his own funds and began by purchasing wood from the wholesale market and selling to the local carpentry shops and local people. Unfortunately, he died a few years back. Now Kabita helps her son to grow up the business. They hope to grow their small business so that they can improve their income and work toward financial stability, a goal that will help them improve their living standards.

So Kabita seeks a loan from BJS to invest in her business. The loan will help this poor but honest and needy family to increase their sales and increase their earnings, setting them on the first step to create a stable family environment with good living conditions and savings. 

The goal she has set is to get ahead with this business for the betterment of the family.

She is thankful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more timber for her son's business.

loans.name: Jahara

texts.en:
Jahara is a 29-year-old woman. She is from the village of West Magurmari in Dhupguri town at Jalpaiguri District. She lives with her husband, Tahidul, and her four children (two sons and two daughters). Both of the parents are illiterate and can sign their names only. Three of her children are attending school and are in different grades in primary and secondary schools. She is a homemaker and her husband is a cycle-van puller. 

Jahara's husband delivers goods and vegetables to the market shops. He has no van of his own. He hires and pays rent on a cycle-van from a local owner, so he is unable to make sufficient income. This three-wheeled cycle-operated transportation is very much popular and useful and is widely used in rural areas of West Bengal to carry goods and people.

So Jahara is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase their own cycle-van to generate more income. She has chosen this business because the demand for cycle-vans is very high in their area. Their high volume of work will create a steady income and it will make it possible for her to build a concrete house from the profit of her business. 

Jahara is taking the loan from BJS and Kiva to prove that it is not too difficult to overcome financial hurdles if financial assistance is received, and so that she can fulfill her dreams.

She is thankful to the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle-van for her husband.

loans.name: Manjurani

texts.en:
Manjurani is a 50-year-old illiterate woman who only can sign her name. She has three children and lives in the village Madhya Tekatuli, under the district of Jalpaiguri. Manjurani’s husband is engaged in agricultural work. Due to poor economic conditions, Manjurani and her husband were not able to send all of her children to school. One of her sons now reads in grade 9, and the other two children did not get an education. 

Manjurani always worried about the condition of their family and wants to do something for the sake of children and husband.
