So Manjurani set up her own business to serve her family better and for the future betterment of her children. Manjurani supplies milk to her neighbors and the local market, too. But there has been more demand for milk in the market, which pushes to Manjurani to buy another dairy cow.   

So Manjurani and her husband decided to take a loan from Kiva lenders via BJS to purchase a dairy cow for expanding the business of animal husbandry.  An extra cow will provide her with a lot of reasonable profit. She will be able to produce more milk and increase her sales volume. The decision makes Manjurani more comfortable about the future of her family and securing the future of her children.

Manjurani gives her heartiest thanks to Kiva and BJS for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her milk-supply business.

loans.name: Minu

texts.en:
Being a housewife, Minu always feels that she has to contribute to her family’s betterment. Minu is a 41-year-old lady. Her husband is a cycle-van puller and his earnings do not meet all the expenses of their family. Even their only son didn’t get an education due to poverty. To meet the family expenditures, her son is engaged as a daily laborer. Minu is illiterate and only can sign her name, and her husband studied up to grade 6.

Minu and her husband tried hard to increase their family income and are willing to buy their own cycle van. A cycle van is a mode of transportation in rural areas that carries people and goods from one place to another. But the only constraints are the funds which may demolish their dream. In the meantime, Minu heard about the BJS and Kiva, which gives loans for micro enterprise development for poor rural women. 

Minu then took a loan to buy a cycle van for her husband. And with that cycle van, her husband may increase his day-to-day earnings. Minu and her husband are now secure and safe, and they are thankful to Kiva and BJS for the betterment of their life.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle van for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, bread, milk, drinks and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, milk and other items. Her business goal is to have a business with high returns within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will open a supermarket. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, milk and other items

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Her name is Rose. She is 52, a resident of Malibay, Pasay City, Philippines, and married to Fernando. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs and to send her four children to school. 

Rose operates a general store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of 1000 Philippines peso (PHP) a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store she is requesting a 18000 PHP loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as fresh meat, sacks of rice, charcoal, soda and other grocery stuff. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings is her source to meet their daily living expense. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Rose hopes to maintain and grow her business so they can have a comfortable life in their old age. She prays to always have a happy and quiet life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 52 years old and married with three children.  

Nenita is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Nenita requested a 22,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Nenita has been in pig fattening for 32 years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Nenita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma works hard to support her family. Norma is married and has a cattle-raising business in the Philippines.

Norma requested a 21,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her cattle.

Norma has been in this business for six years now.

Norma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her cattle

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 63 years old and married with five children. 

Teresita is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Teresita requested a 26,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Teresita has been raising pigs for 11 years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 48 years old and married with two children. Yolanda works very hard to provide for them.

Yolanda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more items like shampoo, detergent soap, canned goods, snack foods, sanitary pads, noodles, etc., to sell.

Yolanda has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, detergent soap, canned goods, snack foods, sanitary pads, noodles, etc. 

Yolanda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like shampoo, detergent soap, canned goods, snack foods, sanitary pads, noodles, etc., to sell

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en:
Rahima, 38, has five children, and all of them go to nearby school. Rahima lives in a small village called South Mouyamari of Maynaguri under the district of Jalpaiguri. Rahima’s husband is a vendor who sells vegetables in the local market. 

Rahima has a popular grocery shop in her area. Local people use her grocery shop for their daily items to save time. For that reason, Rahima wants to increase the capacity of her shop so that she may able to supply necessary items for the people without any hindrances.

To meet all the expenses of the family, Rahima needs to expand her business. One day, Rahima came to know about Kiva’s partner BJS from her neighbors and decided to take a loan from them to buy more grocery items like lentils, oils, sugar, spices, biscuits, etc. 

The loan amount will give a boost in her business. With the business profit she will able to fulfill her dreams and also to plan for her children’s future. Rahima and her husband are thankful to Kiva and BJS for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Sarathi

texts.en:
Sarathi is a 40-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two children. Sarathi is engaged in a tailoring business by which she tries to meet her family’s expenses. Her husband is engaged in small jewelry work and unable to meet all the household expenses. Their two children go to the local school and Sarathi is worried about the future of her children. 

Sarathi came to know about BJS (Kiva’s partner) who provides loans for poor women. She wants to take some money as a loan to buy an improved sewing machine for expanding her existing business. This new machine will help Sarathi to produce more improved products and she may able to sell those products at a good price in her neighborhood. 

Sarathi and her family give their heartfelt thanks to their lenders.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Caliente Group

texts.es:
Está integrado por 3 luchadoras, que se han organizado desde hace 6 meses para conformar el grupo solidario caliente, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento y comprar mercadería para sus negocios de pulpería, venta de bastimentos y comercialización de mariscos.

Ana María: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, tiene 48 años de edad, es originaria de Puerto Cabezas, casada, tiene 5 hijos, en edad escolar.  Con muchos esfuerzos desde hace 3 años estableció su pequeño negocio de venta de bastimento: Solicita su segundo financiamiento para comprar mercadería: nancite, plátanos, pilipitas, yuca, bananos, carbón, coco, entre otros productos. Su sueño es mejorar la infraestructura de su  negocio.
texts.en:
Three members came together six months ago and created the communal bank “Caliente” with the objective to have access to loans and buy supplies for their businesses: a grocery store, food production and seafood.

Ana María is the group’s coordinator. She is 48 years old and was born in Puerto Cabezas. She is married and has five children who go to school. She worked hard to open her small business three years ago. She prepares side dishes.

Ana María is requesting her second loan to buy ingredients such as nancite [a fruit], plantains, pilipitas [a type of banana], cassava, bananas, coconut and coal. Her dream is to make some improvements to her establishment.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business, such as plantains, cassava and coconut.

loans.name: 29 De Septiembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo 29 de Setiembre está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Curuguaty,  la cual es una zona que aun se encuentra en crecimiento, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra. Isabel es una de la integrante, ella tiene su pequeño negocio de compras y ventas de Queso, faena de Chancho y ventas de Carne, ella  lleva sus productos a vender en lugares lejanos. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y por sobre todo muy luchadora.
Solicita de este préstamo para la compra productos varios, animales  y otros para seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
This group is called “29 de Septiembre” and is in its first cycle of the Women’s Committee Program. It is located in Curuguaty, a city that continues to grow. This is why the group’s members want to fight to make headway and contribute to the region’s development.

Isabel is one of the members. She has a small business where she buys and sells cheese, pork and beef. She delivers her products to distant places. She is a hardworking and tenacious woman.

She is requesting this loan to buy different products, types of meat, etc. and continue working the way she has been doing so far. In this way, she will continue to expand her business and give her family everything they need to live a dignified life.

loans.use: to buy different products and types of meat for her business.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife, 39, is a married woman with three children who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Marife has a direct selling Avon products business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Marife requested a PHP 1,2000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more products from Avon like lotion, body spray, perfume, deodorant, etc. to sell.

In the future, Marife would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more products like lotion, body spray, perfume, deodorant, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet, 31, is a married woman with three children who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Janet has a direct selling Splash products business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Janet requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more Splash products to sell to her customers.

In the future, Janet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as ambitious. 

She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of funds. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to be able to supply products as a wholesaler within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will become a wholesaler. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, milk and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 1 year to 12 years. He describes himself as focused. 

He operates a retail business where he sells beauty products. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a developing area and his primary customers are daily customers. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of funds. 

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products. His business goal is to be a supplier within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be tolerant. She operates an M-pesa business where she offers mobile-phone-based money-transfer services. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in an area good for business. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low cash flow. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to add M-pesa float. She hopes that in the future, she will have the best business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to add M-pesa float for her mobile-phone-based money-transfer service

loans.name: Berny

texts.en:
Berny is thankful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy new supplies and products needed for her massage service. Her income from the service helps to sustain her daily needs and other expenses.

She would now like to apply for a 10,000 PHP loan that she will use to pay for the necessary supplies and materials for her massage business. 

She is a charming and friendly woman so that her clients keep coming back to her, and they introduce her to their friends who wish to have a relaxing massage, especially after a hard day's work. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Berny dreams of having her own spa and massage clinic for her growing client base. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God that she studies . 

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Shohruh

texts.ru: Шохрух молодой и энергичный человек. Ему 19 лет. Он не женат и живет с родителями. В их семье 5 человек. Его мама занимается бизнесом. Шохрух окончил общеобразовательную школу. Он успешно учился в средней школе и получал отличные оценки. Он упорно учил такие предметы как русский язык, английский язык, географию и математику. Шохрух поступил в университет и данное время учится на 2 курсе. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Shohruh is an energetic young man. He is 19 years old. He is not married and lives with his parents. Their family has five people. His mother works in business. Shohruh graduated from secondary school. He successfully studied in high school and received excellent grades. He persistently learned subjects such as Russian, English, geography, and mathematics. Shohruh enrolled in the University and is currently studying two courses. He must pay tuition. He is asking for a loan to pay tuition. He is waiting for your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: pay for tuition

loans.name: Perez

texts.en:
Perez is a female Kiva borrower. She describes herself as simple, God-fearing and kind. 

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She describes her family challenge as lack of enough clean water for domestic use. 

She will use the KES 75,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use.

loans.name: Sewa Group

texts.fr:
SEWA est un groupe de l’association SIGUIDIA N°2 de SANANKOROBA. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants. Elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente d’encens  à l’image de AMI  qui est la deuxième  personne assise de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à BELEKAN, qui est l’un des quartiers de SANANKOROBA commune rurale dudit lieu dans la Préfecture de KATI (Région de KOULIKORO, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat  vente d’encens.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier  Prêt Solidaire. 
AMI, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à  SANANKOROBA, excelle dans la vente d’encens. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité importante d’encens.  Elle s’approvisionne à SANANKOROBA auprès des grossistes  et vend ses encens à  SANANKOROBA en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.    
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA  somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et  s’investir dans son activité.
texts.en:
The SEWA group is part of the SIGUIDIA N°2 association of SANANKOROBA. It consists of married women who know one another as neighbors and through ties of kinship. They average 35 years of age and four children each. They practice various activities including the purchase and sale of incense through AMI, sitting 2nd from the left in the group photo. They live in large traditional families in BELEKAN, a district of the rural commune of SANANKOROBA, prefecture of KATI (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali). 

Engaged in small trade for many years, they are in high demand for their purchase and sale of incense. 

In an effort to meet their customers’ increasing demand, the group members joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is their first group loan cycle.  

AMI, the group’s president, is well known around SANANKOROBA and highly skilled at selling incense. She plans to use her loan to buy a large quantity of 
incense. She buys her stock from wholesalers in SANANKOROBA and she retails it in the same area to a mixed clientele, cash or credit.    

AMI hopes to earn a monthly profit of 30,000FCFA, which will allow her to repay her loan and to reinvest in her activity.

loans.use: to buy incense.

loans.name: Farruh

texts.ru: Фаррух родился  1995 года. После окончания школы советом родителей он поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет. Данное время является студентом 2 курса юридического факультета. Он очень способный молодой человек. Фаррух увлекается спортом и в свободное время читает зарубежную литературу.  Родители не в состоянии оплатить за его учебу в университете. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы в университет. Он ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможем молодому человеку окончить университет и реализовать свои знания в будущем. Он выразил своё благодарность кредиторам КИВА за поддержку молодёжи.
texts.en: Farruh was born in 1995. After high school, due to his parents' advice, he entered Tajik State University. Now he is a second year law student. He is a very capable young man. Farruh is interested in sports and in his spare time he reads foreign literature. His parents are unable to pay for his studies at the university. He is asking for a loan to pay for his studies at the university. He is waiting for your kindness. This loan will help a young person graduate and use his knowledge in the future. He expressed his gratitude for the support Kiva lenders give young people.

loans.use: pay tuition

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
This is Jesus, 68, a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. He is married to Cristeta, who manages their household. He works to continually provide income to meet their family’s daily personal and household needs.

Jesus has a coffee vending machine beside their house which is located along the main plaza where people usually go to watch basketball games and other entertainment activities. Coffee is a favorite beverage also of Filipinos, whether it's hot coffee or ice-cold coffee. Jesus, despite his age, is still cheerful and energetic that people are happy going to his vending machine. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 600 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every day. 

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan, which he will use to buy another vending machine to serve his growing clients. He is positive this will boost his income as he expands his business. He is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given him. His earnings from his business helps sustain his family's daily household needs.

Jesus aims to grow his business to live a comfortable life in their old age. He prays for long and healthy living. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week, and this is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for an additional coffee vending machine.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be honest and faithful. She operates a retail business where she sells sweet potatoes, onions and tomatoes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a populated area, and her primary customers are both retail and wholesale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor means of transport. 

She will use the 60,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of sweet potatoes and onions. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to provide for her family. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sweet potatoes and onions

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana works hard to support her family. 

Luciana is married and has a manicure/pedicure service business in the Philippines. Luciana has been in this business for 10 years now.

Luciana requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials like nail polish, nipper, nail cutter, etc. for her business.

Luciana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials like nail polish, nipper, nail cutter, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Halicha

texts.ru: Халича, 42 года, разведена, есть дочь - студентка, учится в Медицинской академии. Халича на протяжении многих лет занимается торговлей фруктами, овощами, салатами, выпечкой в собственном павильоне, стартовав в далеком 1990 году. Благодаря упорному труду, Халича на сегодняшний день имеет прибыль до 40,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Кроме павильона у Халичи есть контейнер и холодильники для хранения солений, варенья, кумыза, собственный легковой и арендованный грузовой автомобиль, на которых она развозит изготовленную продукцию и сырье для производства. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Халича обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 95,000 сом (KGS) на покупку грузового автомобиля. По ее расчетам купить собственный автомобиль более выгодно, чем платить арендную плату. Доходы от кредита Халича планирует вложить в открытие новой торговой точки, чтобы иметь возможность платить за высшее образование ее дочери.
texts.en: Halicha is 42 years old, divorced, and has a daughter who is a student studying at the Academy of Medicine. For many years, Halicha has traded in fruits, vegetables, salads, and pastries from her own shop. She started back in 1990. Through hard work, Halicha now earns 40,000 KGS per month. In addition to the shop, Halicha owns a container and refrigerators to store pickles, jams, and kumis. She rents cars and a truck to deliver both manufactured products and raw materials for production. In order to further develop her business, Halicha asked the bank Bai -Tushum for a loan of 95,000 KGS to buy a truck. According to her calculations, to buying your own vehicle is more profitable than renting. Halicha plans to invest profits from the loan into opening a new shop so that she can pay for her daughter's higher education.

loans.use: buy a truck to distribute her goods.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena estudia la carrera de Ciencias de la Educación,  vive con sus padres que son empleados, al culminar su carrera  se ve ejerciendo su profesión. Le gustaría trabajar en un colegio privado, ya que está estudiando la carrera de ciencias de la educación.
Es una mujer muy emprendedora, que lucha por ser una profesional exitosa. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Elena is studying Educational Sciences. She lives with her parents who are employees. When she finishes her studies she will work in her profession. She would like to work in a private college as she is studying Educational Sciences. She is a very enterprising woman who is striving to become a successful professional. She is requesting this loan in order to pay her university tuition and continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase mobile phone accessories and phones

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es:
La Señorita Damaris esta viviendo con su padre, ella es una Persona Responsable Honesta y muy Respetuosa.
Ella esta cursando el penúltimo año de la Carrera de derecho y esta trabajando como Practicante. Uno de sus Objetivos es llegar a culminar sus Estudios Universitarios y llegar a ocupar el cargo de Agente fiscal.
pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera de manera poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Miss Damaris lives with her father. She is a responsible, honest and very respectful person. 

Damaris is now in her final year of law school and is already working as a practitioner. One of her objectives is to complete her university studies and become a fiscal agent.

Damaris is requesting this loan to be able to pay the university fees for law school in order to continue her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: pay for her  university tuition.

loans.name: Siguidayiriwaso Group

texts.fr:
SIGUIDAYIRIWASO est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de KANGARE. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants. Elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de légume à l’image de ANTA  qui est la première personne assise de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à KANGARE sous-préfecture dudit lieu, dans la  préfecture de YANFOLILA (Région de SIKASSO, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de légumes : gingembre et sucre. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a trois ans. Elles sont à leur septième prêt solidaire. 
ANTA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à  KANGARE, excelle dans la vente de légumes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,  4 paniers de carottes de concombres et 2 sacs d'orange. Elle s’approvisionne BAMAKO et SELINGUE auprès des grossistes. Elle  vend ses produits à  KANGARE en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et s’investir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Siguidayriwaso is a [borrowers’] group of the Benkadi Association in Kangare. The group is composed of women who know each other as relatives and neighbors. They are married and, on the average, are 45 years old, with four children. They are engaged in various business activities, such as buying and selling vegetables, which is what Anta does, for example. She is the first one seated from left to right in the photo. They live in traditional extended families in Kangare, in the subprefecture by the same name, Yanfolila prefecture, Sikasso Region, Mali. 

They have been working as vendors for a number of years and have a good customer following. They buy and sell  farm produce, such as ginger and sugar. With the goal of meeting the growing customer demand, the group members have decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their seventh solidarity loan.

Anta, who is the group leader and well known in Kangare, excels at selling vegetables. She plans to use her loan to buy four baskets of carrots and cucumbers as well as two bags of oranges. She buys from wholesalers in Bamako and Selinguie. She sells her wares in Kangare, retail, for cash and on credit, to a mixed clientele. She hopes to earn an average monthly revenue of 30,000 West African francs, which will allow her repay her loan and invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is single and has three children who attend school.  He is a farmer on a small piece of rented land. He operates a piggery and poultry keeping as the main activities on his farm.  Paul constructed more pig sties purposely to have more pigs. He also ordered more birds that he wants to rear. 

With the above projects, Paul's main constraint is financial. To overcome this problem, Paul requested his second loan from UGAFODE Microfinance for 4,000,000 UGX, which he will use to purchase poultry feeds and piglets. He hopes to earn a lot of money from farming so that he can acquire his own piece of land.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feeds and piglets

loans.name: Dahiana

texts.es:
Dahiana es una joven que estudia en la carrera de administración de empresas y a la vez trabaja en un hospital.
Ella con mucho esfuerzo sigue estudiando  para ser alguien en la vida y para darle un futuro  bueno a sus hijas. Su meta es acceder a un trabajo digno y así poder ascender y ayudarle económicamente a mis seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y de esa forma seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Dahiana is a youth who is studying Business Administration and is working in a hospital at the same time. She continues to study with much effort as she wants to be somebody in life and provide a good future for her children. Her goal is to gain access to dignified employment, to be able to get promotions and help her loved ones economically. She is requesting this loan to be able to pay her tuition and in this way continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Analia

texts.es:
Analia tiene 19 años, es estudiante de la carrera de Derecho, quiere lograr el sueño de obtener su título de Abogada convirtiéndose así en la primera profesional titulada de la familia.
Consiguió hace pocos meses un empleo en el Juzgado  donde estaba como practicante por lo que se siente orgullosa ya que sus metas se van cumpliendo y percibe  actualmente un salario fijo que le ayuda a paliar sus gastos ella misma aunque siempre recibe el apoyo de sus padres con quienes vive.
Analia solicita el préstamo para compra de libros y otros gastos que demanda la carrera.
texts.en: Analia is 19 years old and is studying Law. She wants to fulfill her dream of obtaining her Lawyer's degree becoming the first titled professional in her family. A few months ago she got a job in a court where she is working as an intern and she feels proud as she is fulfilling her goals. And she gets a fixed salary which helps to lessen her expenses although she still gets help from her parents with whom she lives. Analia is requesting a loan to buy books and pay for other expenses needed for her studies.

loans.use: to buy books and pay for other expenses for her studies.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Señora María es de la ciudad de Itá, es casada, tiene un hijo menor, el marido trabaja en una Empresa en la ciudad de Asunción hace varios años. La Sra.  María es estudiante universitaria, está en el 4to. año de la carrera de Licenciatura en Ciencias de la Educación, su mayor anhelo es graduarse y seguir estudiando con el fin de brindar un futuro mejor a  su hijo y otros miembros de su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Maria is from the city of Ita, is married, and has a young son. Her husband has worked in an enterprise in the city of Asuncion for various years.

Maria is a university student, in the fourth year of her degree program in Education Sciences. Her greatest hope is to graduate and continue studying for the purpose of offering a better future to her son and other members of her family.

Maria is requesting this loan to pay her graduation fee. In this manner, she will be able to continue striving as she has been doing.

loans.use: pay her university graduation fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy children clothes to start a new business

loans.name: Gulbarchyn

texts.ru: Гулбарчын 40 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей школьного и дошкольного возраста. У Гулбарчын средне-специальное образование, на протяжении 10 лет вместе с супругом активно занимаются полеводством и животноводством. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Гулбарчын есть 1 дойная корова, 1 лошадь с жеребенком, 2 бычка. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет в среднем 25,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства Гулбарчын  обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Она планирует и дальше увеличивать поголовье скота, развивая тем самым свой бизнес. Так как дети Гулбарчын - это главная ценность ее жизни, свой доход на буудет направлять на их воспитание и образование.
texts.en: Gulbarchyn is 40 years old, married, and the mother of five children who are both school and pre-school aged. Gulbarchyn has a vocational education.  For more than ten years, she and her husband have been actively involved in farming and livestock. Currently, Gulbarchyn's farm has one milk cow, one horse with a foal, and two bull-calves. Her monthly income is, on average, 25,000 KGS. In order to further develop her farm, Gulbarchyn approached the bank Bai-Tushum for a loan of 150,000 KGS to buy livestock. She plans to continue to increase her livestock, thus develop her business. Since Gulbarchyn's children are the most important thing in her life, she plans to use any profits she makes to raise and educate them.

loans.use: buy livestock.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio años atrás se recibió de Abogado y ahora está siguiendo un post-grado de consultor en medio ambiente.
Comenta que son sus hijos quienes lo motivan el día a día , su deseo es tener más conocimientos para poder escalar como profesional y ser útil a su familia y a la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su curso de post-grado, ya que es un curso muy caro, y necesita cubrir ese gasto. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Years ago, Antonio graduated as a lawyer and now, he is pursuing post-graduate studies as a consultant in environmental studies.

Antonio comments that it is his children who motivate him day to day. His desire is to have greater knowledge in order to advance as a professional and be useful to his family and society.

Antonio is requesting this loan to pay his registration fees for his post-graduate courses, because they are very expensive and he needs to cover the costs. He is grateful for the opportunity he is receiving to be able to grow.

loans.use: pay his fees for post-graduate studies in the university.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a second-time borrower of UGAFODE Microfinance Limited, applying for a loan of UGX 5,000,000. He is a married man with four children that he takes care of, with the help of his wife. 

James was formerly employed with some private entity that laid him off for some reason. Having been a hard-working man, he managed to start up a small hardware shop on the outskirts of the city. His major challenge is low working capital. He sat down and analyzed his business cash flows and operational expenses and found it worthwhile to apply for a loan of UGX 5,000,000. 

Slowly but surely, he dearly wants to grow his hardware shop into a big one where he can serve clients that are constructing big, commercial structures. If this is achieved, he says he will have attained his main dream.

loans.use: to buy cement and paint to sell.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen hace 16 años que vive en Pilar, actualmente pretende terminar una carrera universitaria para mejorar sus ingresos y por ende tener una mejor calidad de vida. 
Trabajo en una universidad y comenta que su marido es docente. Ella está estudiando la carrera de derecho, y sabe que por medio de su profesión podrá abrirse camino.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y así seguir luchando.
texts.en: Carmen has lived in Pilar for 16 years. She is currently hoping to complete her university studies to improve her earnings and in the end have a better quality of living. She works in a university and says that her husband is a teacher. She is studying Law and she knows that through her profession she can open doors. She is requesting this loan to be ab;e to pay the tuition for her studies and she can continue to struggle.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is thankful that she was granted her previous loan of 15,000 PHP which she used to buy oil, towels, lotion and other supplies for her massage service. Her income from this business helped meet her family's daily needs.
 
Mary Grace would like to apply for another loan of 10,000 PHP which she will use to buy new towels, more massage lotion, oils, and powder she needs for her business. She earns a minimum of 600 PHP a day for her services. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Mary Grace hopes to be able to expand her business soon and have her own massage salon to serve her growing clientele. She dreams of giving her family a better life and being able to send her nieces to school. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase massage supplies such as oil, towels, and lotion.

loans.name: Muong Phang 8 Group

texts.en:
Un is 27 years old, married, and has two children. They live in a small Thai traditional house in a poor remote village. Un and her husband work at agricultural production where they cultivate rice and raise chickens, ducks, pigs, and fish. 

Un wants to expand the business by investing in fish farming. She requested her fifth loan from Anh Chi Em Program, which she will use to buy small fish. She used the previous loan to invest in fish and thanks to the technical support from the Anh Chi Em staff, she earned a high profit. Un hopes that her business will go expand so she can afford to send her children to college and provide them an abundant life. 

In the picture, Un is wearing a flowered shirt and stands first from the right.

loans.use: to purchase fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay education expenses.

loans.name: Siguidia Group

texts.fr:
SIGUIDIA est un groupe de l’association BENKOLA de COULOU. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants. Elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de grain de néré à l’image de KADIA qui est la première  personne debout de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à COULOU, qui est l’un des quartiers de OUELESSEBOUGOU commune rurale dudit lieu dans la  Préfecture de KATI (Région de KOULIKORO, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de grains de néré. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. 
KADIA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à OUELESSEBOUGOU, excelle dans la vente de grains de néré. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 30 sacs de grains de néré.  Elle  s’approvisionne à OUELESSEBOUGOU et vend ses produits à OUELESSEBOUGOU et BAMAKO par sac de 100kg, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 80.000FCFA somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et  s’investir dans son activité.
texts.en:
The SIGUIDIA group is part of the BENKOLA association of COULOU. It consists of married women who know one another as neighbors and through ties of kinship. They average 45 years of age and four children. They practice various activities including the purchase and sale of néré seeds through KADIA, standing first from the right in the group photo. They live in large traditional families in COULOU, a district of the rural commune of OUELESSEBOUGOU, prefecture of KATI (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali). 

Engaged in small trade for many years, they are in high demand for their purchase and sale of néré seeds. 

In an effort to meet their customers’ increasing demand, the group members joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is their third group loan cycle.  

KADIA, the group’s president, is well known around OUELESSEBOUGOU and highly skilled at selling néré seeds. She plans to use her loan to buy 30 sacks of néré seeds. She buys her stock in OUELESSEBOUGOU, and she retails it there as well as in BAMAKO in 100-kg bags, cash or credit, to a mixed clientele.    

KADIA hopes to earn a monthly profit of 80,000FCFA, which will allow her to repay her loan and to reinvest in her activity.

loans.use: to buy nere seeds.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is thankful that she was granted a PHP 15,000 loan which she used to purchase materials and supplies needed in her welding shop business. For additional income, she also now has a small retail store, where she appears in her photo. Through her earnings, she is able to meet her daily personal and household needs.

Edna would now like to apply for a PHP 15,000 loan, which she will use to buy grocery items to add to her product inventory, like rice, peanut butter, coffee, soda, noodles, and some hair spray and lotion. She knows that more items in her store should yield more sales and, thus, increase her earnings. She earns a minimum of PHP 400 from her small business. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Edna dreams of having a bigger general store. She wants to save enough money for her old age. She prays for a happy and victorious life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for food items and beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Menerma

texts.en:
Menerma, age 42, is from Eastern Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Menerma joined PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the Coop. The Coop supported her by providing the capital to start her sari-sari store. 

Helping the family survive, she never gets tired of tending her little store. Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and so she makes promising daily sales. Menerma keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores. She believes that with the support of her family, they will sustain and beat the competition. 

Menerma is now trying to expand her resources, so she decided to engage in selling chicken and pork barbecue for added income. She presented her project proposal to Paglaum MPC to finance the project and has applied for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy merchandise for her store and pay for inventories of chicken and pork meat for her barbecue.

She hopes to continue putting bread and butter on the table in their home. With her extra income, she wishes to live a happy and comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store and pay for inventories of chicken and pork meat for her barbecue to continue putting bread and butter on the table in their home

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de quatre  femmes, les membres du groupe Benkadi sont toutes  mariés dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont une moyenne  d’âge de 52 ans et 7 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Torokorobougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liaisons de parenté, de voisinage et  de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font la vente de, grains de céréales (riz, maïs et mil) et condiments. Dans  le souci de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur  4ème cycle de  prêt  solidaire.
Madame Kadiatou  (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de grains de céréales (riz, maïs et mil). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 sacs de mil et 4 sacs de riz et 4 sacs de maïs. Elle s’approvisionne en grains de céréales dans les villages environnants de Bamako. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit  et parfois par commande à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Kadiatou  compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 150 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour assurer les soins de santé des enfants. Elle a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of four women members, who are all married and living in polygamous households. They average 52 years of age with seven children each and all live in Torokorobougou, a district of Bamako. They got to know each other as relatives or neighbors and through their income-generating activities. The group members sell cereal grains (rice, corn and millet) and condiments. They decide to turn to Soro Yiriwaso to build up their stocks and are on their fourth group loan cycle.

Kadiatou (who is the woman sitting on the far right of the photo) is a significant seller of cereal grains (rice, corn and millet). She is planning to use her loan to buy five sacks of millet, four sacks of rice and four sacks of corn. She gets her supplies of grains in the villages surrounding Bamako. She resells for cash and on credit, and sometimes to order, to a customer base made up mainly of women. 

By means of this loan, Kadiatou expects to make an average monthly profit of 150,000FCFA, which will be used to cover her children's healthcare. Her aim is to increase her business volume through this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy cereal grains.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is driven by a passion for selling. At the age of 40, she is a hardworking mother living in Tangub City, Philippines, and she runs a store that provides the main support for their family. 

She never tires of tending her store which she has been doing for 12 years now. Marites is a full-fledged member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and has taken several loans already. She diligently repaid her obligations without any record of default. 

Now, Marites has borrowed another loan to purchase inventories of sugar, milk, oil, noodles, and soft drinks to increase sales and generate more income. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities for Marites to pay her monthly lease. 

In the future, Marites dreams of sustaining her store so she can continue to provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase inventories of sugar, milk, oil, noodles, and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.es:
El Sr. Abelardo está casado con la Sra. María  hace varios años tienen 4 hijos mayores, que con mucho sacrificio han podido sacar adelante.
Abelardo tiene un taller de motos y venta de repuestos para los mismos. Ellos se iniciaron en esta actividad con un pequeño capital que juntaron cuando aún eran solteros.  Él ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos. 
En esta ocasión solicita el préstamo para aumentar sus herramientas por  que día a día el mercado de su actividad está aumentando.
texts.en:
Abelardo and María have been married for a number of years now, and they have four grown children whom they were able to raise by making many sacrifices.

Abelardo has a motorcycle repair shop, and he also sells parts.  They started this business with a small amount of capital that they put together when they were still single, and he has shown himself to be a very responsible and honest person with his commitments.

He is requesting a loan in order to add more tools, as the demand for his work is increasing every day.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his repair shop.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam has the skills and expertise in candle making; however, she has no capital to start the business. As a mother from Lopez Jaena, she never gets tired of supporting her family in any way she can help her husband, as long as it earns income. 

She joined PMPC after she learned she could get financial assistance. She decided to venture into a candle making business. It has been doing well when she doubles her time perfecting the shape and quality of her candles. She has maximized her profits and keeps pursuing her goals for the good of her family. 

The reason why she requested another loan from PMPC is to purchase additional raw materials and needed equipment to increase production in her candle making business, and to be able to supply stock as well. She hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family. Today, Meriam is able to help others with their retailing businesses by selling her candles, and her own family earns as well.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials and needed equipment to increase production in her candle making business.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie, 44 years old, lives in Eastern Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental with her husband and four children. Her husband is a carpenter but has no permanent work.

Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, Melanie has found ways to attain income through snack & food vending. It began with selling a small amount of viands & snacks to their neighbors. 

Then she joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store in January of 2013. She became a MIGS member, which is why she has received loans several times already. 

Now, she is applying for 7,000PHP to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store to draw more customers to buy from her. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store to draw more customers to buy from her.

location.town: Plaridel-Eastern Pob., Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide

loans.name: Lea

texts.en: Leah, a responsible mother, requests a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory. She wants to buy more inventories of vegetables and spices to sell. This way, she will be able to sell more products which will allow her to maximize her profit and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of vegetables and spices to sell for maximizing profit.

location.town: Plaridel - So. Pob. Plaridel, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Segunda

texts.en:
Segunda is best described as a hardworking mother. She is a widow from Lopez Jaena who earns a meager income from her retail business. She sells vegetables and spices, and is now requesting a loan from Paglaum MPC which she will use to increase her inventory. 

She wants to buy more inventories of vegetables and spices to sell. This way, she will be able to sell more products which will allow her to earn more income and provide her family with a good standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more inventories of vegetables and spices to sell for more income.

location.town: Plaridel-Eastern Pob., Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is 43 years old and she is a widow with three children who are all of school age. Her major source of income is rice farming. She is also engaged in "palay" trading, and also the buying and selling of rice. ("Palay" is harvested rice with the shell still on, not yet dried.)

She has been in this business for 7 years already. The business has helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. 

Ivy wants to expand her rice retailing business so that her customers will be served well and able to supply more sacks of rice in the market. She is planning for a business expansion for the benefit of her children and even for her future grandchildren. 

She made use of loans previously to purchase more sacks of "palay" to produce more rice, and now she is applying for a loan for her rice retailing business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of "palay" to produce more rice for her customers.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 53 years old and lives in Plaridel, Philippines. She is a mother of 4 adult children. 

Rebecca earns a living through her copra retailing business; she buys coconuts from her neighbors for copra production which she then sells at the market. The business has been doing well for more than 10 years already and sustains the basic necessities of her extended family. 

Rebecca has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to be able to purchase more coconuts for her copra production and consequently maximize her profit for the family. 

Rebecca continues to look for better business opportunities and would love to be in a position to help others.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts for copra production.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 38 years old and lives in Sumasap, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children, now at their school age. 

Marivic has been earning income from her agrivet supply business for two years already. She is also receiving support from her husband as an OFW.  Marivic earns approximately PHP 7,000 each month doing these types of business activities. 

She has requested a loan to be used to purchase roofing materials for her ongoing house repair. 

Marivic became a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) just this year. In the future, she hopes to expand her agrivet supply business, with her husband as her managing partner.

loans.use: to be used to purchase roofing materials.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El grupo El progreso  está en su ciclo número 9 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Pelagia, una señora muy luchadora.
Pelagia se dedica a las ventas, vende prendas varias de manera ambulante y por medio de este trabajo es que tiene los medios necesarios para poder ayudar a su familia. Es una mujer muy dedicada a sus seres queridos, ya que es por ellos quienes lucha.
Pide este préstamo ya que quiere comprar remeras, jeans, pantalones, camisas y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Cada una pone su mejor esfuerzo para poder realizar sus metas y sueños.
texts.en: “El Progreso” group is in its ninth cycle with the women’s committee program, where everyone works and helps each other to get ahead. They are taking the poverty elimination survey.  One of the members is Pelagia, a very hardworking woman.  Pelagia is engaged in sales, selling various items of clothing as a street vendor, and it is through this job that she has the means necessary to be able to support her family.  She is woman who is very devoted to her loved ones, and she strives for them.  She is requesting this loan because she wishes to purchase T-shirts, jeans, pants, shirts, and other items, and so be able to continue her work as she has been doing.  Each member puts in her best effort to be able to realize her goals and dreams.

loans.use: to purchase T-shirts, jeans, pants, shirts, and other items.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
In the year 2012, Arlyn joined Paglaum MPC after she learned that it will give financial assistance for start-ups. As a farmer in Puntod, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan for the working capital she needed for her rice farming activity. After cropping, she was able to return her borrowed capital. 

To this day, Arlyn feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her rice farm. Recently, she requested a loan to purchase farm supplies and fertilizer to increase the harvest. Arlyn wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply rice in her town.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and fertilizer to increase the harvest on her rice farm.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 53 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 9 children, all now at their adult and/or school age. 

Norma has been earning income from vegetable gardening and fishing activities for 20 years already. She is also earning a monthly honorarium from their barangay (village) as a caretaker of the barangay beach resort. She earns approximately PHP4,000 each month doing these types of business activities. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing fertilizers and sprays for her existing gardening activity. The remaining amount is for the purchase of new fishing hooks and nylon threads.

Norma has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her vegetable gardening business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and sprays.

loans.name: Garantie Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de quatre femmes, les membres du groupe Garantie sont équitablement  mariés dans des ménages monogamiques et polygamiques. Elles ont une moyenne  d’âge 43 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Torokorobougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liaisons de parenté, de voisinage et  de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font la vente de, condiments (tomates, choux, aubergines…) et légumes. Dans  le souci de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur  4ème cycle de  prêt  solidaire.
Madame Youma (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une bonne réputation dans la vente de condiments (tomates, choux, aubergines, tomates…). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 sacs de choux, 3 corbeilles de tomates  et  4 sacs d’aubergines. Elles s’approvisionnent en condiments à Médine. La revente se fait au comptant ou à crédit en ambulant et parfois par commande à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Youma compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 125 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour assurer la scolarisation et les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
Made up of four women, half the members of the Garantie Group are married into monogamous family frameworks with the other half married into polygamous family frameworks. On average, each group member is 43 years old with an average of three children each. They all live in Torokorobougou, one of the districts of Bamako. They all know each other through the bonds of family and community, as well as through their revenue-generating activities. The members of this group sell foodstuffs (tomatoes, cabbages, aubergines) and vegetables. In order to build up their stocks, the group members decided to turn to Soro Yiriwaso. This will be their fourth loan.

Youma, the woman sat to the right of the photo, has worked to build up a solid reputation as a seller of foodstuffs (tomatoes, cabbages, aubergines). She plans on using her part of the loan to purchase three sacks of cabbages, three baskets of tomatoes and four sacks of aubergines. She gets her supplies from the town of Médine. She sells her wares in exchange for cash and credit, both as a street vendor and sometimes delivering door-to-door, to a customer base comprised primarily of women. With this loan, Youma plans on making an average monthly profit of 125,000 FCFA, which will be used to pay for her children's school fees as well as for ensuring their good health.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs

loans.name: Fenie

texts.en:
Fenie has completed signing up for her membership with PMPC and borrowed the needed capital to start up a sari-sari (variety) store business. She is 34 years of age and lives with her husband and four kids in Agunod, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. 

She is thankful for the capital that PMPC extends to a small time loaner like herself. Fenie is able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. 

Recently, she took out a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce, noodles and soft drinks to increase her inventory. This will give her an opportunity to maximize her profit. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family and provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce, noodles and soft drinks.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is from Unidos, Plaridel, Philippines. She is married with five adult age children. Remedios is making a profit in her retailing business. She buys coconuts from her neighbors for copra (coconut juice) production and sells it in bulk to the market for which she can fetch a higher price. 

She has had this business for 28 years and supported her family, especially her children's education, until they graduated and got jobs on their own. She requested a loan to purchase more inventories of coconuts to produce more copra and be able to generate a higher income for their needs. 

Remedios has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, she hopes to own a space near town so that she can sell to more customers from different barangays (villages). This would be a good business opportunity.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of coconuts to produce more copra (coconut juice) and generate a higher income.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita de 61 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz, arroz y frijoles, vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside, Margarita esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en: Margarita is 61 years old, and lives in her own home with her husband and three children.  For several years, she has been engaged in farming, growing corn, rice, and beans.  She sells her products around the area where she lives.  Margarita is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control products, etc. and improve the land (shown in the photograph) and be able to continue with her work.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control products, etc. and improve the land.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La Sra. Teodora es una Señora muy trabajadora y luchadora, que con la ayuda de su esposo esta trabajando, son muy conocidos por la buena variedad de productos que siempre tienen. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en comprar botas, calzados y demás tipo de calzados, que vendió y que le ayudó a poder mejorar sus ventas.
Ella pide este préstamo nuevamente para poder comprar zuecos, sandalias, zapatillas, los que podrá vender y seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Señora Teodora is a very hardworking and determined woman who is working with the help of her husband. They are very well-known for the good variety of products that they always have. She mentions that she used her previous loan to buy boots, shoes, and other types of footwear, which she sold and which helped her to improve her sales.

She is requesting this loan once again to be able to buy clogs, sandals, and flip-flops that she can sell in order to carry on with the work she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en:
Feliza, a widow, is a mother of six children who are all in their adult age. She lives in Clarin, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

She is earning a living through her snack-vending business, where she sells "suman", supporting the family's needs when she became a widow. Feliza has applied her membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and she appreciates the programs and services of the Cooperative. 

She is in need of additional working capital to purchase additional raw ingredients to increase her production of "suman" (rice rolls), to provide more customers. She asked for financial assistance from PMPC, in the amount of PHP 10,000, and she is thankful for the financing of her capital needs. 

In addition, she wanted to expand her business and to provide good business management for her loyal customers. With her extra income, Feliza deeply wishes to have a better life and adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients for her "suman" production.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La  joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 24 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de ropa de cama desde hace varios años, comercializa de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, vive en casa propia con su tía, la joven esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa de cama por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young woman whose face has been blurred is 24 years old, and lives in a high risk area.  She has been engaged in selling bedding for several years.  She sells her merchandise as a street vendor in the different communities near where she lives.  She lives in her own home with her aunt, and she is requesting a loan to purchase more wholesale bedding to be able to continue with her sales, which will enable her to have better income.

loans.use: to purchase more wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Santa Rita Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Rita está en su 10 ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, cada una es jefa de familia, que se decidieron a formar parte de este desafío, y es de aquí que surge este grupo, que viene trabajando de manera muy unida.
Maria es una mujer muy decidida, que se gana la vida de una manera muy digna, a través de venta de prendas de manera ambulante, su sueño siempre fue tener su local propio y por medio de ello ayudar a sus seres queridos. Fija en que su sueño se podrá cumplir algún día, pone se mejor esfuerzo.
Pide este préstamo para comprar prendas varias, y así seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo, luchando por cumplir con sus sueños.
texts.en:
The Santa Rita group is in its tenth cycle of the women's committee program. Each member is the head of her family; they decided to become part of this challenge and that's how this group emerged. The members work together in a very united fashion.

Maria is a very decisive woman who earns a living in a very dignified manner by selling clothing in an itinerant fashion. Her dream was always to have her own store and to help her loved ones with this work. She thinks she'll be able to achieve her dream some day and is making her best effort. She is asking for this loan to buy an assortment of clothing and thus to continue with her work as she has been doing, striving to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of clothing to sell

loans.name: Anselma

texts.es:
La Sra. Anselma proviene de una familia que se dedicó siempre a la venta ambulante, especialmente de sobrecamas. Desde muy joven fue a la Argentina para trabajar y poder terminar sus estudios primarios. Con el tiempo formó pareja, y tiene una hija mayor a quien le dio posibilidad para terminar su carrera ,ahora ya está  trabajando.
Ella es una señora muy sacrificada, que con mucho sacrificio pudo conseguir todo lo que tiene.
Necesita acceder a un préstamo para comprar remeras de dicha procedencia debido a que tiene muchos pedidos de sus productos.
texts.en:
Señora Anselma comes from a family that has always worked in street vending, primarily selling bedspreads. Since she was very young, Anselma has gone to Argentina in order to work and be able to finish her primary education. Eventually, she got into a relationship, and she has an adult daughter to whom she gave the opportunity to finish her degree; she is already working.

Anselma is a very selfless woman, who with great sacrifice was able to achieve everything she has.

She needs to gain access to a loan in order to buy t-shirts from Argentina because she has many orders for their products.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts to sell

loans.name: Mburucuya Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mburucuya  está en su ciclo número 8 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra María quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere decir que ha ido mejorando a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, trabajo mediante el cual ayuda a sus familiares, dándoles una vida sin privaciones-
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de frutas y verduras variadas, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group named Mburucuya is in its eight loan cycle of the women's committee program, where everyone works and helps each other to get ahead. The group is taking part in the poverty elimination survey.

One of the members is Maria, who showed a poverty level of three in her latest survey. This means that she has been improving through the hard efforts, continuous work, and the qualities associated with a successful woman. She makes a living selling fruits and vegetables, an occupation through which she helps her relatives to live without privation.

Maria is requesting this loan to buy an assortment of fruits and vegetables, which will help her realize her business plan and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Maira Beatriz

texts.es: Maira de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado lechero desde hace 5 años,  es una mujer trabajadora, responsable y muy emprendedora, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside, ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende su negocio. Por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas para el ganado y ajustar para la compra de una vaca lechera que le permita crecer en el negocio. Con esto espera obtener resultados favorables y continuar brindando la ayuda económica a su hogar que tanto lo necesita.
texts.en:
Maira is 30 years old, and she lives in a home of her own with her life partner and their two children. She has worked raising dairy cows for the last 5 years, and she is a very hard-working, responsible and enterprising woman. She sells her products in the area surrounding her home.

Maira has decided to invest in caring for her cattle, because her business depends on them. This is why she is requesting a loan to purchase vitamins for her cattle to adjust for the purchase of a milk cow which would allow her business to grow. She hopes to have favorable results and to continue providing economic help to her home, which needs the support so much.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and a milk cow.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos y su compañero de vida, ella posee una panadería en su casa de habitación desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos con los vecinos y tiene muchos clientes, Marina está solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, levadura, huevos, latas, etc. para poder continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Marina is 42 years old, and she lives in a home of her own with her four children and her life partner.

She has owned a bakery in her home for several years. She sells her products to her neighbors, and she has many clients. Marina is requesting a loan to purchase flour, sugar, yeast, eggs, and tins to be able to continue with her work.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, yeast, eggs and tin.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase thread, needles, buttons, fabric, and other necessary products.

loans.name: Derlis

texts.es:
Derlis tiene 29 años, es soltero y vive con su madre en la ciudad de Carapeguá.               Desde muy temprana edad empezó a trabajar como vendedor de ropas, calzados deportivos a cuotas, luego empezó también a vender los  productos artesanales de la zona que lo lleva a vender por las ciudades de Fernando de la  Mora y Asunción,   transportándose en su motocicleta que gracias a este trabajo logró comprarse y también ayuda a la familia para salir adelante.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hamacas, frazadas y sábanas puesto que tiene muchos pedidos de estos productos, y quiere poder cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Derlis is 29 years old, he is single and lives with his mother in the city of Carapeguá. From a very young age, he began working as a salesman, selling clothing and athletic footwear on a payment system. Later, he also began to sell handicrafts in the area around the cities of Fernando de la Mora and Asunción, getting there on his motorcycle which, thanks to this work, he was able to buy. He also helps his family to get ahead.

He is requesting this loan to purchase hammocks, sheets and blankets because he receives lots of requests for these products, and he wants to stick to his word with his clients.

loans.use: to purchase hammocks, blankets and sheets.

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
El grupo de mujeres se llama San Isidro, son  de la ciudad de San  Ignacio, ellas son unidas y solidarias entre ellas, trabajan juntas en actividades.
Agustina es la presidenta de este grupo, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas que son muy ricas y pedidas por sus clientes, comenta que por medio de su sacrificio y esfuerzo está ayudando a su familia y sus seres queridos. Está recibiendo capacitaciones que le ayudan a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos para poder seguir con su elaboración de alimentos, como ser verduras, condimentos, carne, y demás.
texts.en:
