This women's group is called San Isidro and they are from the city of San Ignacio. The women are very close and supportive of each other, and they work together on activities.

Agustina is the president of this group, and she works preparing and selling food that is very tasty and frequently requested by her clients. She comments that because of her sacrifice and hard work, she is helping her family and her loved ones. She receives training that helps her to get ahead with her work as she has done before.

She is requesting this loan to purchase ingredients to be able to continue preparing meals, such as vegetables, condiments, meat and others.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, condiments, meat and others.

loans.name: Eve

texts.en:
Eve is 38 years of age and married with two kids. They live in Sta. Cruz, Tangub City.

Eve is gaining a profit through her sari-sari (small grocery) store business. She earns a meager income from it that sufficiently supports her family.

She is a determined businesswoman who never loses hope in pursuing her goals despite the odds she faces on the way. She never gets tired of tending her store since she has driven by a passion for selling. 

Eve is a fully fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now she has applied for a loan to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari (small grocery) store to serve more customers and increase her sales.

Eve continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the strong will and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari (small grocery) store to serve more customers and increase her sales

location.town: Tangub-P3 Sta. Cruz, Tangub City, Mindanao

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan de 57 años de edad vive con su esposa en casa propia, él se dedica a la venta de pan francés en su moto por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su casa, tiene mucha clientela por los buenos precios, Juan está solicitando un crédito para la compra de más pan francés por mayor y darle mantenimiento a su moto para poder continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Juan is 57 years old and he lives with his wife in a home of their own. 

He works selling baguettes on his motorcycle to the neighborhoods that are close to his home, and he has lots of clients because his prices are good.

Juan is requesting this loan to purchase more wholesale baguettes and to do some maintenance work on his motorcycle to continue working.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale baguettes and to do some maintenance work on his motorcycle.

loans.name: Jissela Judith

texts.es:
Jissela es una joven de 22, vive sola en casa de familiares en un pequeño  en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Colorados, una ciudad con un clima cálido húmedo, conocida también por ser un sector muy productivo y comercial. 
Jissela es propietaria de un pequeño local donde vende ropa usada,  con experiencia hace más de un año; ahí también  tiene un gabinete, donde le ayuda una chica. El negocio está bien ubicado, y cuenta con varia clientela porque los atiende muy gustosamente, ya que es una joven llena de carisma.
Jissela emprendió este negocio por ayuda de su madre, ahora se maneja sola y se siente muy feliz de contar con su propio ingreso, ya que gracias a esto ella ha podido comprase una pequeña casita.
Se siente muy agradecida con la Fundación y el proyecto Kiva, ya que con el crédito podrá crecer en su negocio, comprar mercadería y surtirlo más para empezar vida crediticia.
texts.en:
Jissela is a 22-year-old young woman who lives by herself in a small family house in the city of Santo Domingo de los Colorados, a city with a humid, warm climate that is also known for being a very productive and commercial area.

Jissela is the owner of a small store where she has sold used clothing for more than a year. She also has an office where she has a girl to help her out. The business is well located and has many customers because she attends to them happily, as she is a young woman full of charisma. Jissela started this business to help her mother; now she runs it by herself and she feels very happy to have her own income, as she has been able to buy herself a small house thanks to this business.

She feels very grateful to the foundation and to the Kiva project, as with the loan she will be able to grow in her business, to buy merchandise and to stock her business more to earn a credit history.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and to stock her business

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is a hardworking woman who runs a retail shop that sells general merchandise such as maize flour, millet flour, and sugar. She lives in Masindi, Uganda with 7 children, of which 5 attend school.

She desires to build a commercial house but lacks enough capital. Teopista is faced with a challenge of competition and needs a loan to buy maize flour, millet flour, and sugar to sell.
.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, millet flour, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Alexey

texts.en:
Alexey is married and has adult children. He has his own business.

Alexey is engaged in greenhouse farming and has extensive experience of 25 years. He grows early and late vegetables: cucumbers, tomatoes, cabbage and potatoes. Alexey is ambitious and hardworking. He wants to develop his business further.

Alexey is asking for a loan in the amount of 40,000 UAH to build two greenhouses. The loan will help him to prepare for the season and to receive the income from sales of the early vegetables.

loans.use: to build two greenhouses

loans.name: Kutimuy Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “KUTIMUY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Josefa ella es casadasoltera y tiene 60 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maíz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "KUTIMUY". This bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Maria Josefa. She is married/single and is 60 years old and has 3 children. She works selling grains: corn, wheat and quinoa. She works from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm, and has been in this business for 4 years- it is going well. Maria Josefa's dream is to have a stall where she can sell her grains. She is reqeusting this loan to buy wheat, corn and quinoa. 

Maria Josefa's photo is attached to the group photo, her photo was taken after the meeting because she had to miss the meeting because of work.

The other members work selling candies and clothing, and with their grocery stores and book stores. 

Maria Josefa is thankful to those who are a part of her dream through Kiva, and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase wheat, corn and quinoa.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 21 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la crianza de pollos desde hace varios años, el joven vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el quiere mejorar su vivienda pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para poder cambiar el techo y poder comprar laminas, polines y pago de mano de obra y asi poder vivir mas seguros.
texts.en: The young man whose face is blurred because he is 21 years old and lives in a high-risk area has made a living by raising chickens for many years. He lives in a house he owns with his life partner. He wants to improve his home but he doesn't earn enough from his sales to be able do so. For this reason he is asking for a loan to be able to replace the roof, to buy sheet metal and beams and to pay for labor. In this way he will be able to live in a safer house.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal and beams and to pay for labor

loans.name: Lelane

texts.en:
Lelane is 42 years old and married with seven children, six of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lelane is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lelane has been raising pigs for seven years and earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Emelia works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling roasted whole pigs in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear. Emelia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional pigs for her business.

Emelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs for her business

loans.name: Carlos Orlando

texts.es:
Carlos es un señor de 35 años, un señor muy trabajador; vive en Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, una ciudad muy comercial y productiva, es conocida también porque en la zona vive la Comunidad Tsachila una etnia muy representativa e importante de Ecuador. Carlos tiene dos hijos, que viven junto a él y su esposa en casa propia, la misma que gracias al esfuerzo de tantos años de trabajo pudo construirla.
Carlos actualmente tiene una pequeña fábrica de queso, él hace años atrás trabajó en una empresa y ahí es donde aprendió a elaborar el queso; ya tiene 6 años con su propio negocio. Cuenta con dos trabajadores, que desde muy temprano le ayudan en la preparación, elaboran queso de mesa y pasteurizado. Carlos cuenta con clientela fija quienes retiran el producto en su domicilio.
Carlos tiene el apoyo total de su familia, todos le ayudan en lo que pueden. Carlos solicita un crédito para la compra de una mesa inoxidable para elaborar el queso, ya que con la que cuenta no abastece para su producción.
Está muy agradecido con la institución ya que le abrimos las puertas, no esperaba que se le dé una mano tan eficazmente. Con el crédito podrá mejorar su fábrica.
texts.en:
Carlos is 35 years old, and very hard-working. He lives in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, a very commercial and productive city that is also known for the Tsachila indigenous group, a very representative and important group in Ecuador, who also lives in the area.

Carlos has two children who live with him and his wife in a house of their own that they were able to build after many years of hard work. Carlos currently has a small cheese factory. He worked for a company years before, and it was there that he learned to make cheese, now he has had his own business for 6 years. He has two workers who help him to make cheese very early, they make table cheese and pasteurized cheese. Carlos has many stable clients who pick up their products at his home. 

Carlos has the full support of his family; they all help him when they can. He is requesting this loan to purchase a stainless steel table to prepare cheese, because the one that he has is not enough for his production.

He is very grateful to the institution because they opened doors for him, he didn't not expect to be helped so efficiently. With the loan, he will be able to improve his factory.

loans.use: to purchase a stainless steel table to make cheese.

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Rosa del Rosario está en 4to ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se unieron con el objetivo de poder ayudarse las unas a las otras y por medio de esa unión y trabajo en equipo poder ayudar a sus familias.
Cynthia, una de las integrantes, tiene una despensa bien surtida, en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas, es muy dedicada y esta abocada a poder ayudar a su familia, e ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida. Su día empieza desde muy tempranas horas, ya que tiene muchos clientes y quiere cumplir con ellos. Empezó muy tímidamente y hoy ya tiene muy buena clientela. Pide este préstamo para la compra de productos varios, ya que de esa forma podrá surtir su despensa y seguir dando a sus clientes buena variedad de productos.
texts.en:
The “Santa Rosa del Rosario” Group is in its 4th loan cycle with the Women’s Communal Bank Program, in which they have joined together to empower themselves to help one another, and work as a team in order to be able to help their families.

Cynthia, one of the members, has a small, well-stocked grocery store in which she works every day, starting very early in the morning. She is very dedicated, and she is focused on being able to help her family and improve their living conditions.

Her day starts very early, as she has many customers, and she wants to be there for them.  She started out very timidly, and now she has a very good clientele. 

She is requesting this loan in order to purchase various products, as this way, she will be able to stock her store and continue giving her customers a good variety of products.

loans.use: to purchase various products in order to stock her small grocery store.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es: Adrian de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y a la crianza de ganado desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados, Don Adrian esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas ganado y seguir con su trabajo ya que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Adrian is 62 years old and lives in a house he owns with his family. He has made a living by growing corn and raising cattle for many years. He sells his products in various markets. Adrian is asking for a loan to be able to buy more cattle and to continue with his work, as it provides him with good earnings.

loans.use: to buy more cattle

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 28 años, tiene dos hijos una mujer y el otro varón ambos son pequeños y van a la escuela. Oscar comenta que por sus hijos esta luchando para poder darle una mejor calidad de vida.
Oscar emprendió su actividad hace mas de 8 años como vendedor ambulante, vende por la zona de Paraguarí, Yaguaron, Carapegua, mediante su esfuerzo sus hijos tienen una digna educación, su esposa le ayuda en los quehaceres de la casa.
Oscar es una señor muy  trabajador y sacrificado, tuvo que pasar por varios obstáculos para logar todo lo que actualmente posee. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de mas prendas y artículos de bazar siendo que empieza la temporada de venta alta y donde mas demandas tiene.
texts.en:
Oscar is 28 years old. He has two children, a daughter and a son who are both small and go to school. Oscar says that he is fighting to give a better quality of life to his children.

Oscar started to work over 8 years ago as an ambulant seller, and he sells in the areas of Paraguarí, Yaguaron and Carapegua. Because of his hard work, his children have a proper education and his wife helps him with the housework.

Oscar is a very hardworking and sacrificing man, he has had to go through many obstacles to reach everything that he has now. He needs this loan to purchase more clothing and bazaar articles because the high sales season is beginning, and he has more demand for his products.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and bazaar articles to sell.

loans.name: Jose Raul

texts.es: Jose de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, el posee un panadería ubicada en su lugar de residencia, el quiere comprar todos los insumos necesarios para la compra de los insumos necesarios como harina, latas, moldes, azúcar, leche, etc para continuar con su trabajo ya que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en: Jose is 44 years old and lives in a house he owns with his two children. He has a bakery located in his home. He wants to buy all of the supplies he needs like flour, cans, pans, sugar, milk, etc. to continue with his work, as it provides him with good earnings.

loans.use: to buy flour, cans, pans, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Jose Elias

texts.es: Jose de 53 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de yuca y maíz, comercializa en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder seguir con sus siembras ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo.
texts.en: Jose is 53 years old. He works cultivating cassava and corn. He sells it in the surroundings of the area where he lives. He lives in his own house, together with his wife and their four children. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, plague control, etc., and to improve the soil, shown on the photograph, so that he is able to keep on farming, because this is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, plague control, etc. and to improve the soil.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley, 54 years old, is married and has five children. For the past 4 years, she has earned a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from a general store. 

Shirley is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, 48 years old, is married and has three children, two of them in school. For the past 3 years, Sarah has been in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed.

Sarah has previously borrowed 2 times from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Sarah would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed

loans.name: Sweet Carel

texts.en: Sweet Carel, 24 years old, is married and has one child. She works very hard to provide for her family. For the past 3 years, Sweet Carel has run a direct sales business, selling Avon products in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of Avon products to sell. In the future, Sweet Carel would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of Avon products to sell

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Mildred works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Mildred is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets, bamboo, etc. for her fishing business.

Mildred has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets, bamboo, etc.

loans.name: Arcoiris Ii Group

texts.es:
Roxana es una mujer de 42 años de edad, casada, madre de dos hijos de 11 y 5 años, y su negocio es la venta de refrigerio en un colegio.
Ella es comprensiva, paciente, responsable, buena madre y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona de ‘El Torno’ una zona rural caracterizada por el comercio agrícola en todas sus áreas.
Roxana es de tez trigueña, estatura alta, cabello castaño largo, su lengua materna es el español y conoce el guaraní por herencia familiar (de pie a la derecha, usa polera ploma, pantalón beige y agarra una cartera a cuadros). Debido a su necesidad por ampliar su negocio formó una banca de personas para solicitar un préstamo y poder prosperar en su trabajo. Su negocio es la venta de refrigerios a estudiantes dentro del colegio en horario de descanso; ella se encarga de preparar sándwiches de queso con mortadela, también de huevo y otros como hamburguesas y sándwich de carne, durante el descanso de los estudiantes por la mañana y por la tarde. Este es el primer préstamo que solicita, tiene un año de experiencia y cree que aumentando su capital de trabajo tendrá más productos que ofertar y la demanda de sus sándwiches crecerá. Su nueva oferta tendrá; además del pan tradicional y el pan dulce, utilizará bagels, pasteles de arroz, galletas de grano entero, wraps, pan de pita, tortillas, focaccia o mini croissants, y lo acompañará con vegetales, carnes cocidas, huevos duros, pepinillos y diferentes condimentos.
Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al transporte libre, y sus dos hijos que estudian en la escuela. Ella sueña que sus hijos sean profesionales y desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Es por esos motivos que Roxana solicita un préstamo para aumentar su oferta en la venta de sándwiches como refrigerio.
texts.en:
Roxana is a 42-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of two children who are 11 and 5 years old. Her business is the sale of refreshments in a school. She is a good mother who is tolerant, patient, responsible, and hardworking. She does her work in the "El Torno" community, a rural area characterized by all kinds of agricultural commerce.

Roxana is olive-skinned and tall, with long brown hair (she is standing on the right, wearing a gray top and beige pants and holding a plaid purse) . Her native language is Spanish, and she knows Guaraní from her family. 

Because of the need to expand her business, she formed a communal bank in order to request a loan to be able to prosper in her work. Her business is the sale of refreshments to students within the school during their break time; she is in charge of preparing cheese and bologna sandwiches, egg sandwiches, and other foods like hamburgers and roast beef sandwiches during the students' morning and afternoon breaks. 

This is the first loan that Roxana has requested. She has one year of experience and she believes that by increasing her working capital, she will have more products to offer and the demand for her sandwiches will grow. Her new offerings will include alternatives to traditional bread and rolls, like bagels, rice casserole, whole-grain cookies, wraps, pita bread, tortillas, and focaccia or mini-croissants, accompanied by vegetables, cooked meats, hard-boiled eggs, pickles, and various condiments. 

She shares her life with her husband, who works in public transportation, and her two children, who are in school. She dreams of her children becoming professionals, and she would like to improve her family's quality of life. This is why Roxana is requesting a loan to increase her selection of sandwiches to sell as refreshments.

loans.use: to increase her selection of sandwiches to sell as refreshments

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Cecelia works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell dressed chicken. 

Cecelia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks to sell through her general store business, like soft drinks, biscuits, and soap.

Cecelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 32 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell, like soft drinks, biscuits, and soap.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 33 years old with six children, four of whom are in school. She works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig-fattening. Teresa is borrowing PHP 30,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to  buy fish nets and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

Teresa has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma, 40 years old, is married and has four children, two in school. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 3 years, Vilma has run a general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from pig fattening.

Vilma has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock such as canned goods, eggs, coffee, soap, etc. to sell. Vilma has previously borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as canned goods, eggs, coffee, soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ma. Norma

texts.en:
Ma. Norma is 54 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business direct-selling Avon products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of Avon products to sell.

Ma. Norma has been in this business for 20 years. 

In the future Ma. Norma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of Avon products to sell

loans.name: Muong Phang 9 Group

texts.en:
Thien, 32, works in agricultural production. She cultivates rice and raises pigs and chickens with her husband to provide for their family of 6 people, including her parents-in-law and her two children.

Because their old, small, Thai traditional house is very crowded, Thien and her husband have to make a great effort to satisfy the demands of everybody in the family. To better cover their living expenses, Thien has taken out loans from Anh Chi Em Program. This is the second loan she has had, and she will use it to buy small fish and expand her fish farming enterprise.

She said she was also very interested in technical support such as training and consulting with Anh Chi Em's staff, which helped her a lot with her previous investment in fish farming.

Thien dreams of her children having a brighter future than she had. She wants them to finish school and then get good jobs. In the picture, Thien is wearing a checkered shirt and is standing at the far right.

loans.use: to buy small fish and expand her fish farming enterprise

loans.name: Adi

texts.en:
Meet Adi. He is single and lives with his family in Cianjur, a city located at the foot of Mount Gede-Pangrango, West Java. Adi runs a small stall, selling drinking water refills, phone SIM cards, and mobile phone airtime to his customers. 

Adi joined Ruma about a month ago because he wanted to increase his family’s income. He feels really excited to expand his new business by selling mobile phone airtime credits. He hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide access to mobile services for his community by processing airtime transactions on the weekends. In the photo, Adi is in his small stall.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in his community

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida, 53 years old, is married and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past year, Aida has run a direct sales business, selling Avon products in the Philippines. She also earns an income from food vending.

Aida has requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock such as soap, lotion, etc. to sell. Aida has previously borrowed and repaid 25 loans from NWTF. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock such as soap, lotion, etc. to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia, 48 years old, is married and has six children, one in school. She works very hard to provide for her family. For the past 20 years, Cecilia has run a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock such as rice, shampoo, spices, etc. to sell. In the future, Cecilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock such as rice, shampoo, spices, etc. to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a widow and she works hard to support her family. For the past 16 years, Janet has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. In the future, Janet would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Princess

texts.en:
Princess works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Princess has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Princess would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 44 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like soap, milk, coffee, etc.

Gina has been in this business for three years.

In the future Gina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like soap, milk, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn works hard to support her family. She is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years now.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more ingredients for her business.

In the future, Jovelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her business

loans.name: Dioneta

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of seven children, Dioneta works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Dioneta is borrowing PHP 25,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more fish to sell through her fish-vending business.

Dioneta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 30 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Glady

texts.en:
Glady, 55 years old, is married and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 24 years, Glady has run a retail business selling gasoline in the Philippines. She also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear and raising chickens.

Glady has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell. Glady has previously borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF. She aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 6 years, she has operated a fishing business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from a general store and raising pigs

Lourdes is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets for her business. Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Cecilia works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from charcoal retailing. Cecilia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her rice retailing business.

Cecilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Milawati

texts.en:
Milawati is married and lives with her husband and their two children in North Bogor, a suburban area that is located about two hours’ drive from Jakarta, the capital city. To make a living and support her family, Milawati sells mobile phone airtime to her customers.

Milawati joined Ruma about a month ago because she wanted to increase her family’s income. She feels really excited about expanding her business in selling more mobile phone airtime credits.

As the business runs, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide greater access to mobile services to her community by processing airtime transactions on the weekends. Milawati thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile phone services in her community

loans.name: Lufilufi

texts.en: Lufilufi is a 53-year-old woman who is married with five children. She has a well organized lawn mowing business to serve the people of her community. She has had three years in this business. Lufilufi needs a loan to buy five new lawn mowers, petrol, boots, overalls, safety glasses and gardening gloves. She will use her profits to help with her family's weekly expenses. Lufilufi joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy five new lawn mowers, petrol, boots, overalls, safety glasses and gardening gloves.

loans.name: Niuvai

texts.en: Niuvai, 41 years old, is unmarried and has 5 children. For 5 successful years, she has made and sold elei printed material to earn a living. Niuvai has requested a loan to buy a small car to ease the burden of traveling, rolls of material, fabric paint, rubber designs and stencils. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Niuvai joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a small car to ease the burden of traveling, rolls of material, fabric paint, rubber designs and stencils

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is thankful that she was granted a PHP 10,000 loan which she used to purchase school supplies such as pens, bond paper and cartolina for her school and office supplies store. Through her earnings, Teresa is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

Because of her entrepreneurial skill, Teresa now has an Internet shop. She is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000, which she will use to buy another PC unit to serve her growing clients. In provinces like Dasmarinas, not a lot of people own home computers. People go to an Internet shop for their business and school requirements. Teresa rents out computers by the hour and offers printing and typing services. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 a day from her Internet shop.  She is positive that she will have good returns on her investment. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her.

Teresa aims to have more branches for her Internet shop. She dreams for all her children to finish college. She prays that her family will always lead a victorious life. Teresa also desires to help her less fortunate relatives. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.


 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for a personal computer unit to rent out.

loans.name: Juvylyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Juvylyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Juvylyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Juvylyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of repairing and renovating her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years now.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Liza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Lagi

texts.en: Lagi is a 47 year-old woman who is married and has six children. She runs a taxi business with her husband to serve the traveling public. To earn extra income, she also has a newly established fishing business. Lagi needs a loan to pay for her children's education and also to renew her business license, a new fishing canoe, fishing nets and flippers. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and help with the renovation of her house. Lagi joined SPBD in 2008 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to pay for her children's education and also to renew her business license, a new fishing canoe, fishing nets and flippers

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is thankful that she was granted a PHP 14,000 loan, which she used to buy sacks of rice needed for her wholesale/retail rice business. From her store earnings, she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

She would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of PHP 15,000, which she will use to buy more sacks of rice to sell, either at a wholesale or retail price. Rice is a main staple in the Philippines. It constitutes a dominant portion of the standard diet of Filipinos. Her earnings from selling rice help cover her family’s daily needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given to her. 

Lina dreams to have another outlet for her rice store. She wants to send her children to the best schools until college. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of rice for her business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. From her sole earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 15,000 PHP loan which she will use as part of her working capital to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Cecilia dreams of having a bigger general store and aims to give her children the best education possible for them to have a brighter future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans. and get inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Hojan

texts.en:
Meet Hojan. Hojan is married and lives with her husband and their two children in Cianjur, a city located at the foot of Mount Gede-Pangrango, West Java. To make a living and support her family, Hojan runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, daily consumption products, and mobile phone airtime to her customers.

Hojan joined Ruma about a month ago because she wanted to increase her family’s income. She feels really excited about expanding her new business by selling mobile phone airtime credits.

As the business runs, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide greater access to mobile services for her community by processing airtime transactions on the weekends. In the photo, Hojan is in her small stall. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile phone services in her community

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Marilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a sound system rental business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.  Marilyn is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials and a unit of sound for her sound system rental business.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and unit of sound for her business

loans.name: Rodeliz

texts.en:
Rodeliz is 43 years old and single.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, shampoo, noodles, etc.

Rodeliz has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Rodeliz aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, shampoo, noodles, etc

loans.name: Mylen

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mylen works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice and raising pigs. Mylen is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to  buy additional fish to sell for her business.

Mylen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Wilma works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Wilma is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to  buy fishing nets and maintenance for the fishing boat for her fishing business.

Wilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and maintenance for the fishing boat

loans.name: Dagoberto

texts.es: Dagoberto de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a realizar viajes en su pick up por los diferentes pueblos aledaños, tiene muchos clientes por la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar, el esta solicitando un crédito para poder darle mantenimiento a su vehiculo y comprar llantas nuevas ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poder tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Dagoberto, aged 49, lives in his own home with his wife.

He makes a living providing transportation services by pick-up truck between the various nearby towns. He has many customers because of his responsible driving.

Since this is his only source of work, he is requesting a loan to do maintenance on his vehicle and buy new tires. This way, he will be able to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy new tires and do maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Elva Victorina

texts.es:
Elva de 72 años de edad. Es soltera y tuvo 3 hijos ninguno vive con ella en este momento.

Elva administra una tienda desde hace 5 años, que le permite obtener ingresos para sus gastos, también trabaja en la agricultura desde muy pequeña pero esto solo realiza para el consumo.  Ella decidió colocar la tienda para obtener sus propios ingresos, las ventas la realiza de 6:00 am hasta 6:00 pm 


EL préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar fertilizantes como fórmula,  sulfato y cancelarles a las personas que le ayuden a aplicarlo al sembradío y el resto del dinero para la compra de más productos para la tienda.

Su objetivo principal es obtener una buena producción de maíz para garantizar su seguridad alimentaria, también tiene como prioridad mejorar su tienda y teniendo más productos a la venta aumentar su clientes.
texts.en:
Elva is 72 years old and single. She had three children, but none are living with her at this time.

Elva has been running a store for 5 years, which allows her to earn money for her expenses. She also works in agriculture, something that she has been doing ever since she was very young, but she only does this for her own consumption.  She decided to set up the store in order to earn her own income, and she sells from 6:00 A.M. until 6:00 P.M.

The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of fertilizers such as formula and sulfate, and for paying people to help her apply them to her crop. The rest of the money is for the purchase of more products for the store. 

Her principal objective is to obtain a good production of corn in order to guarantee the security of her food. Her other priority is to improve her store and have more products to sell in order to increase her customers.

loans.use: to purchase formula and sulfate, and to pay people to help her apply them to her crop. With the rest of the money, she will purchase more products for her store.

loans.name: Karamoko Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Karamoko est majoritairement composé de  femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Torokorobougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, fruits (bananes) de bonnes de qualités, tubercules, colas, charbon du bois et produits alimentaires. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Oumou (femme assise à  l’extrême gauche  sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des fruits (bananes) de bonnes de qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 corbeilles de bananes  en gros au quartier du Fleuve à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Torokorobougou  à une clientèle mixte. Madame Oumou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 250 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Karamoko group is composed mainly of monogamous women who average 45 years of age and six children. They all live in Torokorobougou, a district of Bamako, and they know one another as neighbors. They sell top quality fruits (bananas), tubers, colas, charcoal, and food products.   

To bolster their working capital, the group members joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is their 4th group loan cycle.

Mrs. Oumou (sitting at the far left in the group photo) is a leading reseller of high quality fruits (bananas). She will use her loan to buy 5 baskets of bananas wholesale in Bamako’s Fleuve district. She retails her stock in Torokorobougou to a mixed clientele. 

With this loan, Mrs. Oumou expects to earn an average monthly profit of 250,000 FCFA, which she will use to reinvest in her activity. 

With the help of Soro Yiriwaso, her goal is to purchase some land to live on.

loans.use: to buy fruits for resale.

loans.name: Siavii

texts.en:
Siavii is a 54 year old woman who is married with 6 children. She runs a small tailoring business in her community. She has 10 years of experience with this business. 

Siavii has requested a loan to buy new sewing machines, threads, needles, a measuring tape and material. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

She joined SPBD in 2004 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new sewing machines, threads, needles, a measuring tape and material.

loans.name: Ulaula

texts.en:
Ulaula is 32 years old and unmarried with 3 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 11 years. 

Ulaula needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, sprayers, a new tiller, a crowbar, a wheelbarrow and a machete. She has been a member of SPBD since 2003. 

Ulaula will use the profits from her sales to pay for her families weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, sprayers, a new tiller, a crowbar, a wheelbarrow and a machete.

loans.name: Teleise

texts.en:
Teleise is a 49 year old woman with 4 children. She runs a small pancake business. She sells them at the market and in her community to earn a living. 

Teleise requested a loan to buy a bag of flour, bag of sugar, bottle of vegetable oil, a frying pan, wooden spoon, and plastic bags to improve her business. She will use her profits to provide for her family's everyday needs.

Teleise joined SPBD in 2010 to gain finance to start a business.

loans.use: buy a bag of flour, bag of sugar, bottle of vegetable oil, frying pan, wooden spoon, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Taape

texts.en:
Taape is 45 years old and married, with one child. She owns and operates a shop in her village, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for six years. 

Taape needs a loan to buy a new display refrigerator, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, bags of rice, sugar, and salt. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

She became a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2008 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new display refrigerator, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, bags of rice, sugar, and salt.

loans.name: Sau

texts.en:
Sau is a 30 year old woman who runs a small plantation business, and she sells in her community to earn a living. 

Sau requested a loan to buy a wheel-barrow, taro roots, banana roots, rakes, safety boots, a knife, and a water tank to assist her with the business. She hopes to use her profits to provide for her family's everyday needs. 

Sau joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a wheel-barrow, taro roots, banana roots, rakes, safety boots, a knife, and a water tank.

loans.name: Faimeasoo

texts.en:
Faimeasoo is a 25 year old unmarried woman with 3 children. She runs a small plantation business and sells her produce in her community and at the market. 

She requested a loan to buy a rake, taro roots, banana roots, a knife, wheel-barrow, and safety boots to help her with the business. She hopes to use her profits to provide for her family and to expand her business. 

Faimeasoo joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital.

loans.use: to buy a rake, taro roots, banana roots, a knife, wheel-barrow, and safety boots

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more women's and men's clothing wholesale.

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
José de 56 años de edad,  tiene un nivel de estudio de 6° grado. Está casado y su esposa le ayuda en el trabajo de la panadería y a los oficios domésticos. Tiene tres hijos, las 2 hembras están casadas y el varón depende de él. 

José antes era militar (soldado). Ahora se dedica a la venta de pan. Le trabajaba a un señor pero ahora es dueño de su propia panadería. El carro que tiene para repartir el pan necesita llantas nuevas.  Por ese motivo, el préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar las llantas para el carro. Él planea hacer la panadería más grande para dejarle a su familia un trabajo y negocio propio.
texts.en:
José is 56 years old and has a sixth grade education. He is married and his wife helps with the work at their bakery. She also handles the household duties. They have three children. Two daughters are married and his son is still dependent on him.

José was previously in the military as a soldier, but now he sells bread. He worked with another gentleman and his dream was to own a bakery. José has a car that he uses for delivering bread, but it is in need of new tires. For this reason, he is requesting a loan for buying tires for his car. He plans to make his bakery larger so that he can leave a business for his family, as well as a source of work.

loans.use: to buy tires for the car that he uses for delivering bread.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, noodles, spices, etc. for her food production business.

Elvira has been in this business for 3 years. Elvira earns additional income from buying and selling mangoes.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, noodles, spices, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Lofelia

texts.en:
Lofelia is 40 years old and married with two children.

Lofelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, soft-drinks, biscuits, candies, noodles, cereals, juice, etc. to sell.

Lofelia has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear.

Lofelia aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, soft-drinks, biscuits, candies, noodles, cereals, juice, etc. to sell

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is 29 years old and married with 4 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 6 years. 

Tina needs a loan to buy a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, a sack of onions and bags of sugar. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2008 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, a sack of onions and bags of sugar.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is a widowed woman with six children. Josefa is 64 years old and has one child who is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Josefa has a business direct selling Avon products in the Philippines. Josefa requested a PHP 23,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more products from Avon like lotion, deodorant, body spray, etc. to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Josefa has been in this business for 4 years. Josefa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products from Avon like lotion, deodorant, body spray, etc. to sell

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en:
Mareta is 29 years old and unmarried with 4 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 4 years. 

Mareta needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, salt, new shoes, snacks, frozen goods, canned items and drinks. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, salt, new shoes, snacks, frozen goods, canned items and drinks

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is a 47 year old married woman with 7 children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has 9 years of experience with this business. 

Penina needs a loan to buy a sandwich maker, drinks, snacks, bread, butter, a toaster, noodles and a boiler. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Penina has been a member of SPBD since 2005.

loans.use: to buy a sandwich maker, drinks, snacks, bread, butter, a toaster, noodles and a boiler.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
Benito de 73 años de edad, estudio hasta 2 grado,  procreo 12 hijos de los cuales algunos de ellos viven fuera del país. Actualmente solo un joven de 17 años vive con él y su compañera de vida.

Benito se dedica principalmente a los trabajos de la agricultura trabajo que aprendió de sus padres, además tiene como otras fuentes de ingresos como las sandias en la temporada inicial del invierno, también posee once colmenas las cuales le permite obtener una buena producción de miel. Actualmente  Benito tiene sembrando 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz trabajando en los siguientes horarios de 6:00 am a 12:00 pm.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar fertilizantes como fórmula y sulfato y para cancelar a las personas que le ayuden a trabajar.


Sus Planes a futuro son siempre dedicarse a los trabajos  de la agricultura y obtener buenas cosechas para hacer frente a los compromisos adquiridos
texts.en:
Benito, 73, studied up to second grade.  He has 12 children, some of whom live abroad.  Currently only his 17-year-old son lives with him and his life partner.

Benito works mainly in agriculture, a job he learned from his parents.  He also has other sources of income, such as watermelon at the beginning of the winter.  He also has 11 beehives that allow him to get a good crop of honey.  Currently Benito has 7,000 square meters of corn planted.  He works from 6 a.m. until 12 noon.

The loan he's requesting is to buy fertilizer such as formula and sulfate, and to pay the people who help him work.

Benito's plans for the future are to always work in agriculture and to get good harvests to satisfy his commitments.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay the people who help him

loans.name: Tavai

texts.en:
Tavai is a 23-year-old mother with two children. She runs a plantation business from which she sells produce in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Tavai requested for a loan to buy taro roots, banana roots, a wheelbarrow, a rake, sprayers, and a knife to assist her with the business. Tavai hopes to use her business profits to expand her business and provide for her family's everyday needs. She joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy taro roots, banana roots, a wheelbarrow, a rake, sprayers, and a knife

loans.name: Emi

texts.en: Emi is 35 years old and married,  She has four children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for six years. Emi needs a loan to buy snacks, drinks, canned items, frozen goods, diapers, shoes, deodorants and a new display fridge. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD in 2008 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, drinks, canned items, frozen goods, diapers, shoes, deodorants and a new display fridge

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina is 43 years old.  She is married and has nine children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for eight years. Sina needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade. She has been a member of SPBD since 2006. Sina will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade

loans.name: Taopaua

texts.en: Taopaua is a 72 year old widow with eight children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has six years of experience with this business. Taopaua needs a loan to buy pies, drinks, coffee maker, boiler, new chairs, sausages and tomato sauce. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Taopaua has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: to buy pies, drinks, coffee maker, boiler, new chairs, sausages and tomato sauce

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Luchadoras está en su ciclo número 14 ° Del programa de comité de mujeres, este grupo lleva ese nombre, ya que eso es lo que son, mujeres luchadoras, jefas de familia. También forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Adelaida, mujer trabajadora, luchadora, y muy entusiasta, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel  dos, es decir esta en un novel medio.  Ella tiene una despensa que con mucho sacrificio pudo montar y hoy en día ya tiene muy buena clientela y su negocio es el sostén de la familia.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de insumos varios para poder surtir su despensa, como ser bebidas, verduras, carne, enlatados, frutas y demás, ya que quiere ofrecer una buena variedad a sus clientes, ya que así podrá atraer a nuevos y seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres Luchadoras is in its fourteenth loan cycle in the women's bank program.  The group has that name because that's what they are, determined women, heads of families.  They're also part of the poverty-elimination program.

One of the members is Adelaida.  She's a hardworking, determined, and very enthusiastic woman who showed a poverty level of two on her last survey; in other words, she's in the middle level.  She has a store she was able to set up with a lot of sacrifice.  Currently she has good customers and her business supports her family.

Adelaida's requesting this loan to buy beverages, vegetables, meat, canned goods, fruits, and other supplies to be able to stock her store.  She wants to offer her customers a good variety so she'll attract new customers and keep up with her sales, just as she has been doing.

She's grateful for this opportunity because it will be a big help to her.

loans.use: to buy beverages, vegetables, meat, canned goods, fruit, and other products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and seedlings for the family land.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: Juan de 56 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace 20 años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder seguir con sus siembras ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo.
texts.en:
Juan is 56 years old, and he has been growing corn for the last 20 years. He sells his products around his place of residency. He lives in his own house, with his wife and two kids. 

He is requesting the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, plague controllers, etc. and to improve the field shown in the picture. 

He wants to be able to keep sowing because that's his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, plague controllers, etc. and to improve the field.

loans.name: David Daniel

texts.es:
David es un joven que desde que terminó el colegio trabaja como obrero de construcción en Ica, su ciudad natal. Se vio en la necesidad de conseguir un trabajo debido a la situación económica que se atraviesa en su casa, sin embargo está ahorrando al máximo para poder estudiar más adelante una profesión porque quiere superarse y sacar adelante a su familia.
Debido a los grandes sueños de mejorar la calidad e vida de su familia, David piensa utilizar el crédito para comprar electrodomésticos para su casa como una refrigeradora para que sus comidas permanezcan en buen estado por más tiempo. Él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad porque su familia gozará de mejor salud con un alimento mejor conservado.
texts.en:
David is a young man who has been a construction worker in his hometown of Ica since finishing high school. He needed to secure a job due to his financial situation at home. However, he wanted to save as much as possible so that in the future he could study for a profession that would enable him to succeed and help his family get ahead.

Among his greatest dreams is to improve his family’s quality of life. David plans to use this loan to buy household appliances for his home, such as a refrigerator that can be used to preserve food for longer periods of time. He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity since his family will be in better health because of food that is better preserved.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for preserving food.

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Carina is 30 years old, and two of her children are currently in school.

Carina has a food vending business in the Philippines. Carina requested a PHP 22,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Carina has been in this business for one year. In the future, Carina would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Llian

texts.en:
Lost Male Film, Inc. was first established on 08/01/2013 as an independent film production company that specializes in camera rentals and cinematography. Mr. Llian is the President of the film production company which he established after being in the industry for the past 6 years. He has been working as a photographer for over 10 years. He is currently working as a Cinematographer and decided to start his own business because he enjoys being creative and creating something out of nothing.  

The company’s mission is to provide the latest in camera technology to mid-level Los Angeles filmmakers at a relatively low cost, compared to current rental cameras. His use of proceeds will be to purchase film equipment such as the Black Magic Camera.

loans.use: Purchase of equipment

loans.name: Moavinimoa

texts.en:
Moavinimoa is a 38-year-old married woman with six children. She runs a small business making and selling pancakes at the market and in her community to earn a living. She requested for a loan to buy bags of flour, bags of sugar, bottled vegetable oil, yeast, a wooden spoon, a frying pan and plastic bags to help her improve her business. 

Moavinimoa hopes to use her business profits to expand her business and to provide for her family's everyday needs. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, bags of sugar, bottled vegetable oil, yeast, a wooden spoon, a frying pan and plastic bags to help her improve her business

loans.name: Faafetai

texts.en:
Faafetai is a 50-year-old woman who is married with three children. She runs a successful elei printing business, and also earns extra income by conducting a weekly bingo game. Faafetai has nine years of experience with these businesses. 

Faafetai needs a loan to buy rolls of material, rubber designs, carved wooden designs, stencils, fabric paint and bingo bottles. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and also to help with the expansion of her businesses. Faafetai joined SPBD in 2005 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy rolls of material, rubber designs, carved wooden designs, stencils, fabric paint and bingo bottles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rebuild his damaged home from the last war on Gaza.

loans.name: Khaleel

texts.en:
Khaleel is a 21 year-old single man from a village near Nablus city.  He lives with his family in a small house. Four years ago, Khaleel opened his own business which is a barber shop.  It is a good business and Khaleel now has very good experience in this field.

Khaleel took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new tools and hair products that he often uses in his barber shop.  By taking this loan, Khaleel will be able to improve his business and increase its productivity. 
Khaleel appears in the photo in his barber shop

loans.use: to buy new tools and hair products that he often uses in his barber shop.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 34-year-old married woman from Qabatiya, a village near Jenin city. She is a mother of three sons and two daughters. Hala and her husband work as farmers on their land. They plant seasonal crops and sell them in the local market. It is a good business but the income is not stable.

Hala took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank for the family home. By taking this loan, she will be able to provide hot water without using electricity.

Hala appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank for the family home.

loans.name: Deisy  Elizabeth

texts.es: Deisy de 35 años de edad vive con su hija en casa propia, ella tiene un negocio de salón de belleza desde hace 8 años en su lugar de residencia trabaja de lunes a domingo y tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar. Deisy solicita un crédito para poder comprar productos para su salón de belleza como: cremas, shampoo, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Deisy is 35 years old. She lives with her daughter in a house that she owns. For eight years, she has had a beauty salon business in her residence. She works from Monday to Sunday and has a large clientele because she does very good work. With the earnings she obtains, she manages to cover the costs that come up in her household.

Deisy is requesting a loan so that she can buy products for her beauty salon like creams, shampoo, hair clips, scissors, and more things that she needs. Then she will be able to obtain better earnings, which will help her to have better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy creams, shampoo, hair clips, scissors, and more

loans.name: Mirian Elizabet

texts.es: Miriam de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de ropa, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal y tiene mucha clientela, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para poder obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Mirian is 46 years old and lives with her husband and her daughter in a house that they own. She has earned her living for several years selling clothing. Her business is located in the municipal market, and she has many customers. 

Mirian is requesting a loan for the purchase of more clothing at wholesale so that she can earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy more clothing at wholesale

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is forty-two years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Raquel's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has started to rebuild her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Raquel is committed to rebuild her devastated life, and in the future she would like to save enough money so she could provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a married woman with one child who goes to school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Zenaida is thirty-nine years old.

Zenaida's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her fish vending and is committed to regain what she lost. She is taking out a PHP 6,000 Housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

She has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Zenaida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Emelia is 49 years old, and three of her children are still in school.

Emelia has a retail ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. Emelia requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothing like blouses, pants, and shorts to sell.

Emelia has been in this business for six years. In the future, Emelia would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothing like blouses, pants, and shorts to sell

loans.name: Shabano

texts.en:
Shabano is a 31-year-old woman, living with her two children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Shabano’s husband has been driving an auto rickshaw for many years. It has been depreciating with the passage of time. He sold his old rickshaw and wants to buy a new rickshaw. He belongs to an ultra poor family but has been feeding his children. Now his children are growing older, and their needs are changing as well. 

Shabano has been making savings for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband , but at the time of purchasing, some money has become short. Therefore, Shabano has requested a loan for her husband  so that he can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of her savings. 

Shabano hopes that now her husband will be able to generate more income. She is very happy after taking this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Manowara

texts.en:
Manowara is a 28-year-old married lady with two sons. Her sons are too small to go to school. She is originally from a remote village of Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is known for being hard-working and responsible, with a great desire for personal achievement. 

Manowara's husband handles his own business of selling mustard oil. Manowara also assists her husband in this business. It is an essential oil resulting from grinding the mustard seeds and is widely used in cooking in India. He makes his purchases in cash from the wholesale markets and distributors in his area in bulk quantity, then after re-packing, sells to the local retail shops. His sales are in cash. He has regular and occasional customers. He began his business many years ago with his own funds and with the goal of helping with the expenses of his household. Today, it is the only source of income for his household.

One of his dreams is to be able to make an increase in the inventory in his business. The current income from the business is insufficient to cover all the expenses. So Manowara is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BJS. The purpose of this financing is to invest in working capital by buying more quantity of oil for her husband's business. She hopes the loan will help the business to be a profitable one, will earn more income for the well-being of the family, and will strengthen their economic condition.


She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more mustard oil for retailing.

loans.name: Gulshan Abid Ali's Group

texts.en:
Gulshan is a 41-year-old married woman, living with her daughter in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband prepares bakery items such as sweets, bread, biscuit, and cakes at home, selling them to the bakeries. Earlier his father had been running this business, but now her husband looks after all the affairs. Due to inflation, the prices of raw material such as wheat flour, sugar, eggs etc. have increased. 

Therefore, Gulshan has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy his desired inventories for making bakery items. Gulshan thanks Kiva because they showed him how to turn his business from backwardness.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as wheat flour, sugar, and eggs for making sweets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Valery Lhor

texts.en:
Valery Lhor works hard to support her family. She has two children, both of whom are in school. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business this year (2014) and requested a PHP 7,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family. With your help, Valery Lhor will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Valery Lhor would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to school..

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Oysuluv

texts.ru:
