Ойсулув добрая отзывчивая женщина, проживающая в районе Спитамен. В возрасте 37 лет она имеет мужа и троих детей. Ее детям по 19, 16 и 15 лет. Они учатся. Сама Ойсулув работает в фермерском хозяйстве и дополнительно занимается животноводством. Ойсулув начала выращивать крупнорогатых скотин у себя во дворе 8 лет назад и по сей день продолжает этот стабильный бизнес. В данный момент Ойсулув обратилась за кредитом для увеличения поголовья скотов. За счет прибыли с деятельности она хочет улучшить жилищные условия и провести ремонт в доме.
Поддержите Ойсулув в осуществлении ее целей!
texts.en: Oysuluv is a kind, compassionate woman who lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan.  She is 37, married, and has three children ages 19, 16, and 15 who are still in school.  Oysuluv works on a farm and raises livestock on the side.  She started raising cattle in her yard at home 8 years ago, and has kept it up to this day as it's a stable source of income.  She's seeking a loan to buy more cattle, and wants to use any extra income she earns from her business to renovate her home and improve her living conditions.  Help Oysuluv bring her plans to fruition!

loans.use: buy cattle to increase her head count

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma works hard to support her family. Delma is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Delma requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Delma has been in this business for 40 years now.

Delma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is forty-nine years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Her house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her buy & sell frozen foods business this year. She is committed to regain what she lost. 

She is taking out a PHP 10,000 Housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Delia has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could provide a secure future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es:
Luis un hombre trabajador y muy alegre que sabe sacarle esos gustos a la vida, a sus 49 años de edad se dedica a la jardinería, siendo uno de los pocos contratistas independientes del sector, tiene dos hijos de 12 y 19 años de edad una mujer y hombre respetivamente y todos los días se levanta a realizar su trabajo para pagarle la educación y alimentación a estas dos criaturas que son el motor de su vida. 
Luis presenta una dificultad y es que necesita una guadañadora para seguir ejerciendo su profesión la cual representa el 100% de ingreso en su familia y es por esto que solicita un crédito para la compra de este indispensable implemento de trabajo con el que sueña poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is a hardworking and cheerful man who knows how to make the most out of life. At 49 years of age, he works as a gardener. He is one of the few independent contractors who is in this line of work. Luis has two children who are ages 12 and 19, a daughter and a son respectively. He wakes up every day so that he can do his work, which allows him to pay the educational and food expenses for his two children who are his motivation in life.

Luis is having difficulty and in need of a weed eater so that he can continue to perform his job, which represents 100% of his family’s income. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can buy this indispensable piece of work equipment. Luis dreams of improving his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a weed eater for his work as a gardener.

loans.name: Lujain

texts.en:
Lujain is a 20-year-old university student majoring in Engineering, and she is in her second year. She is working to get her Bachelor's degree so that she can look for a job in her study field where she can gain good income to start helping her family financially. 

However, because she doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Ten years ago, Betty started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Simoti, a remote village in the Litein area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of four children sells milk, eggs, tea and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer, and because of the immense knowledge she has of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow. That makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through selling milk, she lacks a proper dairy unit, so she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan she will have a humble time milking her cow and also feeding it. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax, and it can also prevent them from contracting diseases that may arise because of exposure to harsh weather conditions such as rain. 

Betty believes that through this loan her living conditions will change, because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save the money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Betty waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To build a dairy unit

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert, at 23 years old, is a charismatic, active and attentive man. Being a father has been his main motive for fighting tirelessly day to day, seeking alternatives to earn a living and support his children. Approximately 5 years ago, he started doing mixed farming and through those years he has gathered so much experience with the techniques of farming. Through the income from farming he has been able to take care of his family and also provide the basic needs for his children. Robert is a very enterprising man, and although he never got formal employment, he has always worked hard on his farm and he has always assured his family of a decent meal. The Litein area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why he is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, he is sure that he will reap maximum profits and be able to increase his business. Being a man from a marginalized community and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Robert feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising men like him. Robert is much disciplined with finances and he plans that through the accumulated profits he will be able to improve his living conditions and also secure the future of his children.
Robert says that his age doesn't stop him from doing what he is passionate about. That is why he always sets new goals for himself and among them is becoming a great horticulture farmer and to generate employment opportunities. This way he will be able to improve his quality of life and the well-being of his family and those people who help him do his daily work. By supporting this loan, you will be giving a boost to the entrepreneurial ideas of a Kenyan father!

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 22-year-old ambitious young man who lives with his family of five in Irbid-Jordan. He is a university student majoring in Mechanical Engineering, and he is in his last year. Mohammad is planning to find a job with a good income that will help him support his family because of the financial crisis they have been facing, and he is only one step away from that. However, because he doesn't currently have enough money to pay his upcoming semester fees, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Mua

texts.en:
Mua is a 62 year old woman who is married with 5 children. She runs a small tailoring business in her community. She has 13 years of experience with this business. 

Mua has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and material. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

She joined SPBD in 2001 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and material

loans.name: Masela

texts.en:
Masela is 33 years old and divorced with 6 children. She runs a small business making and selling woven and carved handicrafts in her community. She has 3 years of experience with this business. 

Masela has requested a loan to buy large blocks of wood, carving tools, measuring tape, cans of varnish and brushes. In the future, Masela hopes to pay for her families weekly expenses. 

She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy large blocks of wood, carving tools, measuring tape, cans of varnish and brushes

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is a 28 year old married woman with 1 child. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. 

Marieta needs a loan to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiler and soft drinks. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Marieta has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiler and soft drinks.

loans.name: Tunufai

texts.en:
Tunufai is a 43 year old woman who is married with 4 children. She has a small taxi business to earn an income. She has 5 years with this business. 

Tunufai needs a loan to buy a new gear box, seat covers, wheel-caps, a new taxi sign indicator and floor mats. She will use her profits to pay for her families weekly expenses.

Tunufai joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new gear box, seat covers, wheel-caps, a new taxi sign indicator and floor mats

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel works hard to support her family. Maribel is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Maribel requested a PHP 22,500 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Maribel has been in this business for 1 year now.

Maribel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Kpangmanga - Nyolugu Group

texts.en:
Ayi is a 40-year-old hardworking woman from Nyolugu in the Northern region of Ghana. Ayi is married and has six children, with five of the children attending school. Ayi is the individual pictured in the middle who has her child among members squatting.

Ayi is a member of a Shea butter and rice processing group that has been in business for the last 20 years. The name of the group is "Kpangmanga - Nyolugu." Ayi earns a good profit from the business, as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to improve their Shea butter and rice processing business such that they can always produce premium quality for the local and non-local markets.

Ayi and "Kpangmanga - Nyolugu" have asked for a loan of GHS 9,200.00. Ayi’s share of the loan will help her to buy four bags of Shea nuts for processing. Ayi aspires to earn more income as well as to repay this loan and support her children with food and educational materials.

Ayi thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy four bags of Shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: Sairabubu

texts.ru: Сайрабубу 64 года, замужем, есть дети, младший сын живет с Сайрабубу. На протяжении многих лет она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в далеком 1993 году. Благодаря упорному труду, Сайрабубу на сегодняшний день имеет прибыль 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи произведенных исключительно ручным трудом сельскохозяйственных продуктов и экологически чистого молока. На своем участке мерою 2,00 ГА она выращивает горох, клевер, картофель, яблони. Также в хозяйстве Сайрабубу есть 6 коров, 3 бычка и 3 лошади. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы и бычка. Доходы от кредита Сайрабубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Sairabubu is 64, married, and has children.  Her youngest son lives with her.  She has grown crops and raised livestock for many years, first starting all the way back in 1993.  Thanks to her persistent efforts, she currently earns 15,000 som a month from selling organic milk and other agricultural goods, all of them produced and prepared by hand.  In addition, she has six cows, three bull calves, and three horses on her farm, as well as 2.00 hectares of land for growing peas, clover, potatoes, and apples.  To further develop her farm, she's seeking a loan of 80,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy a cow and a bull calf, and plans on using any profits due to the loan to further grow her business.

loans.use: buy a dairy cow to bolster her milk sales and a bull calf for fattening and resale

loans.name: Dzingo

texts.en:
Dzingo is married with six children. she buys, packages, and sells hardwood charcoal. At first she used to buy the charcoal already packaged, but she was able to expand her storage area and she can now store up to 60,000 kg of charcoal. she buys bags and polyurethane, packages the charcoal, and sells it to small businesses in the zone. 

She needs this loan to buy charcoal to sell because she is increasing her number of customers and needs to increase her amount of charcoal to meet their demands. 

Her greatest desire is to provide an education for her children who attend school, so that she can guarantee them a prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya est majoritairement composé de  femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Samè l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (échalotes, tomates et piments), atiéke, tailleur et macaroni. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Kiatou  (femme arrêtée à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des condiments (échalotes, tomates et piments). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 sacs d’échalotes, 2 corbeilles de tomates et 1 sac de piment en gros à Médine. La revente se fait en détails à Samè à une clientèle de femmes. Madame Kiatou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
This group called Danaya is mostly composed of monogamous women. They are on average 40 years old with four children. They all live in Samè, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako and know each other because of being neighbors. The members of the group do small-scale selling of condiments (shallots, tomatoes, and hot peppers), sell 'atiéke', work as tailors, or sell pasta. Wishing to grow their working capital, the members of the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third cycle of solidarity loans. 

Madame Kiatou  (the woman on the far left in the photo) has a good reputation for selling condiments (shallots, tomatoes, and hot peppers). She intends to use her loan to buy two sacks of shallots, two baskets of tomatoes, and one sack of hot peppers, wholesale, in Médine. She will sell her goods retail, in Samè,  to a clientele composed of women. 

With this loan, Madame Kiatou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 90,000 FCFA which will be used to reinvest in her business. Her goal in working with Soro Yiriwaso is to buy a plot of land to build a house on.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Rezlen

texts.en:
Rezlen is 29 years old and married, with two children.

Rezlen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell, like snack foods, soft drinks, beer, biscuits, candies, and coffee.

Rezlen has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and raising pigs.

Rezlen aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like snack foods, soft drinks, beer, biscuits, candies, and coffee.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a boda-boda (motorcycle) transport business, where her potential customers are town dwellers and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. Especially during the rainy season, it becomes hard to operate a motorcycle. Her dream is to purchase another motorcycle, in the near future.

With the KES 45,000 loan, she wants to service her motorcycle and purchase new spare parts. She decided to join Yehu because of its affordable interest rates.

loans.use: to service her motorcycle and purchase new spare parts.

loans.name: Jorge Luís

texts.es:
Jorge de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado de educación básica, es soltero y tiene 2 hijos una niña de 12 años y un joven de 15 años hijos que cuido desde muy pequeño ya que su esposa decidió abandonar el hogar y como todo un padre responsable para sus hijos ha sido su madre y su padre. Él menciona que estos jóvenes son quienes lo motivan a luchar cada día más para mejorar las condiciones de la familia. 
 
Jorge es motorista de buses que realizan viajes desde el cantón hasta la ciudad, tiene más de 8 años de trabajar realizando esta labor que le ha permitido llevar el sustento diario a su hijos; su hora de inicio de las labores es de las de 6:00 de la mañana con el primer viaje y a las cinco de la tarde que es el último. 

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar madera, clavos y laminas para la reparación del techo, así como mejorar las paredes de la vivienda.

Jorge lucha cada día para brindarle la mejor educación y condiciones de vida a sus hijos que son el motor que lo impulsa cada mañana a levantarse y trabajar para sacarlos adelante y se han personas de bien para la sociedad Salvadoreña.
texts.en:
Jorge, aged 30, studied up to third grade of primary education. He is single and has two children—a 12-year-old daughter and a 15-year-old son—whom he has been taking care of since they were very young because his wife decided to abandon their home. As any responsible parent, he has been a father and a mother to this children. He mentions that these children are who motivate him to work hard each day to improve the family's living conditions. 

Jorge is a bus driver who makes trips from the hamlet to the city. He has been following this occupation for over eight years, and this job has enabled him to provide for his children. He works from the beginning time of the first trip (6:00 a.m.) to the end time of the last trip (5:00 p.m.)

He is requesting a loan to buy timber, nails, and metal sheeting to repair the roof and improve the walls of his house.

Jorge works hard each day to provide his children with the best education and living conditions. His children are the driving force that compels him to get up every morning and go to work in order to get them ahead so that they become good citizens for the Salvadoran society.

loans.use: to buy timber, nails, and metal sheeting to repair the roof and improve the walls of his house.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in wood carvings. She would like to invest in tools and equipment for her workshop that would make her work more efficient. Rita has been selling through Novica since 2009. This is her story: "Having a passion for creating more designs inspires me, and I have taught this art to a number of people. The basic materials I use are sese wood and aluminium sheets. My favorite things in life are cooking and being with my family. I dream that we'll one day have enough so I can also give back to others. "This loan is greatly appreciated -- it will go a long way towards enhancing my business." Use the link below to view Rita's wood carvings on the Novica site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/7110

loans.use: to invest in workshop tools and equipment that would make her work more efficient

loans.name: Carmen Concepcion

texts.es: Carmen de 57 años de edad posee una tienda ubicada en su casa de habitación desde hace varios años, tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Carmen vive en casa propia con su hijo y sus tres nietos, ella quiere comprar más productos como sopas, huevos, leche, azúcar, arroz, golosinas, etc. todo por mayor por esa razón solicita un crédito y asi poder comprar lo dicho para obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Carmen is 57 years old and has been managing a store out of her home for several years. She has many customers as a result of the variety of products that she offers. With her sales, Carmen is able to cover some of the household expenses. She lives in her own home along with her son and her three grandchildren.

Carmen wants to buy more products such as soups, eggs, milk, sugar, rice, snack foods, and other items in bulk. This is why she is requesting this loan. As a result, she will be able to buy these products and generate better earnings.

loans.use: to buy soups, eggs, milk, sugar, rice, snack foods, and other products in bulk.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is 50 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. Marisa's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. 

Marisa restarted her fish vending business this year. She has now requested a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Marisa is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and, in the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Afiya

texts.en:
Afiya is 30-year-old lady from Dhupguri. She studied till 7th grade in village secondary school.  Now she is married and is a housewife. She is blessed with two children, one son and one daughter; they go to school, and they are in grade 6 and 3 respectively.  They live in their own house in East Dhangapara in Jalpaiguri district. 

Afiya's husband, 40-year-old Noor, has worked as a decorator for social events. He uses this business to generate an income to support his family. He started the business on his own initiative, following his innate creative abilities in the area of design and decoration. His customers request the decoration of weddings, children's birthday parties, religious and political gatherings, etc. He rents out chairs, tables, utensils, bedding, etc. Every day he works at his business so that he can achieve his goal to provide financial sustenance to his family. His greatest challenge is obtaining customers in his small village.

Currently his wife Afiya is applying for a Kiva loan; through their field partner BJS. She will use it to buy more decorative items like tablecloths, tables and chairs, mattresses, flower vases etc. She intends to decorate the furniture in her husband's small shop, which he runs from their house and rent it out. With this loan she plans to offer a higher quality lifestyle to her family.

She wants to reinvest the profit to further grow the business. Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase decorating materials for her husband's business.

loans.name: Tulobala

texts.en:
Tulobala is a 49-year-old housewife who lives with her husband, Ganapati. Both of them are illiterate but know to sign their name. Her husband is a farmer by trade. They have one son, who is in grade 12. Her husband usually sells the vegetables which are grown in his own land in the local village market but they have a scanty income, and that’s why they are leading a very hard life. The reason for choosing this business is only due to having their own land and a sound experience in the agricultural field. Now she and her husband plan to grow broad beans in their land. 

Thus Tulobala applied for a loan to BJS (Kiva’s partner). With the loan Tulobala wishes to buy bean seeds for cultivating broad beans in their own land to generate more income. 

She is confident that she will be able to grow her business. As she is living in a kaccha house (made of mud and straw) in Dhupguri, she wants to build a concrete house with the profit she will earn from her business. She also dreams her son will lead a very successful life with a good education. Tulobala is a woman with great enthusiasm and never wants to stop fighting for her family. She thanks Kiva and BJS for funding the loan.

loans.use: To purchase inputs to cultivate broad beans in her own land.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is married and works hard to support her family. She has had a candle making business in the Philippines for the past 14 years.

Gina has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials like cord, wax, etc. for her business.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials like cord, wax, etc. for her business

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 57 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. Marlyn has run a general store in the Philippines for the past 15 years. She sells a variety of items such as rice, diapers, detergent soap, cereals, chocolate drinks, milk, juice, beer, etc. 

Marlyn has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of items, such as rice, diapers, detergent soap, cereals, chocolate drinks, milk, juice, beer, etc., to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sanoka

texts.en:
Sanoka, aged  45 years, is an energetic housewife from a small village in Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district.  She lives with her three small school-going daughters and husband in their small kachha house (made of mud, bamboo and straw).  Her daughters are in grades 5, 4 and 1.

Sanoka’s husband is a farmer. He has been involved in this agricultural activity for many years.  He mainly cultivates paddy rice in his own farmland.  He has good knowledge of paddy cultivation. He wants to boost his agricultural business to strengthen his family's financial situation.

Sanoka heard that Kiva’s partner, BJS, gives small business loans to rural women and she has taken a loan to purchase paddy seeds and fertilizers. In order to strengthen her agricultural business, she plans to improve her strategy and make use of new farming techniques.

Her ambition is to enlarge her business for which she is struggling a lot.  She gives her hearty thanks to her lenders BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivation of paddy rice.

loans.name: Virgenia

texts.en:
Virgenia is 57 years old and married with five children. She has earned a living for the past four years by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from farming vegetables.

Virgenia is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Maria Flor

texts.en:
Maria Flor is 48 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. Maria Flor has been running a general store in the Philippines for the past three years. She earns additional income from raising pigs and farming vegetables.

Maria Flor has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has now requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. 

Maria Flor aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado de educación básica en la escuela de la comunidad;  está acompañado y esperan a su primer hijo viven en su casa propia.
 
Juan desde muy pequeño se ha dedicado al trabajo de la agricultura específicamente a la siembra de maíz y frijol labor que aprendió de sus padres, desde que se  acompaño hace un año junto con su compañera de vida decidieron colocar una pequeña tienda en la comunidad mientras él trabaja en el campo ella se encarga de vender en la casa los horarios de Juan en la agricultura son de 6:00 de la mañana hasta 12:00 del mediodía y la tienda está abierta al público desde las 6:00 de la mañana 6:00 pm    

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar insumos agrícolas como fórmula y sulfato para la cosecha de maíz y la otra parte  para comprar productos para la tienda como frijoles, azúcar, café y otros productos básicos.

Sus planes a futuro son mejorar su tienda para que le permita obtener mayores ingresos y en futuro mejorar su vivienda para brindarle a su esposa y a su primer hijo las mejores condiciones posibles para vivir.
texts.en:
Juan, 23, got a basic education up to third grade in the community school.  He's in a relationship and they're expecting their first child.  They live in their own home.

Juan has worked in agriculture from a very young age, specifically growing corn and beans, which he learned from his parents.  When he and his life partner got involved a year ago, they decided to start a small store in the community.  While he works in the field, she's responsible for the store at home.  Juan's schedule is from 6 in the morning until 12 noon, and the store's open to the public from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m.

The loan he's requesting is for buying agricultural inputs such as formula and sulfate for his corn crop.  He'll use another part to buy beans, sugar, coffee, and other basic products for the store.

Juan's plans for the future are to improve his store so he earns more income and to improve his home to give his wife and his first child the best possible living conditions.

loans.use: to buy formula and sulfate for his corn crop and basic products for his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in skirts, blouses, pants, skirts, undergarments, etc.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro de 35 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijas una de 6 meses y  la otra de 8 años de edad. Él es un hombre que se esfuerza cada día por dar lo mejor a su familia apoyado en su negocio de venta de dulces, la cual realiza en los buses de transporte colectivo desde hace 8 años. Pedro es una persona que no se deja vencer por los problemas y siempre busca la manera de salir adelante fue así como decidió vender dulces para sostener a su familia. Por lo anterior él solicita un crédito a FUSAI para seguir ampliando su negocio ya que al comprar las cajas él puede vender un poco más cómodo y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Pedro, 35 years old, lives in his own home together with his wife and their two daughters, one six months old and the other eight years old. He is a man who makes an effort each day to give the best to his family, supported by his business of selling sweets which he has carried out on public transportation buses for the last eight years. Pedro is a person who does not give up due to problems and he always searches for the way to get ahead. It was in this way that he decided to sell sweets to support his family. For the aforementioned, he requests a loan from FUSAI to continue expanding his business since by buying the boxes he can sell a little more comfortably and obtain better earnings.

loans.use: to invest in boxes of sweets.

loans.name: Marvin Humberto

texts.es:
Marvin de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado de educación básica, está acompañado y padre de una niña de 3 días de nacida, ellos viven en su casa propia.

 Marvin ha trabajado como auxiliar de limpieza en instituciones del estado, desde hace 6 años está trabajando para una empresa atunera ubicada en La Ciudad, en la cual desempeña el cargo de empacador de productos. El horario de trabajo es rotativo semanas trabaja en el día y otras semanas por las noches.           


El préstamo que está solicitando, es para finalizar con la construcción de la vivienda, comprara cemento, arena y ladrillo para el piso que este momento es de tierra. Esto le permitirá brindarle un mejor estilo de vida  a su familia.


En estos momentos Marvin y su esposa son la familia más feliz porque Dios les permitido ser padres de su primera hija y sobre todo que nació con buena salud; ellos saben que una responsabilidad muy grande que han recibido, pero el plan más fuerte a futuro es trabajar muy arduamente para sacar adelante a su hija y brindarle la mayor educación posible para entregarle a la sociedad una persona ejemplar.
texts.en:
Marvin is 24 years old, studied through sixth grade of primary school, is married, and is the father of a three-day-old daughter. They live in their own house.

Marvin has worked as a cleaning assistant in state institutions. For 6 years, he has been working for a tuna business located in the city, in which he performs the task of packing the products. His work schedule rotates between working in the morning some weeks and working at night in other weeks. 

The loan that is requested is to finish construction on his house. He will buy cement, sand, and brick for the floor, which, at the moment, is made of dirt. This will allow him to offer a better style of living to his family. 

At this time, Marvin and his wife are a very happy family because God has allowed them to become parents of their first daughter and above all, because their daughter was born in good health. They know that they have a very big responsibility, and their strongest plan for the future is to work very hard to go forward for their daughter and to offer her the best education possible to give society a model person.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and brick for his house's floor, which is currently made of dirt.

loans.name: Milenium Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Milenium está conformado por cuatro mujeres emprendedoras que tomaron la decisión de solicitar un crédito con la institución con el objetivo de incrementar su capital de trabajo y mejorar su forma de vida. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Yuniek quien es una mujer emprendedora y con ideas de superación, tiene la edad de 20 años, acompañada y madre de un hijo, su negocio es la venta de electrodomésticos. Negocio  que empezó con capital suministrado por su esposo quien le otorgo cinco mil córdobas teniendo actualmente un año de experiencia los comercializa en cofradía, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de plancha, arrocera, licuadora, DVD, etc. Los otros integrantes son María de 38 años de edad quien se dedica a la hecha y venta de tortillas en su domicilio desde hace cuatro años, la señora Yaris de 19 años tiene un negocio de venta de ropa usada y la vende en la comunidad donde vive, la señora Sebastiana de 31 años que también vende ropa usada en el norte del país y cofradía.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Milenium is made up of four entrepreneurial women who made the decision to request a loan from an institution with the objective of increasing their work capital and to improve their way of life. The group coordinator is Yuniek who is an entrepreneurial woman with plans to excel. She is 20 years old, married and mother to a son. Her business is the sale of household appliances.

This business started with capital supplied by her husband who provided her with five thousand Cordobas. She currently has one year of experience and sells them in Cofradia. 

She is requesting the loan to buy an iron, rice maker, blender, DVD player, etc. The other group members are Maria, 38 years old, who has earned a living making and selling tortillas in her home for four years. Yaris, 19 years old, has a used clothing business and sells them in the community where she lives. Sebastiana, 31 years old, also sells used clothing in the north of the country and in Cofradia.

loans.use: to buy household appliances.

loans.name: Dinora Del Carmen

texts.es: Dinora de 52 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus hijos. Ella es una mujer que desde hace 17 años se gana la vida vendiendo diversidad de productos de belleza por catalogo, en los cantones cercanos, lo que le ha permitido apoyar a la economía de su hogar. Para Dinora su negocio es una importante fuente de ingreso por lo que desea invertir en el, además desea invertir en ropa para ampliar su negocio y así obtener mejores ingresos, y es para ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: camisas, pantalones, ropa interior y productos de belleza.
texts.en: Dinora is 52 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and their children. She is a woman, who for 17 years, has made a living selling a diverse collection of beauty products by catalog in nearby areas. This activity has allowed her to support her household finances. For Dinora, her business is an important source of income, so she wants to invest in it. In addition, she wants to invest in clothing to grow her business and, thus, to obtain a better income. It is for this that she requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in shirts, pants, undergarments, and beauty products.

loans.use: to invest in shirts, pants, undergarments, and beauty products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a porcelain sink, cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to build a bathroom in her home.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is 59 years old and married with six children. Meriam works very hard to provide for them.

Meriam runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like rice, soft-drinks, canned goods, bread, snack foods, etc. to sell.

Meriam has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, soft-drinks, canned goods, bread, snack foods, etc. 

In the future, Meriam would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like rice, soft-drinks, canned goods, bread, snack foods, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Felipa is 45 years old and has three children who are in school.

Felipa has a general store business in the Philippines. Felipa requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Felipa has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Felipa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Aurelia is sixty two years old and has one child in school.

Aurelia's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her buy and sell charcoal and firewood business this year. She is committed to regain what she has lost. Aurelia is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Aurelia has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Aurelia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene has three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Arlene is twenty-eight years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Arlene's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her vegetables vending business and is committed to regain what she has lost. Arlene is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Arlene has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home.  In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 21-year-old university student, majoring in Historical Resources maintenance and management. He is in his third year. He is seeking to finish his studies and find a job in his field in the future. Because he doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en: Yousef is 25 years old. He lives with his family that consists of five members. His father is a retired man and his pension isn't enough to cover his children needs. Yousef works at a station in the evenings to be able to cover his study fees as he is a university student majoring in design. He is in his second year. Because he is currently facing financial problems, he has applied for this loan to be able to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en: Abdullah is a 21-year-old university student, majoring in Strength and Electric Machines. He is in his third year. He lives with his six family members in Irbid-Jordan. His aim is to finish his studies so that he will find a good job in his study field. Because he currently doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Almuntaser Bellah

texts.en: Almuntaser Bellah is a 21-year-old ambitious man living in Ajloun with his family. He is a student at university, majoring in Sport. He has been interested in sports since childhood. Almuntaser Bellah is seeking work in his field which he considers as one of his hobbies in the future. He is currently facing a financial crisis. Because of that, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela is twenty-four years old and has three children, who are in school.

Miguela and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Miguela is taking out a housing loan through NWTF amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Miguela has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to recover her fish vending business.

With your help, Miguela can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Bhanu Group

texts.en:
Tombi is a young and vibrant 24-year-old woman pictured with her hand raised with the other members of the group. She is the featured borrower of the group. Most of the group members are engaged in weaving, embroidery, and piggery businesses to earn their own income. 

Tombi has been weaving for six years now, and her skills are extraordinary. She could not continue further studies due to their family’s financial problems, and she decided to start weaving to earn income since then. “I started weaving for the hope to be self-reliant and not become the burden of my family,” she said. 

She lives with her widowed mother, four brothers, and two sisters. Since her father left them, they have been bearing the financial problems within the household. They were helpless, since they were all very young, and their mother, whose occupation was a cultivator, had been the mere provider for the family. 

Tombi weaves different designs of traditional shawls and wraparounds for selling purposes. With the small profit she made, she joined a local banking group referred to as a 'marup', which is formed among friends and known persons as a group. They pay a fixed amount monthly, and one person gets the total amount per month. When her turn comes, the money she receives is utilized for the household needs and for weaving production. 

Likewise, when the banking cycle ends, she will join in another group again. “This is a good idea for saving because the small profit that I made vanishes like flowing water if I do not join this,” she said. 

Now that she is thinking of marriage, she wanted to save more income for buying jewelry. It is mandatory for women of their tribe to take a set of jewelry to their new home. Those with no jewelry are not respected in their new home. 

The loan she applied for from Kiva will be used for buying more yarn to increase her production. She will join those in the local banking group with a greater amount, which will be sufficient enough to buy the required jewelry. “This will lighten my family’s responsibility in my marriage,” she says. “Thank you so much for the generosity I received.”

loans.use: to buy different textures of yarn for weaving so that she can weave beautiful traditional shawls and wraparounds for selling.

loans.name: Sumitra

texts.en:
Sumitra is a 47-year-old woman who is a married housewife and has one grown son. She lives with her husband Jitendra and son in their own house in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.  Both Sumitra and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names. They were unable to get an education because their parents could not afford it.

Sumitra's husband has a plot of land where he cultivates vegetables like potatoes, beans, gourds, cucumbers etc. Every day he works hard and enthusiastically tending to their crops with conviction so that he will have an excellent harvest as it is the way to generate more income.  His wife (Sumitra) also helps in this work. Now he wants to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers, seeds, pesticides and other items. They plan to grow paddy in their field as it’s a profitable crop in India. 

So Sumitra has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase seeds, fertilizers and insecticides. She hopes this new crop will enable them to obtain a greater income to get ahead and provide a greater opportunity in life, having a dignified home worthy of her family where her child can feel comfortable, educating her child so that in the future he is prepared for life.

Sumitra is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
Nelson de 42 años de edad, es soltero y estudio hasta cuarto grado de educación básica y por la situación económica difícil que vivía su familia decidió dejar los estudios y trabajar para ayudar a la familia con los ingresos económicos vive en su casa propia en la cual tiene una tienda.
 
Nelson anteriormente vivía en la Ciudad y desde hace cinco años volvió a su lugar de nacimiento ahí decidió colocar una pequeña tienda, la cual le ha permitido obtener los ingresos necesarios para los gastos que realiza en la tienda vende productos básicos como arroz, azúcar, frijoles y aceite. La tienda es abierta  desde las 6 de la mañana y la cierra a los 6:30 de la noche           

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar pan dulce, aceite, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, embutidos y otros productos para tener una mejor variedad para los clientes.  

Su plan a futuro es hacer crecer la tienda que le proporcione mejores ventas y por lo tanto mayores ingresos para continuar ahorrar y en un futuro no muy lejano mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Nelson is 42 years old, single and attended school until fourth grade.  Due to the difficult financial situation in which his family lived, he decided to leave school to work and help his family with the finances.  He lives in a home that he owns, in which he has a store.  Previously, Nelson lived in the city, but five years ago, he returned to his birthplace, where he decided to open his small store.  This store has allowed him to generate the necessary income for his expenses.  In his store, he sells basic goods such as rice, sugar, beans and oil.  The store is open from 6am and closes at 6:30pm.  

The loan that he is seeking will be used to purchase sweet bread, oil, rice, beans, sugar, sausages and other products to offer his customers a greater variety of goods.  His plan for the future is to expand his store so that he can increase his sales and increase his earnings so that he can continue saving to improve the store in the future.

loans.use: purchase sweet bread, oil, rice, beans, sugar, sausages and other products to have a better variety for his customers.

loans.name: Chhapeya

texts.en:
Chhapeya is a 48-year-old woman who lives in the village of Kalirhat, under Dhupguri, Jalpaiguri. She is a proud mother of two children who are studying in MA and grade 12. Her husband Abdul and Chhapeya both studied up to grade eight and despite their poor economic condition, they always try to continue the studies of their children.

For that reason, Chhapeya gives her time to help her husband in agricultural work after responsibly completing her household job. Chhapeya’s husband is involved in agricultural work.  He grows paddy on his farmland and sells it in the local market through a middle man at a bulk rate. There is a good demand for his paddy in the local market as well as the wholesale market. Abdul and Chhapeya wish to grow more paddy on their farmland but the only constraint is an insufficient flow of money.

That is why Chhapeya is asking for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase paddy seeds, fertilizers and other necessary products. The loan will help them to earn an additional income to reach their goals. With the increased earnings, they will be able to meet their basic essentials and plan for their children’s future.

Chhapeya gives her heartfelt thanks to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Mina

texts.en:
Mina is from Dhupguri. She is 40 years old and married to Abhinash, who is a 43-year-old blacksmith. Mina and her husband received education until grade 9. They have two children (one son and one daughter). One of her children is continuing his bachelor’s degree, and the other is in grade 9. They live in their own kachha house (made of wood, mud, and straw) in a village, West Magurmari, in Jalpaiguri district.

Mina’s husband is a blacksmith by profession. He has experience in this field. Mina's husband prepares different kinds of tools made of iron, such as hammers, nails, scythes, axes, sickles, knives, etc. He has a rented shop in their locality, where he works from dawn to dusk tirelessly and sells his tools to the local people and in the neighboring villages. Mina helps her husband after managing her household work. There is a great demand for their products in the locality.

Mina and her husband decided to take this loan from BJS to invest in their existing blacksmith business for purchasing raw materials such as iron etc. With the profit from this business, Mina wants to give her children a good education and a bright future. Mina is very much grateful to Kiva and BJS.

Mina is grateful to BJS as well as Kiva, who help people with low incomes to have decent jobs.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her husband's blacksmith business.

loans.name: Archana

texts.en:
Archana is a middle-aged woman of 36 years who not only handles all of the household chores successfully but also helps her husband with his agricultural work in the field. She lives in the village of West Magurmari in Dhupguri region under Jalpaiguri District with her husband and two children. 

Because of the family's low income,  Archana’s husband is not able to run their life smoothly and deserves more economic help. So Archana decided to take a loan from Kiva through BJS. She will use the loan to purchase broad bean seeds and fertilizers for cultivation of broad beans.

She thinks the business profit may help her to increase their monthly income sufficiently. Both of her children go to the nearby school and she faces difficulties meeting the expenditure of their school easily. The increased amount will also help her to fulfill her dream of educating her children properly.

She is a hardworking woman and wants to improve her economic condition with the help of the profit from the loan and support from BJS. 

She is thankful to her lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivation of broad beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick, and rebar to finish building his rammed-earth wall and a room in his house.

loans.name: Ma. Isabel

texts.en:
Ma. Isabel is thirty-three years old and married with five children who are in school.

Ma. Isabel and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Ma. Isabel is taking out a housing loan amounting to 10000 PHP to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Ma. Isabel has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. With your help, Ma. Isabel can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is fifty-seven years old and married with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rebecca's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her buy and sell firewood business and is committed to regain what was lost.

Rebecca is taking out a 9500 PHP Housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Rebecca has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is fifty-four years old and widowed with six children. Rosita works very hard to provide for them.

Rosita's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Rosita has restarted her buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Rosita has taken a 10000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her family home.

Rosita is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and, in the future, would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Dipali

texts.en:
Dipali is a 23-year-old housewife who lives with her husband Subodh. She is the mother of one young daughter; she is too small to go to school. 

By profession, her husband is a farmer. He grows different kinds of vegetables and sells them in the local market. Now she wishes to cultivate broad beans on her own land to generate more income. They have their own land and experience in the agricultural field; this is the reason for choosing this business. 

Dipali is confident that she will be able to grow her business, so she took a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to cultivate broad beans. 

She hopes she can improve her family’s financial status with the profit that would be generated by this new cultivation. She dreams to build a concrete house and buy more land later for her family with the outcome profit she would gain.

Dipali is thankful and grateful to BJS and Kiva for helping her to be self-sufficient.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers to cultivate broad beans.

loans.name: Mohamamd Jamal

texts.en: Mohammad Jamal is a 24-year-old man, living in Irbid, Jordan with his family that consists of four members. He is a university student majoring in Business Administration, which he believes will help in finding a good job after graduating.  He is in his last year. Mohammad Jamal is now applying for a loan that will help him to pay for his upcoming semester fees, because he doesn't have enough money to do so.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Kawthar

texts.en: Kawthar is a 56-year-old married lady, living with her family that consists of seven members. One of her sons is a 21-year-old, university student majoring in Accounting, and he is in his fourth year. His aim is to get his Bachelors so that he will be able to find a job with a better income.  Because Kawthar’s family has been facing financial problems recently, she has applied for this loan to help her son pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her son's upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 51 years old and married with five children.

Mercy is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Mercy requested a 12000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm. 

Mercy has been farming vegetables for thirty years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF and, more recently, Kiva to sustain it. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 47 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Virginia has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for twenty years. Virginia requested a 30000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Luzviminda works hard to support her family. She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Luzviminda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Luzviminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 57 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Her house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her fish vending and is committed to regain what she lost. Norma is taking out a PHP 10,000 Housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor. 

Norma has been with NWTF since 2013, in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Norma would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Esperanca

texts.en:
Esperanca lives in Suai and she is a businesswoman. She opened her business in 2011 with her working capital of USD 250. 

Now, Esperanca is applying for a loan of USD 1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop of second-hand clothes in the market. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more second-hand clothes, such as short skirts, long skirts, shorts, short-sleeved shirts, long-sleeved shirts, and other things to sell.  

Esperanca said she is still happy to do her business because every day she is earning a good income from selling her second-hand clothes. And with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she hopes to get good management of her business. She also has animals, like cows, pigs, and chickens.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Swapna

texts.en:
Swapna is a 25-year-old energetic and optimistic entrepreneur from Dhupguri who believes that hard work has its own reward. She is married and a mother of two children (one son and one daughter) who are students. She is married to Nandadulal, 41 years old.  He has a garment business.  
His garment business is running successfully but he needs more money to expand his business in a fruitful way. He is seeking help to secure his family and his children’s future. There Swapna stands for her husband to help him to grow his business in a wider manner. 

Swapna is taking a loan from Kiva through their field partner BJS. Their extra income will satisfy their family’s needs. Swapna’s first preference is her children's education. She wants to provide a better education for them for their bright future. 

She will use the loan to improve and expand her husband's business.  She aspires to construct a concrete-made house for them in the future with the profit from the business. She dreams that the extra income will improve their standard of living in the future.

She is thankful to her lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase garments for her husband's existing business.

loans.name: Madeline

texts.en:
Madeline is 48 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  She has a butcher shop business in the Philippines. Madeline requested a PHP 27,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy meat and dressed chicken for her butcher shop.

Madeline has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Madeline would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy meat and dressed chicken for her butcher shop.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria lives in Suai. She is married and has four children. Maria is a businesswoman, and has been involved in business activities since 2013, when she started with her own working capital of $180.  She is applying for a loan of USD 700 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop of clothes in the market. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more clothes such as shorts, pants, shirts, socks, tablecloths, jackets and other things to sell. She is earning a good income every day because she is selling in the center of the market with so many people interested in her clothes. She is very happy to do her business. With the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she hopes to improve her management for her business. She also has animals like cows, pig and chickens.

loans.use: to buy shorts, pants, shirts, socks, tablecloths, jackets and other things to sell.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Lucita works hard to support her family. She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Lucita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods, rice and other groceries.

Lucita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like snack foods, canned goods, rice and other groceries.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is 45 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Rubina has a jewelry business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of jewelry to offer for sale.

She has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Rubina would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of jewelry to offer for sale.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom, 34, lives in a small community of Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a tailor with the daily income of USD 3.00, on average. Her husband, Vorng, is a policeman with the daily income of USD 6.00, on average. This couple has two dependent children who are currently in school. Besides supporting her lovely children, she also has one younger brother who lives under her support. During this time, she is borrowing money to prepare a wedding party for her younger brother. Through this loan, she hopes that it can bring a real happiness for him. Last but not least, she would like to thank all the lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to prepare a wedding party.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel de 31 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos una niña de 3 años y un varón de 10 años de edad. Él es un hombre que se esfuerza cada día para dar lo mejor a sus hijos, por lo que todos los días se levanta desde muy temprano para salir a trabajar como transportista en una empresa cercana, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 12 años contando con una gran experiencia en su trabajo. Manuel tiene el deseo de construir un nuevo cuarto para la cocina, ya que la pared de este se encuentra deteriorada, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, hierro y mano de obra para construir un cuarto para la cocina en su vivienda.
texts.en: 31-year-old Manuel lives in his own house together with his two children: a three-year-old girl and a ten-year-old boy. He is a man who strives every day to give the best to his children, which is why he gets up very early every day in order to go to work as a driver at a nearby business. He has been doing this work for 12 years and has a lot of experience. Manuel wishes to build a new room for the kitchen, since the wall of the existing kitchen is deteriorated. This is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, brick, iron, and labour for building a room for the kitchen in his home.

loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, brick, iron, and labour for building a room for the kitchen in his home

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
For 35 years, Myrna has been engaged in fishing. This is the livelihood that allowed her to support the needs of her five children when they were still young. She is asking for a loan to buy a new engine for her fishing boat and fishing nets. 

Myrna hope that when this is available, she and her husband can do fishing better without any difficulty. Her income will provide healthy meals for them and savings for old age. Myrna is 63 years old, from Concepcion, Iloilo.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her boat and fishing nets.

loans.name: Malati

texts.en:
Malati is a young rural woman who lives with her husband and two children.  She was deprived of an education due to the poor economic resources of her family.  She is a 26-year-old homemaker who resides with her family in the small village of Kalirhat in the district of Jalpaiguri. Malati has one son and one daughter and they read in primary school in different classes.

Her husband is a 32-year-old farmer who is unassuming and hardworking. He learned to work the fields as a child. This has enabled him to make progress. He grows paddy and vegetables on his farmland. Malati helps her husband with his farm work, especially at the time of harvesting and selling the produce in the market.

In order to grow their agribusiness, they decided to grow more paddies on their farmland. Thus, Malati has sought a loan from BJS. With the support of this loan, she will buy agricultural supplies (seeds, chemical and organic fertilizers, pesticides, and other supplies). With these supplies, she will continue to care for her crops and she will get a better harvest, with which she can generate more income when she goes to sell her crops.

With her enterprising spirit, Malati wants to continue to strive to accomplish her dream of purchasing an irrigation pump, which will help her in farming.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa is 60 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Adelfa has requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

She has been in this business for four years. In the future, Adelfa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Kabita

texts.en:
Kabita, 32 years of age, lives in Dhupguri, in Jalpaiguri district. She has a small family comprised of her husband, one son and one daughter. Her son in grade four and her daughter is too young and is in grade one. She is married to Shyamal who is engaged in grill repair work.

To earn a living for the family, Kabita was required to practice livestock.  As she is not very much educated, she had no other option but to raise a cow and start a milk supply and milk products business. She is a very passionate dairy farmer, whose primary source of income is based on the sales of milk and dairy products (curd, ghee, paneer etc.), which she makes at her home.

Kabita is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase an additional dairy cow after evaluating the continual requirements for milk products in her locality. With this loan, she is purchasing a dairy cow. Having understood the market needs, she wants to increase her dairy farm in a modern manner with more animals so that she can diversify the farm’s products.

She is grateful to her kind lenders, those who extend their hands of assistance towards her to pull her from her past situation.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her milk and milk products business.

loans.name: Azizmoh

texts.ru:
Азизмох проживает в городе Душанбе-столица Таджикистана. Ей 57 лет. Она вдова. Азизмох вырастила четверых детей, двое сыновей и две дочки. Азизмох работает портнихой. Она научилась кроить и шить женские платья давно, и по сей день использует свои навыки на работе. Для нее это единственный источник дохода. Азизмох надеется еще на много лет останется в швейном бизнесе. 
  На данный момент Азизмоху срочно необходимо сделать ремонт дома. Но чтобы начать ремонт ей не хватает денег на стройматериалы и она просит кредит. Она нуждается в этом ремонте и будет стараться закончить строительные дела до прихода холодов.
texts.en:
Azizmoh lives in the city of Dushanbe, the capital of Tajikistan. She is 57 years old and a widow. Azizmoh has brought up four children: two sons and two daughters. She works as a seamstress. She learned how to cut and sew women's dresses a long time and still uses these skills in her work. This is her only source of income. Azizmoh hopes to remain in this business for many years.

At present Azizmoh needs to renovate her home. However, she lacks the money for construction supplies in order to start the renovations, and so she is applying for a loan. She  needs to get these renovations done and will make an effort to have everything completed before the cold weather starts.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies in order to renovate her home.

loans.name: Enkhdelger

texts.en: Mrs. Enkhdelger, 46 years old, lives with her husband and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband have been making and selling traditional Mongolian boots for more than 20 years. Their elder daughter also participates in the family business. Their younger daughter studies at university. Also, they have one son who is currently working in Korea on a labor contract. She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy leather, an important raw material for making boots, in large amounts, so that her family can make more boots, meaning an increase in income. The borrower is a very hardworking woman who wants to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy leather for making traditional Mongolian boots.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, brick, iron, metal sheets, and labour for building a grille railing and changing the roof

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheeting and beams and to pay for the labor.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Twelve years ago, Rosie and her husband started fishing to support their family. This livelihood provided food and school fees for her three children who are now grown. She is asking for a loan to further invest in her business. She will use it to buy fishing weights and fishing nets so they can fish and be productive to increase their income. Rosie works hard to save for the future and to buy a healthy diet for herself and her husband.

In the future, she would like to expand her business and live abundantly. Rosie and her family live in Concepcion, Iloilo.

loans.use: to buy fishing weights and fishing nets.

loans.name: Chamina

texts.en:
Twenty-three-year-old Chamina is a woman of courage and strength. She hails from Dhupguri. She is married with three children. They live in a small village in Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district, West Bengal. She has two sons and one daughter. All of her children are going to school and in grade six, grade five and in grade one, respectively.

Chamina's husband,  33-year-old Rabiul, is engaged in a livestock business.  His income is not sufficient for the family. So to help her husband financially, Chamina is involved in a milk supply business. She sells cow milk to her neighbors and is able to support her family and save for a secure future. However, this young, ambitious and energetic lady does not want to stop here; she wants to expand her business by selling milk products like butter, curd and cottage cheese.

So, Chamina seeks to take a loan from BJS to buy a new dairy cow. With the expansion of business, she is expecting an increase in her monthly income. With the increased income and savings, Chamina will be able to reach her goals which include constructing a new and better house and to provide further education to her children.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her existing milk supply business.

loans.name: Dariimaa

texts.en: Mrs. Dariimaa, 27 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been teaching English at the high school since 2013. Her husband works as repairman at an automobile repair shop. Their son stays at kindergarten. Recently, she and her husband began building garage on their land, but due to lack of cash, they didn't finish it on time. Now she is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as steel, bricks and planks in order to complete a garage building. The garage will save their car from freezing and polluting the atmosphere by preserving its quality.

loans.use: to buy building materials to complete a garage before winter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beams, metal sheeting, cement, and sand to repair the wall of her house.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is 48 years old and has a fishing business. She is married with five dependants between the ages of 5-18. 

Rubina and her husband work hard to provide for the needs of their children. She is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy plywood, adhesive and paint. This will allow her to repair her boat and have her business go smoothly thereafter.

Any income generated will be for the family's daily consumption and tuition fees for her children. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and be more successful.

loans.use: to buy plywood, adhesive and paint to repair her boat.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is 49 years old and married with one children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Juditha has previously borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending and hollow-block making businesses.

Juditha aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is 52 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Florencia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

Florencia has been raising livestock for ten years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Kulchhum

texts.en:
Kulchhum is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of two children (one son and one daughter). She is married to 58-year-old Chhapikul. They live in the small village of Kothapara in Jalpaiguri District. He is engaged in a wood business. So his income is insufficient to cover all the household expenses along with his children’s education costs.

Kulchhum is a homemaker. But to support her husband financially, she decided to cultivate paddy on their farmland as the crop is in high demand in the market. In order to purchase seeds, insecticides and pesticides, Kulchhum applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). This would help her to grow more crops, which will ultimately help in generating more income.

She aspires to construct a concrete-made house for them in the future and she wants to save money from her profit to fulfill her children’s dreams.

Kulchhum appreciates the help of her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Jina

texts.en:
Fishing is the most common livelihood for people in Concepcion, Iloilo. Jina is from this place and she is doing the same thing for an income. For the last 15 years, this has been her livelihood. She is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets and fishing weights. This will enable her to fish with ease together with her husband.

Jina is 44 years old, with two grown children and in the future she hopes to have another fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and fishing weights
